Reviews.Title: “Apart from location, not the best”
Reviews.Author: Siew Choy M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights with my wife in March 2012. We had an average stay. The best thing about the hotel was its location, right in the middle of downtown with lots of restaurants and shopping. It is also very close to all the major tourist locations in Sydney, such as the Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, Botannical Gardens, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, etc. All this is well within walking distance. The room and bathroom was quite new and elegant but a bit on the small side. Felt a bit cramped inside especially after having stayed at the Marriott with their enormous rooms. Didn't like the fact that there was no free Wifi in the rooms. Also, when I asked to borrow an adapter for one day, they wanted me to buy one for AUD$15. Surely there is no need for this. The Marriott gave me one free. The pool and jacuzzi on the roof are extremely small. At most only two people can swim at any one time. The view of the city from the rooftop is nice. This is a perfectly adequate place to stay and the art deco style of the building is nice. Apart from the location, however, nothing about the hotel stood out.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: wingriderAustralia
Reviews.Content: Another nice two night stay. This time we had a package that included buffet breakfast and late checkout. This was good value. The room was spacious and very clean. We really love the ambience of this hotel. The breakfasts were terrific. Normally, we would eat downstairs in the cafe. The buffet set us up for the day which suited us fine. The pub is a great place for a beer or pub meal! On a value for money basis this hotel is excellent. A renovation has started so I'd expect the prices to increase over time..... We did not use the pool or sauna/steam room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bobbali99
Reviews.Content: First time stayed at this hotel. It has an old world feel to it and when you read the history of the building in the foyer you see it was the original Grace Bros building in Sydney. Room I had was an excellent size, very well decorated and well layed out. Lighting was excellent and I very much enjoyed my two night stay. will definetly consider on return business to sydney. Location is very central and heaps of eating locations close buy. Staff friendly and efficient. Very clean and furniture new and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Grace Indeed”
Reviews.Author: Chris T
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at "The Grace" after booking as a "Mystery Deal" and could not have been happier. The Hotel was centrally located which allowed us to explore the city. We loved the beautiful art deco grace of the hotel. The room was stylish, roomy and comfortable. The staff was efficient and knowledgeable. Our only minor criticism was that our frig was not working and not fixed after us reporting the fault and our wine remained unchilled. We would certainly stay again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with character. Great location and ambience. Average Service”
Reviews.Author: christopher119
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to stay in this hotel for some time, and the opportunity came with a quick overnight trip to Sydney in early April 2012. I emailed the contact address from the website with a request for a room on the upper floors facing inwards as I'm a light sleeper. The Hotel emailed back and said they would do what they can. On arrival, I was greeted with a velvet rope barrier and had to wait there while the young chap tapped on his computer for a few moments. Once I was served it was all pretty standard, though I did have trouble understanding his European accent. I got the impression he was pretty proud of it, and didn't want to make too much effort to help people understand him. I was placed on the eleventh floor with a window looking in. I could not hear any street noise at all. The room itself was a King Deluxe, and as others have reviewed, it's a very pleasant experience. I found the room was thoughtfully laid out, particularly the work space for business travellers who need a desk, phone and work lamp. I don't even bother with in-room internet any more as it's just so outrageously expensive in Australian hotels, so I can't comment on that. I did notice a wireless network available. There's an Irish-themed pub downstairs with the usual authentic Irish refuse all over the walls, though it did have a pretty good atmosphere for a quick beer before dinner. For dinner I thought I'd try the in-house restaurant, but was met by a surly 'barrista' who was too busy for customers. I then tried the doorman, who was very helpful and sent me to an Italian restaurant around the corner. He was very courteous and helpful and knew his job. More hotels should have these types of older gents who know the area and know the clientele. As mentioned the room was very quiet until 4.30am when a very inconsiderate person slammed a door. That was it, and I just lay there for the next couple of hours. Breakfast was pretty good. I was seated quickly and the coffee came shortly after that. The selection was as good as you'd expect, and I had no complaints about the service or the food, only the very noisy people at the table next to me. Why do people think everyone wants to hear their conversation? Check out was prompt and uneventful. I'll probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, facilities variable”
Reviews.Author: maxie88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grace for one night, on business. It is an interesting building, being restored Art Deco. I had a king room which was spacious, and probably one of the recently renovated ones. It faced onto a busy street but was very quiet. The bed was too firm for me, but that's just personal choice. The bathroom had a large walk in shower only, but all clean and well appointed. ( I would expect a proper hairdrier rather than a small one bolted to the wall at these prices though). The staff at Reception were friendly and helpful, but at Breakfast there was inadequate service even though the restaurant wasn't busy. No-one offered tea or coffee, and there didn't appear to be espresso coffee available. Location is very central to shops, CBD and Chinatown. So overall a bit underwhelming, but worth trying if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “USEFUL LOCATION, GOOD SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: AGEDNOMAD
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Grace on all three of our visits to Australia over the past four years. It is not the most prepossessing venue on first acquaintance, being centrally situated within the city, thus lacking scenic views and being somewhat devoid of natural light, but the location is probably its greatest virtue.It is with easy walking distance of Darling Harbour, with its variety of restaurants, entertainment and shops, in one direction and the Queen Victoria Building, more shops, cafes, etc., in the other. Other locations within the CBD area, e.g. Sydney Tower and various shopping malls, are within a few minutes easy stroll, and Circular Quay is not too far away. If one enjoys Irish Pubs, P.J. O'Brien's is situated on the ground floor and provides decent pub grub as well as a good range of beers which can be charged to the room if desired. We found the concierge to be both very friendly and extremely helpful and our only real complaint was that the air-conditioning in the breakfast room was always set several degrees too low, even during our recent stay when the weather by any stretch could not have been described as hot. It is perhaps designed as more of a businessman's hotel than a tourist's but we have returned repeatedly as tourists because we like the place.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: writetomarlon
Reviews.Content: As a Sydney local and international traveller I decided it would be fun to spend 3 months testing out the Quality of Sydney hotels to help recommend the best we've got. Turns out the Grace is a fairly average offering. Location is Central, room service was actually quite good and the rooms comfortable enough. But there is much better out there! The Grace would do well to renovate into a modern take on Art Deco and attract a more modern crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AJ1570
Reviews.Content: I haven't been to Sydney for a long time so we thoroughly enjoyed staying at The Grace Hotel. Location is great for Darling Harbour, Rocks and Circular Quay, all walking distance. For shoppers, the QVB is just down the road. QVB great location for Cafes, breakfast etc, open early. I will stay here again, and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, expensive car parking !”
Reviews.Author: BradTen
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel online and got a really cheap rate, Hotel in good location within close walking proximity to darling harbour, hotel room really clean and all in working order, room service meals good quality and fairly priced. The only let down was the cost of the car parking, if staying multiple nights it really is expensive, we stayed 2 nights and it cost us $90 just to park our car. Staff all very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. I would return if I were able to secure a cheap room rate in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Graceful”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the grace in central Sydney for a week and found it to be really nice. It is an older hotel but very clean, has a great old world charm but modern and updated decor for our time. The hotel is very central which helps for getting around Sydney and the staff were fantastic. I'd stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but with flaws”
Reviews.Author: MarkDodgson
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, but there are some very irritating flaws in its service. The hotel itself has character, but the bedrooms, while clean and perfectly functional, are dull and featureless. The breakfasts are excellent. If you book make sure you do not have an adjoining room. I did and the connecting door might not have existed. I heard every cough from the person next door and really appreciated his choice of TV station at 4am. Apart from that disappointment there were 2 other sources of irritation. First, the cost of internet access. $25 a day is not a commercial rate. It is theft. Second, the charging of $100 a day against your credit card in case of incurred expenses. This says: we love you customer, and we really want to treat you well, but we don't trust you not to run off with the towels or steal something from the minibar. If you respect your customers, don't insult them.

Reviews.Title: “OK for business purposes”
Reviews.Author: NickB_47
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location - right in the middle of the CBD and close to the main shopping area - I had one of the neo-King rooms (large walki n shower with no bath) - room was fine as I was only there on business - woudl not have chosen to stay here if I was there on holiday as there are hotels that have far better views - my room overlooked a noisy street - good glazing so was not disturbed too much by street noise - staff very helpful - be aware that if this is your first trip to Australia that it is unlikely that you travel adapter will fit the electric socket and the hotel will charge you to buy one at $15

Reviews.Title: “Lovely refit”
Reviews.Author: Herman M
Reviews.Content: The Grace is an old hotel which has been very nicely modernized. Staff very helpful. And we loved not waiting more than 10 seconds for an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great People”
Reviews.Author: Mainetraveler5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grace Hotel for three days and loved it. The people at front desk and the Concierge were most helpful with directions and transportation. The Grace is one block away from George St so easy to catch the 555 free circular bus. The room was very large, bathroom as well. The local map that is available from the Concierge highlights all of the attractions nearby and makes getting around easy.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Historic House in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AnacoTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Grace is a richly furnished and decorated historic hotel in a wonderful location in downtown Sydney- it is just a short stroll to much entertainment, shopping and sightseeing. We had an attractively decorated medium sized room and bath. We had no view other than the light well in the middle of the building- but even outside rooms looked at other highrise buildings. The King bed and linens were of very good quality and the bath had excellent towels and toiletries. The TV featured more than 24 channels (a first in three weeks in Australia). Internet was a bit pricey and log on sometimes problamatic(why can't high end hotels provide good, complementary internet like most economy motels do?) . Breakfast buffet was very good although service was a bit spotty. Other service lapses included a relatively weak concierge service and some of our group had issues with room assingments- we did not. The Grace has much to recommend it but has needed improvements to approach a 5 score. (PX#9)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Inside and Out!”
Reviews.Author: AbirM
Reviews.Content: I only stayed in this hotel for 1 night, but thats all it took for me to fall in love with it. The service at the front desk was excellent, checking in was a breeze, and the bellhop was very friendly! The room was very spacious, with a king size bed, and floor to ceiling windows.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Sydney weekend”
Reviews.Author: gwerdna
Reviews.Content: Great looking building from the outside, comfortable hotel within. The room was a strange design but it was roomy, clean and quiet. The staff were friendly and the location was great. Right in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Close To CBD In Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Belinda62
Reviews.Content: Grace Hotel in Sydney we have stayed in many times and it remains the best. Close to Darling Harbour/The Rocks/CBD/Circluar Quay. Can be abit pricey but check on Expedia.com. Lovely large clean quiet rooms.Powerful showers.(Deluxe King -the best rooms) Great coffee downstairs and fabulous Irish Bar. Friendly staff who are helpful and good at helping with transport to the airport etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Armouree
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for work. We didn't drive so I can't comment on parking, but the hotel itself is stunning and great value. Service from all staff was top notch. Rooms and bathrooms are of a high standard and beds very comfortable. I was sharing a twin room and at no point did I feel cramped. The breakfasts were amazing and staff in the dining room very helpful in accommodating our very large group! The item is surrounded by great places to eat and drink and the QVB is just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place at right price”
Reviews.Author: craigsmithdc
Reviews.Content: With Sydney being one the most horrendously expensive places to get accomodation I have ever been, it can be a bit hit and miss with the mid-range hotels. The grace was anice change. with understated elegance and somewhat old school charm, this hotel is rated as 3 stars- I think it could easily pass as 4 and the service and amenities are good. well positioned and in good condition, I recomend to all who are not of royal bloodlines

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GRG
Reviews.Content: The Grace Hotel is located in the CBD and is perfect if you like being able to walk to the harbour, the Rocks, etc. The beauty of this hotel is its close proximity to everything you want to see and do, including star attractions, restaurants and street cafes, green spaces, shopping and transit to take you to Manly and Bondi beaches. The double deluxe room is large, the king-sized bed and pillows are extremely comfortable, the updated bathroom is spacious, and the art deco public ground floor attractive. Service is solid.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a central local”
Reviews.Author: Jean-in-Spain
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at The Grace Hotel and after a difficult start, we found the hotel to be very good. We were travelling with another couple, on a tour of Australia, and because we flew from Cairns to Sydney, we didn't arrive at the hotel until quite late in the afternoon. On our arrival we were told that we had been allocated rooms 909 and 536. Now, it was obvious that we were couples travelling together because our bookings were made under one reference. So why had we been given rooms 4 floors apart? We had made a request via our travel agent for "hight floors and kingsized beds". When we questioned why weren't allocated rooms together, both on high floors, we were told, quite bluntly that these were the only rooms left as the hotel was "very busy". Our friends had room 909, which they were happy with and which overlooked the street. However, room 536 faced onto the inner square of the hotel and looked directly into brick walls and the windows of other rooms. There was no natural light to speak of and the room was dark and claustrophobic. We went back to the reception immediately and complained. We were told that we could change rooms the next day and that if we left our luggage packed, the staff would move it for us. This was done and we moved to room 835, which was a very good room, with nice big windows, overlooking York Street. Had this been our room in the first instance, we would not have had cause to complain. The both our rooms were large and very comfortable. We had a walk in shower in our room, whilst room 909 had a bath with a shower attachment. We were all happy with the cleanliness and overall condition of both rooms. The breakfast at the Grace was excellent. There were lots of choices in both the continental and the cooked breakfast. There is a chef for "cooked to order" eggs and omelets and their honey yoghurt was to die for! The Grace Hotel itself is beautiful throughout and the only negative I would say is that it is a rather impersonal hotel. The staff are polite, but with the exception of the consierge team, not very friendly. The location of the hotel is very good, within 10 minutes walk of Darling Harbour, and probably only 15 or 20 minutes walk to Sydney Harbour. There are bars and restaurants close by and I would recommend PJ O'Brians Restaurant which is actually on the hotel complex. Very good food, lovely staff and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good large hotel, good location, decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Oliver M
Reviews.Content: This majestic old building is a great place to stay to discover Sydney. It's a short stroll (keep in mind that the city is not flat so a steep climb every now and then is to be expected) from the Aquarium and the waterfront restaurants. The breakfast buffet is good with a variety of fresh fruits and bakery items available. However there are juice and coffee bars virtually next doorif you preferwaking up in the city. The building itself is an old majestic tower which offers nice views from its top floor gym/spa. The rooms are decent and quite large although a bit old fashioned. The reception staff were friendly enough to make this stay an enjoyable one if you can get your hands on a cheap internet deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a couple of nights in the city”
Reviews.Author: princess3016
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grace for 3 nights during a conference, obtained a good rate inclusive of breakfast through wotif. The hotel is in a good location on york street, so 15 mins to Darling harbour, 5 mins to pitt street shops. The hotel is a heritage building in an art deco style. I stayed in a refurbished king room, which was spotlessly clean, however, the art deco style of the furnishings mean it could easily look tired in a year or two. The bathroom was pretty small for a 4 star hotel, with no bath and just a shower (although was a powerful shower which was good). The room overall was small, but is fine for a couple of nights, especially as I was travelling alone. The location of the room in the heart of the city does mean that there is a lot of street noise at night, so I did get woken up early with traffic noise. The other key drawback of the room was that the aircon was very loud, so you could not have it on when you are sleeping, making the room a bit stuffy. I used the hotel pool, which again was spotless, but you could not have more than two people in the pool doing laps. Hotel gym was small, but had bike, XT, rower, runner and some dumbells. The hotel breakfast was pretty standard for a 4 star with good hot and cold options and an egg chef. Overall, if you get a good rate for the hotel and are only staying for a couple of nights and are not bothered about the drawbacks I mentioned you will be fine. I do think that there are better options in the price range in Sydney though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dskwm_99
Reviews.Content: We arrived early (8am) after an exhausting previous night; we checked in hoping to be able to leave our bags somewhere secure at the hotel until our room was ready and were told we could access our room immediately which was a very pleasant bonus. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet (8th floor on a Sat night); exactly what you would expect from this standard of hotel. The hotel is centrally located in the CBD so is surrounded by shops and eateries. Buffet breakfast at the "Grace Brasserie" had good variety - again pretty much standard for the quality of hotel. Reception, concierge and restaurant staff were all helpful, friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “A happy surprise”
Reviews.Author: bid79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while in Sydney for work. I'd never thought of staying here before and this hotel as a lovely surprise. My room was very comfortable with everything I needed for a short stay. We normally stay at the Shangri la or the Intercon when in Sydney, and while this isnâ€™t as fancy, the service is just as good (if not better) and it is in a much better location. This hotel is really well located. It is a 5-10 minute walk to anywhere. That said, I think itâ€™d be a pain (and expensive) to have to park a car here. The staff were extremely pleasant and responsive: While staying here I needed to ask the advice of the concierge and they were extremely helpful and practical in their advice. And I realised after my first night that the air-conditioning in my room wasnâ€™t working â€“ I brought this to the staffâ€™s attention and it was fixed by the time I returned that day. Buffet breakfast was pretty good, although there is a strange arrangement where you need to tell the front desk the night before if you are going to have breakfast â€“ otherwise a higher price. Anyway, there is a very nice selection of fresh items and a man making eggs to order, and the bain maries are not overloaded by vast quantities of stuff no-one eats. my bathroom was a little tired, but very clean with nice toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that !!”
Reviews.Author: Ian190762
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel, found receptionist the blonde lady very unhelpful, we had booked 8 nights at this hotel, was told the room would not be ready until 3 on the afternoon, we went out by 12 o clock the room was ready, which was a large room with very sparse furniture, a bit dowdy and tired. We tried to pay for our stay but my card had been stopped by the bank because of the transaction amount, but if she had called through would have been honoured, she said it had been declined it hadn't ! We found his out after speaking to the bank and told her to retry it the next day.. She made us feel like we couldn't afford to be there !! So we shortened our trip checked out the next day and booked a villa in bondi ! The breakfast is good and staff in restaurant are very welcoming !!

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road business option”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Welsh-Boy
Reviews.Content: I'm often in Sydney for business and, per the handful of other Sydney hotels I've reviewed on tripadvisor, I try to stay I'm different places now and then to keep the travel a little interesting! From the outside, the grace is a beautiful building, only let down by the low rent feel of a few of the bars and shops they have in units on the ground floor of the building. For me at least, the feel you get when you walkinto the lobby pretty much sets the scene for your stay. The lobby and check in are nice enough and staff friendly, but nothing to write home about. Rooms all seem to have been recently refurbished and again, are nice enough, but aren't really any better or worse than most other places around the same price in the area. Breakfast is, guess what? Fine. Nothing special, as is the pub food downstairs. Although the little Asian place and coffee shop are both outstanding! Aside from noting the fact its not a marriot, hilton, sheraton, novatel etc has the benefit of making it feel at least a little it different to the norm, theres Not really a lot else to say, sorry. I've stayed here a dozen times and while I'm rarely disappointed with my room or stay, I'm never really looking forward to it either!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay for my 30th birthday”
Reviews.Author: cindy s
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2011 through a Wotif mystery booking. my first impression when walking into the lobby was breathtaking! Absolutely beautiful.....That was all ruined when I went to the front desk and greeted by a not so friendly member of the reception staff. It was like she was looking down on us for booking through Wotif??? Maybe i'm wrong but that's how it seemed.... Anyway, our room was on the 10th floor and very lovely. Lots of room and very relaxing. The bed was huge and quite comfy. The bathroom was quite compact but still nice. We ate at the restaurant the 1st night and it was delicious! We could have easily eaten somewhere the else the 2nd night but we enjoyed their food so much so we got room service!! Absolutely amazing

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Richo12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is something special. From the time that you walk through the front doors into the lobby you feel that you have been transported back to a bygone era. The whole ambience is great and is probably from the 50's or 60's. It is hard to realise that this used to be a department store!! I stayed there for 2 nights earlier this month and enjoyed the whole stay. The room was very comfortable - not large, but certainly good enough for 1 person. Breakfast was great - plenty of variety and it was being topped up all the time. It is in a great location - not far from the nearest train station or a short 15 minute walk to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in the city”
Reviews.Author: nitalo
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the grace hotel and it was a pleasant stay. The hotel is a bit old but I like it, it has character. The pool and gym on the top floor is disappointing - it's very small. There's not much on offer in terms of restaurants and shops inside the hotel but the location is so convenient you just have to walk around the corner and there are heaps of options for eating, drinking and shopping. If you stay on a sat night avoid the rooms facing the CBD hotel as it can get pretty noisy late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Art deco gracefully”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Grace Hotel again in Sydney this time for a 8 day stint. What a wonderful looking hotel, and this has to be a must for any Art Deco officiando's out there. Rooms are nice enough, but not ultra modern. Try not to get the rooms facing the inne core of the hotel as limited light and no view. Location in excellent and staff very respondent.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: so3003
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here as part of our honeymoon in January 2012. We booked it through Wotif and it turned out to be a good choice in Sydney, in terms of its location and price. We arrived from Sydney Airport thoroughly jetlagged, and despite being early the room was ready for us, which was good. It was a "superior" room (their lowest grade) and was generally fine, though we were slightly puzzled by the inclusion of a baby cot in the room (we don't have children and didn't request this), though it was removed the next day by the equally bemused hotel staff! The hotel is in a central location, a few minutes walk to the tube and walkable to the Rock's, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour (the closest to hotel) etc. The concierge provided some maps etc to help with our travels, and was also able to book a shuttle bus back to the airport at the end of our stay. It's worth doing this to get from SYD airport to the hotel incidentally - it cost less than half the price of a taxi for two of us to go by shuttle service. Our room was comfortable and (with the cot removed) spacious enough, though not enormous. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the room also had a good easy chair, workstation, tv, tea/coffee etc. The bathroom was smallish but functional, though I'd have preferred a full shower curtain to the half-length screen, but that's just personal preference. See photos for a better idea of room layout etc. We slept well all four nights (including weekend nights) and weren't troubled by any noise, though we had requested and got a high floor room which may have contributed to that. We visited the pool area one evening, on the roof. There's a lap pool and a jacuzzi, both of which were fine for one group but could be a bit crowded if there was more than two of you (or more than one group) there at a time. Not bad for a couple of minutes relaxing though. In summary this is a good choice of hotel if you need a base in Sydney (where even regular hotel rooms can cost the earth), with comfortable rooms, helpful staff, and a good central location close to tourist attractions and the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Always a favourite..”
Reviews.Author: Etoile76
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property a number of times over the past few years and it never disappoints. The rooms are well appointed and very spacious with a good mix between the classic look of the hotel with a new modern influence. The beds are really comfy which I find a must when traveling for work, and the staff are always friendly. Close to everything you need with readily available taxi's at the door when required. Look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: smallsFR
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel, great service, great location right in the heart of the city, big rooms and at a reasonable price. I can't really say much more. I would stay here again and recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantstic hotel but please do something about drunks from pub”
Reviews.Author: hungtydiner
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. boutique art deco with oodles of charm. Great city location minutes from trains and king street wharf. My stay was spoilt however by loud noise from surrounding irish and other pubs with drunk idiots making heaps of noise until 330am in the morning. I had to leave quickly next morning or i would have let hotel staff know. I am sure a lot of guests would complain. Not sure i would stay again unless pub noise addressed by management. left hotel very tired next morning and dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Characterful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrstrev
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here three times. This time room had shower but no bath but they upgraded us free of charge to one that did have bath on top floor. Unfortunately woke to find "balloon" of water behind wallpaper after night of torrential rain! Manager very apologetic. Ugraded to huge, super room with views to Darling Harbour and city. Plus bottle of wine as apology. Hotel building has fascinating history and many original features. Very central position for Darling Harbour and shops. Some nights streets are noisy -Sydney has it rowdies. Didn't bother me but disturbed my husband's sleep. Deals through Virgin Holidays don't include big buffet breakfast of free upgrades any more but most hotels seem to be cutting back. Coles supermarket nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: sljr16
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and willing to help us with any questions regarding transport, airport, local food places etc. The hotel itself is a beautiful building and the rooms are lovely and classy. Location is excellent, in between two train stations, close to QVB, town hall and the shopping precinct.

Reviews.Title: “Grace Hotel: Day 1 impression”
Reviews.Author: peapod33
Reviews.Content: After a 17 hour flight I checked into the Grace. It was about 10-15 minute cab ride (on a Sunday) from the airport. Very pretty building & lobby - as everyone mentioned. Very pleasant at desk - only thing is they didn't tell me how I would use the WiFi/ internet (did I need a log in?). As some mentioned, it is $25 bucks a day for WiFi - ouch. Concierge/ doormen/ bellhop were two guys working all aspects - super friendly. Up to room 739: pretty basic, but very clean. (see pics) King bed looks nice - mounted reading lights on each side. HUGE wardrobe with dresser inside. Usual ironing board & iron and a clothes brush (nice). Wardrobe lights up when you open it - nice touch. extra pillow and blanket in the wardrobe. Safe is a bit small - barely fit my mac book pro. Electric kettle & tea in room and mini bar where you fill out the form to take with you at check out. appears to be soda, beer, a few sweets. Outlet at desk for computer - you have to turn on the outlet. This hotel is an eco/ green hotel - you MUST put your key card in a slot by the door to turn on any lights/ air conditioning, etc. good desk light as well. Ok flat screen (I'm guessing 30"?) The hotel has all their info, guest messages, etc via the TV as well via a messaging system. I was worried b/c on the hotel info on the TV it seemed that there were only 5 TV channels - but there are more when you just surf through them. (I know nobody goes to Sydney for TV, but when jet lag hits!) Small sitting chair/ side TV and lamp - two big windows. not a great view though - some high rises on this side. Two large side tables with leather look on each side of the bed. lots of room. Alarm clock. Full length mirror. Bathroom: haven't tried yet but clean and spartan. Ok amount of room for supplies - but I have a lot of things. One of those attached hair dryers. HUGE shower, no tube in this room. Probably fit 4 people in the shower. No additional lock on the door - which I'm used to with American hotels. Just the one latch. I will try out the business center, pool and sauna later. Food: There is apparently 24/7 room service which I will try out & report on. As well as the Grace Brasserie and Cafe. I did go to the P. J. O Brien's right around the corner. Typical pub place - go up to the bar and order & pay and you get a number for your table. So Americans, don't expect to be seated:) Fish & chips were good, but nothing amazing. Service friendly. What's around? There is a HUGE row of shops one block down on George Street. Boutiques, Apple Store, Tourist places-- you name it. There is a pharmacy/ drug store almost right across York St. from the hotel - perfect for anything you forgot. Besides toiletries they have some candy, snacks, soda, water. There are a few corner shop/ bodegas around the corner as well. Getting around: There is apparently 1 block away on George St. in front of the Apple Store the "Free 555 Green Bus" - that goes in a loop for free to the Circular Quay. I will try out & report back. Lots of taxis always in front of the hotel too. To sum up for first impressions: friendly, great location, pretty lobby, clean but sparse rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco Magic”
Reviews.Author: Candi72
Reviews.Content: I returned back home to Sydney for a 3 night stay and wowser, the Grace Hotel certainly delivered. The location is absolutely fabulous with the QVB and Town Hall station one block away. All of the shopping in Pitt st Mall and Sydney Westfields is one block away as well. The hotel itself is art deco style and is classy and elegant. The room is a moderate size and the bathroom is well appointed with a shower over the bath. The view is of other city buildings but thats not a surprise. One big plus is that the hotel is super quiet and peaceful even though it is a decent size. No vacuum cleaners going off at 8am kinda thing.. The staff were super friendly and check in and out were a breeze. The concierge helped order us a maxi taxi for our luggage and surfboard and on our way we went. I would be back sooner but I cant get the awesome rate I got the first time so will keep an eye out for any specials.

Reviews.Title: “Great Art Deco Gem for Business or Pleasure Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maryland1Traveler
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised in a good way by this Art Deco downtown gem. First of all the architecture is really stunning if you like this period as much as I do. This was originally an office building and only fairly recently converted to a hotel. The breakfast upstairs is fabulous. The british style pub on the first floor is a great spot for a night cap. The fitness room and pool is a bit sparse (OK, really sparse) but put on your shoes and go for a run or walk outside in the Botanical Garden. I hosted a 70 person conference here and was very pleased with the facilities. I'd host a business meeting here again, or would recommend it for a holiday stay in the center city as well.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Art Deco”
Reviews.Author: StarliteAustralia
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a fantastic location. My room was well appointed. and as it faced the inner courtyard nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney CBD Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patrick026
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Grace Hotel on York Street Sydney. We like the central location of the hotel being minutes from the Pitt St Mall and just a 15 minute walk to Circular Quay or Darling Harbour. Rooms are fresh and comfortable with King size bed, nice bathroom and flat screen TV. The period decor in this nicely preserved Art Deco building is to our liking. The history of the old building is set out on the wall as you enter the lift lobby off the main entry....well worth taking a few minutes to read it and soak up the experience. Staff are friendly and the Concierge is always up for a chat and ever ready with useful tips on what to see and how to get there. Breakfast in the Brasserie is quite reasonably priced (AUD$18 for full English hot breakfast) and service is very good. Not much of a view from the rooms in this part of the city, however, the comfort and convenience factors coupled with a reasonable room tariff (we paid $207 / night) make this a great place to stay right in the heart of town.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: daniel b
Reviews.Content: First time staying in sydney city. The room was very neatly presented, very clean with a massive king bed! Had a nice view of the city. We were staying on the 7th floor. Very very nice for the money we paid for and is very close to george and pitt street. About 2 mins. Would stay here again any day!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pauline2795
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed and the Grace hotel and it didn't disappoint. It is a beautiful hotel with large comfortable rooms and modern bathrooms. There are five lifts in the building so you never have to wait very long for one. The location is ideal no matter where you want to go in the city and the on-site parking is a bargin. And an added bonus we were able to get a fantastic rate.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money - Grace tick the box”
Reviews.Author: BrettPetho
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Grace for 2 nights on a Wotif Deal booking (accom & breakfast). We stayed in a reently renovated room with walk in shower. Very clean, tidy and spacious rooms, king size bed very comfortable. Pleasantly quiet as well. Breakfast was plentiful, sevice very professional and friendly. Will stay there again. Excellent value for money based on other hotels within the area.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mumofharryandtoby
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. We got good rates which unfortunately haven't been repeated. Thorougjly recommend if the lower rates ever come up.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Art Deco Hotel in a heart of Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: 1_TravelAddict_1
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this beautiful Art-Deco hotel! We got a pretty good deal too! The location was perfect, 5 min walk from Westfield shopping centre and Hyde Park, 20 min away from Sydney opera house. It had lots of small pubs, eateries and bars nearby. The room was very tidy and nice. Very clean yet stylish decor. Bathroom was recently renovated (it didn't have a bath, just shower). Beds were very comfortable with good-quality sheets. Rooftop pool, sauna and steam room were great plus you got glimpses of city from that area. The only problem I had was loud noise on Fri and Sat night coming from neighbouring bars. I couldn't go to sleep for a while but I guess it is not hotel's fault. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelicious_J
Reviews.Content: To me a good hotel lies in its hygiene and cleanliness. The Grace Sydney scores well in the Cleanliness department. Its cleanliness is top notch. The hotel room is flawlessly clean and everything looks new and fresh! A perfect way to start a holiday. On top of that, the room is Spacious.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all!”
Reviews.Author: elmcphee
Reviews.Content: Had a great 2 night stay at the Grace last weekend. Quick and easy check in/out with limited parking available under the hotel ($45 overnight). Room was clean and tidy - no view but quiet and really good blockout curtains ensured you could have a little sleep in! The rooftop gym/pool area was well equiped with the treadmills etc overlooking the city skyline. Good location - short walk to all the entertainment/dining options of King Street Wharf. We booked via the entertainment book and felt the price was very reasonable for Sydney. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm With Modern Comfort”
Reviews.Author: dreamdestinations
Reviews.Content: Awesome landmark building. The only thing missing here was a water view. But for the price it was a winner and we will be pleased to stay here again if needed. My husband had a conference for 3 days at this hotel so I decided to check out the surrounding area. Within walking distance (I'm an avid walker) I was at shopping malls, George Street shops, Darling Harbour, Martin Place, Circular Quay, the Rocks and several museums....perfect! Our room was large with BIG windows and plenty of light. Very well maintained throughout....carpet/walls in excellant condition. The tiled bathroom had a shower/tub - no mold anywhere (a huge plus in my opinion). We also had coffee/tea makings (room service is pricey), a small refrigerator & in room safe. Nice wide hallways. The fitness center and spa is complete with sauna, whirlpools, indoor lap pool and an large terrace with lounges for sun and quiet. There is limited parking for cars but that wasn't a problem for us since we didn't find the need for one. The Grace cafe has a good variety of food items on their menu. WARNING:If you want American coffee (caramel macchiato or frappacino) find a Starbucks or MacDonalds!!! The Aussie specialty coffees are completely differant and served in tiny cups. The staff was friendly and helpful.....no complaints with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Travellers!”
Reviews.Author: maryloupoulson
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay as part of birthday gift from a fantastic friend! Very spacious, clean, deluxe room with 2 superbly comfortable king singe beds. Delightful art deco charm throughout. No street noise. Check-in staff, concierge most friendly and very helpful with restaurant information, magical appearance of taxi and luggage storage! Rooftop sunlounge, lap pool and gym facilities all fine. Location fantastic- very close to QVB-for breakfast-, pleasant walk to Wynyard Station, The Rocks, Circular Quay and Opera House (also Darling Harbour tho we didn't go there). Great value for money (extra10% disc for using Entertainment card) and would definitely stay there again - soon, I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Top Location - Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: danieltjames
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grace Hotel for 3 nights over New Year 2011 as part of a month long holiday touring Australia. Putting our stay into context, as we were staying over New Year the price was very high - however it still was decent value when compared to the increase in price at other hotels during the period. The hotel is ideally located - close to all the main attractions - an easy walk into the city centre, shops and main sights and a very short walk to Darling Harbour. That's almost where the good points end... check in was extremely painful - the 20 minute wait was unacceptable and it was only the reserved Englishman in me who's used to queuing that put up with it. The two others in front of me in the queue were less impressed. The room was as expected - pretty bland but acceptable. The large bathroom was clean with nice toiletries that were refreshed once during our three night stay. The wall mounted television was big but the reception on the few available channels was terrible. Not good enough. Overall, a relatively decent hotel, busy and bustling, nice location but there are better hotels in Sydney and if we were back in this great city, we'd stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: Fredndust
Reviews.Content: Was booked as part of a mystery flight weekend. Very well presented from the minute you walk through the door. Room was great but the real winner was the location it is central to everything and if you don't mind a walk you can get to everything on foot, circular quay harbor bridge, darling harbor and shopping even got an Irish bar on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tashii1
Reviews.Content: The building is old and charming, the lifts worked well and were fast. The room ws spacious and quiet. Good water pressure and heat in shower. Close walk to Pitt St Mall and Hyde Park. Don't park underneath if you are precious about handing over your keys. And if you want to go to the Rocks for breakfast, leave your car parked and walk or bus or taxi it - parking at the Rocks is a no go zone! Other places for breaky - level 5 in westfield Becasse for pastry and coffee. Collect your Sunday paper downstairs, there is no complimentary paper delivered to your door. Checkin and out was quick and easy. Overall a good stay, reasonable price for Sydney and we would stay again. I also recommend Jamie's Italian (yes, that's Jamie Oliver) 107 Pitt St for lunch/dinner - good food for reasonable price - no bookings taken.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location”
Reviews.Author: Catslave5
Reviews.Content: Great location - easy walk to everywhere - the Harbour, Rocks, Queen Vic Building, China town. Building is fantastic architecture and they have done a supurb job of refurb. Very strange bathrooms though, roomy but absolutely no where enough town rails - lots of space to fill there guys. I would also stay away from the coffee shop on corner of building. The service was terrible and the food unedible. All in all a good place to stay right in the heart of things.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Nicky W
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night at the end of our honeymoon but were really impressed with the standard of the room (very large!) and the friendly service at reception. The concierge service was unfortunately a little bit slow in the afternoon but they were still very friendly. Room service was fantastic and we really enjoyed our brief stay and would be happy to return. We were however surprised that we had to pay for the internet, but this seems to be the case in most hotels in Australia. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the Bridge and Circular Quay and is good for both tourists and business visitors. Attached to the hotel is a small bistro / cafe which we stopped at for a bite to eat before heading to the airport. Unfortunately this does not seem to provide the same level of service as the rest of the hotel, as they were very slow and were not very welcoming. The food, when it arrived was of a good quality, but we felt this did let the hotel down slightly. There are lots of other places to eat at near by e.g. the Rocks so this should not detract from your visit to a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hint of old time elegance..”
Reviews.Author: irobertson14
Reviews.Content: The public spaces reminds one of those hotels featured in old Chicago gangster movies, circa 1930, or perhaps even "la belle epoque" Paris. The history of the building is interesting and explained on wall panels in the lobby. The edifice is certainly of the Art Deco period. That being said, the room I had was facing on to the interior, void of direct sunlight and somewhat lacking in character but fine in every other respect.Tour bus/coach morning pick up times from this hotel was about 7.05 am which made for very rushed breakfasts, served only from 6.30 am. One morning I had a problem with the key to access my room a few minutes before I was due to be picked up. Full marks to the employee who arrived promptly to sort things out. The ground floor restaurant is pleasant enough without being a gastronomic treat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay with impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: Sydneylover89
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in between Christmas and new year 2011. From the moment we booked we knew this would be a fantastic stay, with the hotel calling before the arrival to follow up certain requests we noted such as parking. The premium room which we stayed in was newly renovated with lovely furniture and the bathroom was amazing with a rain/hand held shower and large bath tub. There was molten brown toiletries and complementary chocolates and water !! The bed was comfortable with goosedown pillows. We ordered food from the in room dining menu which was delicious and well worth the price. We were even happier when we were given complementary chocolate strawberries and Turkish delights. The hotel was quite, in a perfect location only a stroll to darling harbor and the main shopping district. I recommended the hotel before we even checked out to friends and ranted on how fantastic our stay was. Looking forward to our next stay already.

Reviews.Title: “EXcellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: peegee1
Reviews.Content: Right in the centre of the CBD, easy walk to Bridge and Opera House and shopping on your doorstep. Good service, good sized rooms. Breakfast was also very good. Great value for money given the location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Kayt83
Reviews.Content: The location is very good however I was quite disappointed with my stay at the Grace. My room was small but reasonably clean (although looking a little tired) but the real problem was the amount of noise - I was on one of the lower floors, near the conference rooms, and attendees at those conferences seemed to congregate outside my door during breaks in their conferences. The noise from staff cleaning and then setting up the meeting rooms was very disturbing, particularly as it was very early in the morning. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: espeesh
Reviews.Content: The Grace is a beautiful old building, very convenient location and extremely helpful staff. The rooms were small but very nice and clean. Breakfast daily was very good and offered plenty of options. The staff was wonderful, friendly, helpful efficient and made our stay very good. While there isn't free internet, the Apple store is very close and you can easily go in there and use the computers, no one seems to care. There are tons or shops and restaurants withing walking distance as well public transportation nearby. The location of this hotel, makes it a perfect place to stay while in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: lee1811027
Reviews.Content: We booked here after the Menzies where we usually stay, wanted 3 times the price over christmas! We will certainly stay again, staff gracious, rooms lovely, clean, beautiful linens and the best pillow selection we have ever had in a hotel. The art decor of the hotel is worth a visit in itself. Walking distance to everything! Like most hotels restaurants pricey but just around the corner is an Irish pub with very good and cheap food. We had an inside room, no view but would recommend asking for same as it was very very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is gracious at the Grace”
Reviews.Author: 058Lynn
Reviews.Content: Very nice sanctuary in the city...comfortable beds....very helpful concierge..nice people in the gift shop etc....but we loved their breakfast buffet...good food, many choices, nice surroundings..polite and gracious staff. Would we return and also advise others to stay there?? DEFINITELY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but be carefull if bookings are heavy.”
Reviews.Author: canddsyd
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff friendly but the disappointing part was that we had booked 3 king rooms and they were confirmed two days prior when I rang about parking as we were arriving late. During registration, no mention was made but when we went to the rooms, one had two beds instead of a king. Lodging a complaint, I was told no other rooms available due to heavy bookings. As two roms were kings on the same floor and the non king was on another floor, I feel we were "bumped" as we were late arrivals even though the rooms had been prepaid. A complaint was sent but the reply was no rooms could be guaranteed, which I found unbelievable since they had been confirmed two days prior.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good..”
Reviews.Author: Ewelinka87
Reviews.Content: Location is good....staffs are good and quick check in and check out.....room service man was friendLy...food was yummy...bed sheets are nice and bed were comfy Room is bit dark and gLoomy and very oLd room and very oLd interiorior....its kinda a sad room...nothing to see in our window...its just reaLLy tv show that made us happy. ToiLet was very bad in fLushing

Reviews.Title: “Solid performer for price”
Reviews.Author: Micah_Smith
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Grace for 4 nights whilst on a business trip in Sydney. Firstly the good, location is excellent for the price you pay. Easy walking distance to all Sydney CBD and Wynyard train station. Rooms are spacious and comfortable and its nice to get a decent sized bathroom. Secondly the not so good. A victim of its location it can be noisy if you are on a lower floor and on the outside room. Suffering a bit from jet lag I struggled to get to sleep as some road works were being done through the night. Also, on check in my card was swiped and I was told it didn't work so I handed over another. My credit card bill showed that it had worked but the hotel had no record of it. Hopefully I won't get charged for this but I didn't get a lot of sympathy or reassurance from the front desk. Finally having to pay for internet connectivity is a bit dated. Most other countries throw this in free so its a bit annoying to have to pay an extra $20 a day. In summary, good location and comfortable rooms given the price but this would rate a 3.5 if I could.

Reviews.Title: “My 3rd Wonderful Experience at Grace”
Reviews.Author: ksarosey1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed at the Grace Hotel three times now, and every time has been a wonderful experience that I cannot fault. The staff have always been friendly and professional, the rooms very clean and comfortable, and brilliant facilities (gym, spa, sauna, steam room and indoor heated pool etc). Nothing is a problem at the Grace. Looking forward to staying again next year!! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JCM81
Reviews.Content: My second visit to the Grace and both stays have been enjoyable and I cannot make a complaint apart from the fact there is a surcharge when paying by credit card - and who carries around cash to pay for accommodation??? Location is excellent with everything I needed in close proximity - definately my choice when staying in Sydney for business.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: InquisitiveTessa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grace based on tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. In fact, we had arrangements to stay at a different hotel in Sydney a month later at the end of our trip just to try something different (and 5-star). But we liked Grace so much that we cancelled our other reservations and booked the end with Grace before we left the first time. Spacious rooms, great bed, nice amenities, friendly and helpful staff...but best of all was the location. You really could walk from there to so many places in Sydney (great shopping, cafes, restaurants, botanical gardens, Darling Harbour, Sydney Harbour, The Rocks, ferries to Manly Beach, etc.) or you were a block or two away from the subway (to go to Bondi Beach, etc.). We couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in centre of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: DustyBillBrisbane
Reviews.Content: A hotel with atmosphere and style, the art deco look is mixed with modern rooms, comfortable beds, a great breakfast and a great central location. There is even a friendly Irish bar attached to relax and plan your next day's adventures with a good pint of the black stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Good business stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: RudiHefer
Reviews.Content: This is my first and last stay at the Grace hotel in Sydney. My review title does say that it's a good hotel and for the quality and size of my 10th floor room, I have to commend the overall standard. The staff in this hotel were particularly disappointing and both the restaurant for breakfast on the 2nd floor and the cafe in the lobby were disappointing to say the least. The breakfasat on the second floor was an average buffet and one section of the restaurant was tacky and looked as if a range of conference tables had been added to extend seating capacity. I had to see myself to my own seat and didn't have any wait staff offer tea/coffee/clean the table or remove dirty plate services. Overall experience was poor. I gave the cafe in the lobby an opportunity to redeem the Grace's breakfast standards and I have to admit, again, the food quality was average with my poached eggs overdone, serive non existant and cleanliness and atmosphere of the cafe lacking overall. Sydney is way to competative market to not delight a captive breakfast audience and as a business traveller, the convenience of having good breakfasrrt facilities is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in the heart of Sydney's CBD”
Reviews.Author: MikeB92
Reviews.Content: The Grace is a nice and classy hotel in the centre of Sydney's Central Business District. It is in an excellent location to explore the city including all highlights like Circular Quay with the Opera House and Darling Harbour. Public transportation is also very close so getting to Manly or Bondi Beach is very easy. The hotel itself is quite nice. I am not sure it is a 4/5 star hotel as the rooms are not very special and maybe even a little outdated. Also wireless internet is way too expensive. But all and all I have the say we had a very nice stay at this hotel. WIth regards to value for money, all hotels in the CDB are pretty costly so I think this hotel is quite good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BigBruv
Reviews.Content: The room was tastefully furnished and a good size and very clean. Handy location right in the middle of the city with everything in walking distance. Darling harbour 5 mins walk and Circular key 15 mins max. Service was excellent and the conceirge extremley helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: freedombird
Reviews.Content: The Grace Hotel is an elegant reminder of times past and I love the art deco styling. The rooms are small but perfectly adequate with very comfy beds, large televisions and individually controlled air conditioning. The shower was fabulous- large, great pressure and temperature. In a great location close to shops, trains, Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. They quoted their cheapest rate when I rang which matched wotif. They have parking available though you need to check before you arrive as they can fill up (parking Plaza park entrance Clarence Street). I also found the rooms to be very quiet which made it easy to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LaraH19
Reviews.Content: The Grace Hotel is ideally positioned for any city activity. Walk one way to the city centre, another to Circular Quay, and the opposite to the Rocks. Found the staff all very customer focused, willing to assist whether requesting room service, at the buffet, and at reception. Our room was clean and well appointed, and the room staff came and went while we were out sightseeing, regardless of when we left, the room was always ready for us on our return. Will definately book here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rostodd
Reviews.Content: The Grace hotel was a lovely place to stay, the decor was beautiful and the staff and service was excellent. Very convenient location in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “november 2011”
Reviews.Author: Keith C
Reviews.Content: Just today returned to Brizvegas from conference at the Grace in Sydney. Had read mixed reviews on service, but record my own experience of service as without complaint. In fact every member of staff was solicitous and helpful without being intrusive. I have never had better anywhere in the world at any price. The hotel is extremely well located for getting moment to moment conveniences as well as close access to shopping, the monorail and Darling Harbour, and affects a thematic coherence of the art deco period which provides a specially pleasing ambiance. Highly recommend for price, quality and great professional service from all staff with whom I had interaction.

Reviews.Title: “graceful art deco hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenTamworth
Reviews.Content: A lovely old art deco building with large up to date rooms, very comfortable beds and a central city location. A big bonus was the helpful staff especially in the Grace Cafe. Annoush our waiter was both friendly and helpful, his knowledge of the wine list and suggested wine was spot on. A lovely short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Penultim8
Reviews.Content: This was another wotif mystery hotel. The location is ideal for getting around the city with good access to both trains and buses. I stayed here for the City to Surf, so the start line was right around the corner. It's clean and tidy, nothing flash. The bed was very comfortable with great linen. My windows faced the corner of York and King Street. It was loud on the Saturday night, but did not disrupt my sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great character hotel, spoiled only by the inconsistent service.”
Reviews.Author: Alex C
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at the Grace recently on the recommendation of a colleague. It's a lovely old art deco style building in the heart of the CBD in Sydney, close to all the usual tourist and shopping traps, so very easy to get around from there. The room was good, though a little smaller than expected. Facilities are also good, including a pool, gym and spa on the top floor. The restaurant was the let-down - poor quality food and shoddy service. If you can live without eating on the premises then the Grace can be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: guampanda
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location near Queen Victoria Building. Concierge was extremely helpful - booked us last-minute tickets to High Tea at the Sydney Opera House, dinner at the Tower Restaurant, and other local reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelloMocha
Reviews.Content: This is a great 4 star hotel.Its not very luxurious but its not dodgey either. If you want something clean and tidy, thats still nice this is the place for you. This is not for you if you want luxury of 5 star, nor does it cost as much as a 5 star hotel. So for what it is, its good enough. The buffet breakfast is OK. There are no pancakes , but you get toasts with different spreads, some pastries, eggs, fruit and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Noel D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Grace on 2 nights last week & found it to be very comfortable. On the first night I was upgraded to a mini suite, the second night was in a King. Both were well equipped, very clean rooms. A few small niggles -- I asked for still water with my evening meal & was charged $6 for a small bottle. I ordered breakfast for between 6 & 6.15 -- it arrived at 6.20 which meant I could not eat much before I had to leave for an appointment. At about $25 for a "continental" breakfast I was a bit peeved, it was not value for money either. The buffet on the second morning was excellent, but still expensive. My rooms were both on the inside of the building & were very quiet. On the first night my A/C shut down early morning so I woke boiling & had to grope around, half asleep to re-set it. Staff were friendly & efficient. So, yes I would go back, but I think there are alternatives with better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: hay_renay
Reviews.Content: Great location for the weekend, if you can get a good rate then it is worth it. I'm a very heavy sleeper and our aircon broke during the night, it was hot in the room. I woke up feeling so sick and dehydrated. The rooms are very tiny but they are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: koalaking
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights there and have just got around to writing this review. I would like to start be saying the front dest staff seemed nice and efficient. I liked the history of the building and it was not too bad from an appearance point of view. The room was clean but small my main complaints where with the Internet. I needed wifi to send business emails while on my stay and I just bought the iPad with me for convenience sake. I was very disappointed to have to pay $25 a night for the privilege of Internet which is standard in most 4-5 star hotels all around the world for free, even mc donalds around the corner had it as a free service. Anyway, I tried to set it up but I couldn't get a signal. I rang front desk and they sent their tech guy up, he couldn't get it working, said he would be back and I never saw him again. After waiting over an hour I told them what happened and they sent 2 guys up this time, both struggling with English so it was hard to make myself understood. They tried at one point to connect with the phone line but gave that up after I said iPads aren't wired that way. I knew at that point I was in trouble. They proceeded to walk off in defeat but didn't come back either. So, no wifi as I gave up, at least I saved myself $100. My next gripe was something I had read about while reading the reviews of the hotel, this was the sound levels from the street below. 2 Biggs in. Row I was woken up by sirens and car noise as well as the noise coming from the pub across the road. It is hard to believe they didn't design it with double glazing. On the positive side, it is quite central and the doorman was superb addressing me by name and always pleasant. As I travel alot OS I still find this hotel lacking in many areas especially for the price compared to others I frequent. I would like to say that after leaving my charger there, I rang them and asked if they could post it back to me, they told me the postal rates and I said that considering the poor effort with the Internet maybe they could consider wavering the few dollars postage and send it up to me in the name of good service. They did indeed! Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Sazzar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grace for 4 nights for business/family trip. The Grace's location is so central with everything within walking distance. The building is a classic, maintaining its history through the decor and lighting, giving it a nice welcoming feeling. Unfortunately, the same couldn't be said for the doorman whom we only spotted once during our stay. Upon arrival, we were given our room promptly, however, the concierge did not take our bags to our room despite having an 8 week old baby in our arms. My husband was left to take our two suitcases, backpack and baby bag while unoccupied staff members did not offer to help. Our room was comfortable and clean with a very nice bed. The shower was brilliant with a great flow of hot water. If you're after a view, then this is not the hotel to go to. We had an internal facing window which offered very little. We ordered room service a few times. Food was prompt, plentiful and tasty. However, it's probably best to wander down to the cafe on the ground floor to get a wider range of food at cheaper prices. They do offer takeaway! Room service staff were friendly and cleaned the basics well, though didn't replace the sheets in our baby's cot which was a little disappointing considering the mess babies make. The range of amenities was great. It was so helpful to have a guest laundry with the amount of washing a family has to do. Though $8 to use the machine per load is a little steep. The gym is reasonably equipped and the lap pool is a great idea though could be cleaned a little more often. WiFi is available, but at $11 per hour or $23 per day, I think most people would pass. It's disappointing that Internet access is treated as a luxury in hotels like this one. Our checkout experience was fantastic. The concierge of the day was very helpful in getting us a taxi with a baby seat and helped us all the way to the taxi. It was greatly appreciated. Overall, this hotel has the potential to be something outstanding. Unfortunately, it's let down by a number of niggles that could easily be rectified.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful business travel accommodation”
Reviews.Author: goldie01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grace approx. 20 times in the last 3 years, always for business. The building is beautifully art deco and in a great location, easy 5 minute walk to waterfront restaurant strips and just a half a block from the Queen Victoria Building and other shopping hot spots. Check in is fast, the rooms are quiet, tastefully appointed and I have never had a bad night sleep. The kings beds are so comfortable and the pillows good quality. The staff are friendly, efficient and extremely helpful. I highly recommend this beautiful building as a must see on any trip to Sydney and will continue to stay there for business travel as long as the standard remains so high. The cafe is fine for breakfast or a quick dinner and there are pubs and other dining options within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “lovely art deco hotel”
Reviews.Author: hils_pink
Reviews.Content: we spend 4 nights here in oct 2011, and had a lovely time. the lobby was beautiful art deco era, and staff were good. the room was smallish but very clean, and the beds were fantastic! i slept so well. the breakfast in the cafe wasvpretty avarage, room service which we got twice was fine pool was clean and quite. the beds were awesom!

Reviews.Title: “Strictly for Art Deco fans”
Reviews.Author: wandring1
Reviews.Content: If you love art deco, you will appreciate the furnishings at The Grace. Nice chandeliers and sconces just like in the 1930s. For everyone else, the rooms are getting a bit tired. This hotel is a Sydney institution that just refuses to give up. If you absolutely must stay in the middle of the CBD, this hotel will serve the purpose. As another reviewer remarked, the heavy drapes are a highlight. The hotel service and eating areas approach average. There is plenty of retail action and cafes around during the day but not much available at night. An Irish pub on the corner is the saving grace. Or head west 500m to the footbridge and monorail over to Darling Harbour- a much better area to stay for tourism, entertainment and restaurants. And you might even find a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Heron2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We stayed in a Neo King room which was spacious and bright. The Grace Hotel is in an Art Deco building harking back to the thirties. The Grace Hotel is in a great location for shopping and access to Sydney CBD activities. We enjoyed breakfast and also dinner where we attended a Malaysian buffet of authentic dishes. Overall the grace Hotel provided a relaxing and luxurious stay in Sydney without the pretensions of other Hotels in the area. We would definateley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “totally awesome”
Reviews.Author: rabbit8025
Reviews.Content: stayed 6nights at the grace awesome service, tidy and clean everyone very helpful, would stay there again without a doubt, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Grace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cozzie245
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at The Grace for a week at the end of September 2011. The rooms were nicely laid out and the hotel decor very exquisite. The breakfast meals were excellent and plentiful with a varied selection of choices. The staff were very polite and courteous and Mike and Shaun on Concierge were very knowledgeable on any subject we needed help with.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms but hotel service average”
Reviews.Author: storm_fan1998
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed there for one night and asked for two single king beds in the room. When we checked in the reception staff were polite but not exactly friendly. When we went up to the room there was only one bed in it. After 3 phone callls back to reception and messages left with a promise that "someone would look into it and call us back", we finally got two staff up to the room after 30 mins of waiting. We had breakfast in the cafe down at reception and the breakfast was good but once again the staff were not that friendly. Location wise - it is a short walking distance to the nearest train station and there are a couple of good bars close by although the Irish pub below the hotel was full of drunk irish twenty somethings. All in all I probably would give the hotel another go but it is not one that I would definitely want to go back to in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Grace Hotel for a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Snudgie
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in a deluxe twin room (no. 415), over for the NRL Grand Final. A great central location easy walking to Darling Harbour, the Casino and the rest of the CDB. One block from Wynyard Station (airport train route, 22 minutes). The breakfast in the hotel is superb and will set anyone up for the day, ask for an omelette (made to order). We frequented the Irish bar on the ground floor great meals and a good price, recommend the lamb shanks, the meat just fell off the bone. The room was a good size. Ironing board, iron, in room safe all the essentials are there and three fox sports channels to chose from. Only slight problem is the early morning buses out on the street but not to off putting. The room had an impressive bathroom with a deep bath, spotlessly clean. The staff we encountered were all very pleasant and eager to help. Iâ€™ll definitely be staying he next time Iâ€™m in Sydney. Grand Hotel and well worth the dollars, Thanks Grace Hotel for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Cohunagirl
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in hundreds of hotels, but this place was the best so far. The rooms were quiet, heavy drapes to keep out the light, extremely courteous staff, comfortable bed, great recreation facilities. Great location. We got caught in the rain and had no warm clothes to put on, I rang guest services to ask if they had robes, within a couple of minutes they were at the door with freshly warmed robes. Love those little touches.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Rooms, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Trouvailler
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days in The Grace Hotel in Sydney in July 2011 accompanied by my wife and infant child. The staff was very helpful and efficient while the hotel itself was beautifully maintained. The location is fantastic - corner of York and King street and walking distance to the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Circular Quays, etc. Some memorable experiences: * The concierge (head by Troy) is well geared for infant needs. They even had a spare pushchair to borrow when my wife forgot ours with relatives in Melbourne. * The Indian chef would bring our baby his favourite strawberry yoghurt despite it being not on the breakfast menu. A spicy coriander omlette with freshly ground chilly sauce went down well with the parents, too. * The receptionist was from good old Blighty and could fully understand my excitement of being in warmer climates :) * The room service guys were more than happy to heat and serve a curry from Coles when their own curry chef was away one night. * A couple of minor negatives: a) They can introduce free wireless in the rooms. b) Some F&B trainee tried her best to make me sign multiple breakfast vouchers but it was sorted at check-out. Overall, a very good experience. Its on the top of our list when we return to Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Third Visit and would go back again”
Reviews.Author: Kel69g
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Grace now three times, and have never had a problem. I have always found the rooms to be well kept, clean and the staff to be very professional. We normally have breakfast in the cafe in the foyer and the food and service has always been of a high standard. The motel is close to everything, would gladly stay there abain

Reviews.Title: “Central, spacious and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Hawks2008
Reviews.Content: I had often admired the exterior of The Grace Hotel in central Sydney. When a super-duper Wot If deal provided the impetus to try it on an overnight trip, I could admire the interior too. All dealings with staff were pleasant, my room on the third floor felt like it could be noisy, overlooking a busy city street, but it was quiet and restful. Notably spacious for a "standard" hotel room, it had everything required for a comfortable night. I enjoyed pleasant (if not outstanding) room service dinner, and a particularly good deal on a flawless breakfast buffet - full buffet for $22 if paid on check in. Highly recommended, including eggs cooked to order and all the trimmings. The provision of a guest laundry ($8 for wash and $8 for dry, laundry tubs free) is excellent, too often hotels do not make this provision which is a pain in the neck. The room was attractive, clean and the beds comfortable. The location could not be more central, only a block from the Pitt St Mall. I highly recommend The Grace and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, terrible service!”
