Reviews.Author: captain_fatgut5
Reviews.Content: Checked in, arrived at WRONG room, called front desk, repeatedly NO ANSWER. Concierge arranged room error to be corrected. Day One, room not made up until 3:30pm. Day two; had to call for room to be made up at 3:30pm, towels not refreshed despite old towels left on floor. Left hotel for room to be cleaned, returned to find room service had taken spare key. Rang front desk, lodged complaint about poor service, "No problems Mr Stevens, we will send some keys straight up"...2 hours later guess what? Went to dinner, asked for new keys to be ready on our return. Manager greeted us after dinner and apologised, said that a letter and a gift was awaiting us in our room. Arrived at room, nothing, cheese platter and wine turned up 30 minutes later. Room, decor and ammenities .... 5 star! Customer service...Fawlty Towers!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dreamtime_2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights the rooms are a good size, and one feature I particularly liked was that the shower was not over a bath and it was a good height (not sure if all the rooms are like this i.e. no bath and don't remember this being the case when I stayed a few years ago). Hotel location is convenient - close to shopping area and offices while at night Darling Harbour is not far which offers a wide selection of restaurants for dinner. Had breakfast in the cafe on the ground floor both mornings and it was good value (compared to similar hotels), as a result of that it was busy and service was somewhat slow. If you get in before the it gets busy it is ok. Only negative was that the bins hadn't been emptied from whoever stayed in the room previously. For the price could include limited internet access rather than charging additional. Check in/check out was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, shame about the soundproofing...”
Reviews.Author: LondonGabrielle
Reviews.Content: 3 sleepness nights thanks to loud tv's in the next room, traffic noise from below and banging doors from early tour group departures. Tired looking lobby but niceish rooms. Not impressed with $25 a day wireless fee, and $45 overnight parking fee. That being said, if you are willing to pay for an overpriced breakfast, the internet comes free in the cafe below. Fairly decent room service menu.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location for reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: Krissi55
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through wotif for a really good price and were satisfied with it. It was just for one night as stopover but the rooms are quite big, the bed very comfortable. And we were so glad as we already arrived at 6am in the morning from a long flight and were able to check in directly! The hotel is really central, close to shopping malls and also other central sights, you can do everything by walking.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location to shops, restaurants and transport”
Reviews.Author: LeonieLordHoweIsland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Friday and Saturday night after booking mystery hotel on Wotif. Check in was easy and as I was in a rush due to late arrival of plane I asked the attendent to confirm that the restaurant I was going to in King Street wharf was left and left out of the hotel. He had to google it and then told me I would need to catch a taxi! Anyway after dropping my bags in the room went the 150 metres down the road to KSW. Room was on the 9th floor outside so good view of the cityscape. Room had very good supplies of anything you would need and was neat and tidy with the bed being very comfortable. Unfortunately the two long black hairs I found in the bathroom, one of which was still there when I left although I had placed them in obvious view on the side of the bath, was disconcerting. I disagree with the high cost of wifi internet in the hotel and was unimpressed when it kept logging out, using up the time. Hotel is in a very busy part of the city but there was no problem with noise from the many bars etc nearby. Hotel overall was impressive and I would stay again. It was a very easy to walk to Queen Victoria Building and then train to the Airport. at a cost of $15 and only about 20 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything with great room service!”
Reviews.Author: HD8386
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time my husband and I have stayed at The Grace Hotel, and it won't be our last. The rooms are clean and surprisingly spacious; the bed and pillows are ultra comfortable, and despite being in the middle of the CBD, this hotel is pleasantly quiet. The room service menu is very good value for money, and the food is delicious. My only gripes are that on two occasions of our last visit, by the time the food arrived, it wasn't hot, and was only lukewarm. The Full Breakfast is very good though, and there was more than enough food to share one breakfast between two people. My other complaint is with the bathrooms - satin shower curtains that billow out and refuse to stick to the side of the bath are really annoying, and result in torrents of water ending up on the bathroom floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice art deco”
Reviews.Author: Chris K
Reviews.Content: We booked through Wotif mystery and got a very good rate of 130 per night. Wanted to arrive early due to a flight change and they said we had to pay 200 for the previous night. This was a bit over-the-top as we arrived at 7.30 and checkout was supposedly 10.00. The girl on the desk did not have good people skills. The 'take it or leave it' type. The hotel itself has a lovely art deco feel with lots of marble in the foyer. It is perfectly located for city shopping and darling harbour. The rooms were not well cleaned with the dust on our bedside table outlasting our stay. Not sure how long it had been there. The concierges were excellent. A good hotel spoilt slightly by some service that didn't match the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great and stylish place”
Reviews.Author: LoraTraveling
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a for a long weekend after a business trip and I loved the place. Great central location, very charming, clean hotel. My room was huge, nicely organized, the only drawback was that there was no view but not a big loss. The furniture and the design are charming and again you can feel it is done with style and you feel cozy. It is a great example of 4-5 star hotel. The staff and concierge in particular are some of the best! The restaurant is nothing special, staff is not always friendly, food is OK; It is walking distance from Darling harbor, downtown, shopping, 20 or min walk to the Opera House, close to the Botanic garden, gallery, train station to airport and Bondi beach. I made the booking on the hotel website where you can get nice deals. Above all, it is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Fibenton
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business trip. Good location. Good gym. Comfy bed. Didn't try room service. Only issue was entering the building after-hours. Left us out side waiting. Not sure what the issue was but got in eventually.

Reviews.Title: “a central position”
Reviews.Author: newycouple
Reviews.Content: My husband picked this as a luxury weekend getaway for us. its a beautiful hotel but in all honesty for the $$$ Ive stayed in far better...it was lovely but we didnt feel that it lived up to what we actually envisioned. The parking is abit of a concern too as it is run by a separate company next door, we picked our vehicle up to go home & after a quick inspection we noticed that 2 of the mags had serious scratches on them that were not there at the start (we have a subaru wrx..not a bomb...not that, that should matter)...after some chats , phone calls , quotes & emails the company did happily pay for 2 new rims...it just spoilt our otherwise nice weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good sized rooms- value for money”
Reviews.Author: carolans69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip for 2 weeks. It is in an excellent location, and has close access to restaurants and nearby bars. My room was a very good size and was clearn. The hotel is the original Grace Department Store and was rennovated about 10 years ago. it was decorated in an Art Deco style but is need of a bit of an update, as the carpets feel a bit tired and musty. However it does have a guest laundry which was invaluable to me given my length of stay. The staff were generally very nice and the room service was excellent. Food from the inhouse restaurant - The Grace Cafe - was very good. I would recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “10Rooms is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jerseyboysfan
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed again at the Grace, this time in one of the "10Rooms". This is called a boutique hotel inside the hotel, 10 rooms which are all different styles. I had room 5 which was light and bright with a partioned off area for the bed, a small "living" area with two chairs, coffee table and large flat screen tv. There were treats left - white chocolate bars, special tea bags, espresso coffee, and semi-dried figs. The toiletries are Molton Brown and smelled divine. Free bottles of water, and breakfast is included in the room charge. I really enjoyed the experience of staying at 10Rooms and will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - will stay there again for sure”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter1952
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grace recently with my daughter - overall a great experience - could not fault anything

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: re85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, got a really great deal online. We arrived early in the morning to drop our luggage off and were told abruptly that check-in wasn't until 3pm and to come back. It was slightly annoying that we had to wait to 3pm on the dot to check-in. Staff at the reception desk were pretty rude and disinterested, they didnâ€™t even bother to tell us where the lifts were or about the hotel facilities. The concierge were fantastic, polite and full of good suggestions on where to eat. The location was excellent and the rooms were nice. Would defiantly stay here again due to the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: woohooyoo
Reviews.Content: Absolutely lovely hotel with nice spacious rooms and good room service food. Staff are nice and everything went smoothly. Laying in bed at night we could hear the people in the room next to us yelling at their kids. Annoying but still we had a great time! Very central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Michael076
Reviews.Content: Well located to Sydney CBD and Darling Harbour. Large rooms, well appointed, quiet. Everything works. Eating options in the hotel are several, from cafe to irish pub (hard to get a table) to usual hotel restaurant. Lots of other options nearby. Queen beds consist of 2 singles pushed together, which is pretty poor. However not uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful renovation of a classic building and good rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Scottd237
Reviews.Content: Had a quick overnight stay at this hotel. The building has a long history and this hasn't been spoilt by conversion to a hotel. Staff were polite and professional, rooms very well appointed,large, quiet and clean. In house Internet was the usual Australian slow over priced and mostly useless hotel connection. A number of small boutique shops are located downstairs, and given the hotels location it is in a good spot to access darling harbour, town centre and a short stroll to circular quay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodation - great location for shopping and attractions”
Reviews.Author: travlr9
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend with family in Sydney. The Grace hotel is well located in the centre of Sydney near Queen Victoria Building and the Pitt St mall. Handy for Darling Harbour and Circular Quay which are about 10 minutes walk away. The room was clean and comfortable although minor deficiencies - no sewing kit, hairdryer in bathroom pretty pathetic and ackwardly located. We had a spacious family room - plenty room for 2 adults and 1 child - king bed rooms are of average size. Staff were pleasant and efficient at reception however the bistro on the ground floor was very disappointing. We waited 35 minutes for a basic order of soup and sandwiches which were expensive and not very exciting. We considered eating at the buffet restaurant "Brasserie" but staff could not tell us what was to be on offer and suggested we look on the internet for a sample menu which we could not locate in the hotel website. Definitely not good enough for a 4 star hotel. Suggest eating elsewhere - for both value and quality. Fat Buddha (Chinese restaurant) and Yama (Japanese and good breakfasts) on level 2 QVB within easy walking distance and both excellent. Recommend avoiding the Forbes Hotel opposite - dining room grubby and food poor. Also disappointing was that we could not access the gym - it was locked although it should have been open at the time we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Honesty Honesty Honesty”
Reviews.Author: kjram
Reviews.Content: On July 29 and 30 I had the pleasure of staying at the Grace Hotel in Sydney.When leaving I was helped to my car with my luggage and unbeknown to me at the time I dropped my watch.As I was driving home I went to check the time-no watch.I rang the hotel and was helped by a very caring and compassionate receptionist who took my details and assured me she would ring me back.True to her word I received a phone call within 15 minutes with the good news that my watch had been found.The sentimental value attached my watch is more than the world to me.Because I was returning to Sydney the following week the receptionist assured me my watch would be kept in a safe place till I picked it up.I am very happy to say that I was reunited with my treasured watch on August 6th with no problems.Future patrons/clients of The Grace can rest assured that this hotel has honest ethics and does practice them-so important these days!!!!!!!!!!!! A very big THANKYOU again, much appreciated

Reviews.Title: “love love gorgeous Grace”
Reviews.Author: SHAELEEJANE
Reviews.Content: Currently at The Grace for a three night stay. Got a GREAT deal via the website.....30% off for a three night stay-so cost $150 a night for the superior room-ended up with a "Neo" which is the superior room that has been refurbed so were super happy. Foyer and public areas are just beautiful. Service has been lovely. Room is tastefully modern and roomy....I wouldn't pay more for a deluxe (no need to). Bed is a king and comfy, lots of spare pillows and one of the BEST pay per view movie selections I have EVER seen. There is also a 24hr deal.... $26.95 and you can watch as many movies as you like! Very handy when someone is hanging around the room for a few hours.....we watched 4 movies between us in that time! Ordered room service and the Club Sandwich was very good-huge actually and tasty. Location is perfect for us.....really close to the fabulous shopping-I beat a path to Zara, still within walking distance to Chinatown and Darling Harbour. Train station about 250m away too. Had dinner in the cafe-very high quality food ie: not cafe style! YUM, service here was a little non attentive even though it was almost empty. They also turned away a big group of would be diners which was bizarre. We have stayed at various Sydney apartments over the years including Star City, Oaks Maestri, Somerset and thought we had found our faves, this was the first hotel room we have encountered in Sydney (and only booked last minute after a booking mix up elsewhere) and it's by far my favourite place to have stayed in. I would not hesitate staying here again and have felt the value for money was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Will be Back”
Reviews.Author: Titan44
Reviews.Content: Perfect location right in the middle of everything. Just a short walk to Darling harbour China Town and shopping and theatres. The rooms are big and you will have the BEST BED EVER!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good honest hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gundagirl
Reviews.Content: We were attending a work function in town and found this hotel well situated and close to everything. Room was clean,quiet and bed comfy. Breakfast was good but in the function room as restaurant was closed for renovations. Only bad thing as per every Sydney city hotel horrendous parking which was hard to find and expensive. would recommend as somewhere convenient to stay in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was beautiful! Staff weren't helpful”
Reviews.Author: Jo5hWa
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful! Room was spacious and nice. Unfortunately the staffs were unhelpful and rude.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but everything shuts early”
Reviews.Author: Nick T
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been converted from the old Grace Brothers department store and has retained much of its historic past and character as part of the decor. Check-in procedure and the room lay out was excellent. Parking a car you need to drive around the other side of the block and wait for the porter, who doesn't seem to be in any hurry. Wireless internet in the room is a rip off but that seems to be par for the course in Aussie hotels. Free internet in the cafe downstairs. All the restaraunts and bars within the Grace hotel seem to shut by 9.30 pm so you need to be prepared to venture out. Good central location and restaurants etc are easy walking distance. A good old fashioned english style pub is across the road and very charming for a night cap. I have no qualms about staying at the Grace again for either business or pleasure in central Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “THE NOISE WAS UNACCEPTABLE”
Reviews.Author: victoriajayne2011
Reviews.Content: Worse hotel ever stayed in in sydney. Why did the management think it's acceptable for guests to be woken at 05.45 am for the grease trap cleaners to start up in clarence street under everyones windows .this incredible racket went on for half an hour by which time there was no hope of getting back to sleep . what the hell were they thinking ?

Reviews.Title: “A good experience.”
Reviews.Author: laurahoc
Reviews.Content: Free upgrade on arrival was a pleasant surprise. Room was larger then expected though the bed wasn't so comfortable as the one at Four Points where we stayed the week before. Location was great in the middle near the harbour and quay. Very close to the train station which was a plus. The lobby wasn't as spectacular as I thought/heard it was going to be which was a little disappointing. Check in was quick and pleasant. Overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “We are sick due to the cold in the room”
Reviews.Author: ads_88
Reviews.Content: Well, leave aside the location; we had a cold night there. Looks like the air-conditioner in the room was not heating up. We set the temperature at the maximum possible with their AC system (24oC); but still it was chilly; I can guarantee, the room temeperature would have been in early teens. At home we set it at 18 and it is quite comfortable. The AC was noisy and it did not heat the room at all, we ended up turning it off in the early morning and the room temeparture got bit better. We are down with cold, fever and headache since then (it has been three days now). I would have expected bit better from Grace; we were there to have a good night, not to get sick. Its a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but customer service was lacking a bit”
Reviews.Author: KayMM01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, check in was fast and easy. The room was nicely decorated and clean but could hear quite a bit of traffic noise outside. We ordered room service at night but upon check-out I noticed a discrepancy on the bill and after questioning it we were advised by Jenny at the counter that it was for a Breakfast room service (for 2) I told her we didn't order breakfast and the room service we ordered wouldn't have added up to the amount we were charged, she just shrugged and said "well that's how they charged you" and didn't bother rectifying.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: __hellyes
Reviews.Content: A really beautful hotel, the rooms are very nicely decorated and immaculately clean. Beds are very comfy and staff very friendly. Cafe downstairs has yummy food, great location in a quieter and slightly classier street of the cbd. I believe there is no better compliment than a short positive TA review as I have no complaints to highlight at all!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Rvee2010
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Grace was short and sweet. Nice clean room, friendly staff, good location, good value. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable (but a little noisy)”
Reviews.Author: c0untryc0uple
Reviews.Content: This was a very comfortable hotel. Check in was very easy and efficient and the consierge was most helpful. We were quickly shown to our room. The room was clean and well appointed but light switches were a bit difficult to find. During the night i Had to request ear plugs due to street noise ( although we were in an "inside" room. They were delivered very quickly without bother.) Breakfast was very nice but there was no clear indication on what was available - you were able to have cooked items but it was not clear as to how you obtained same. I don't think the young girl who was the breakfast host was very informed. Coffee was delivered to tables - but I am not sure coffee that has stood for some time is ever nice. Our checkout was very efficient also.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Art Deco architecture”
Reviews.Author: PerthFrequent_Flyer
Reviews.Content: I love Art Deco and the Grace Hotel is a good example of the architectural style. It had beautiful fittings, lobby and I just love the lit panel next to the elevators which indicates the elevators in use and their locations. Unfortunately, the other bits that make the hotel: service, presence, meals etc. were average. Other than for the architecture, I can't imagine too many people would consider their stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not necessarily memorable”
Reviews.Author: rwhite732
Reviews.Content: My work has recently moved and as a result we (interstate staff) are trialling different Sydney CBD hotels having stayed at a number of them. The Grace is in an excellent location, beautiful and interesting building and staff welcoming. Would I recommend it? Well like many hotels it has its pro's and con's. I like a bit of luxury and the Grace's room whilst clean and well decked out just needed a bit of a revamp. In saying that I gather there are floors in the hotel where this is already happening. One surprising aspect of my visit over the course of a few days was that the room service dinner was excellent (as far as room service goes). It was hot, arrived when they said it would and generous portion sizes. The Breakfast selection was a downfall though in that there appeared to be only two options - a $25 or $35 choice. As all I wanted was special K , milk and a small danish - $25 is a ridiculous price to pay for that and as a result I ate elsewhere for breakfast. Like I said, there have been pros and cons in every Sydney CBD hotel I have stayed in but this was pretty good and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A classic hotel with superb location”
Reviews.Author: TATA22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped over Sydney for one day and stayed at the Grace Hotel. The hotel building is beautiful and classical. The best thing of the hotel is it's convenient location. You could walk to the station, darling harbour and harbour bridge/ Sydney opera house conveniently. This is perfect for us as we have only one day at Sydney. The bad thing is internet access is not free (but this is common for hotels in Sydney. Yet, it would be better if they provide free internet access at the lobby. We are there to celebrate my birthday and the hotel send us a complimentary wine. This is highly appreciated :)

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay will recommend to friends”
Reviews.Author: QldKosta
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end our stay was a very happy one. With the beautiful foyer our first impression our reaction was WoW" The staff were extremely helpful, and the rooms were quiet and spacious. We were also upgraded, which was nice! The Grace is close to everything..shopping,restaurants, China Town, Theatre and tourist spots..no need for a car! It's also close to the train. We booked our stay through an exciting new on line accomodation site travelcandy.com.au....check it out!! We received an excellent deal through this company.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing cold experience”
Reviews.Author: charlie1279
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of Art Deco and this hotel was on my to do list. Upon entering the hotel I found it to be an amazing building, lacking some of its originaly charecter, but still lovely. I had a look around the hotel to check out some of the original decor, I loved all the curves and textures of the deco chair which are on the various levels of the hotel. This shold be embraced more throught the hotel as it is so unique. My room was the new refurbished type from the pictures and we found it had everything we needed and due to the hotels great location we enjoyed great nights out in china town and Darling habour. This is a great central hotel. On our last day before we flew back to the Uk I decidede to try on of the treatment within the hotel CRYOTHERAPY, I had never heard of it either!!! Sounded great and being British I missed the cold, The clinic is very modern and the staff very friendly, felf a little nervous but thought it might help on the long haul flight and said you could burn upto 800kcal. OMG I felf AMAZING!!!!!!! afterwards and its such a different treatment to have then a normal massage at a hotel. Upon arriving back in the UK I suffered NO SYMPTOMS of jet lag as on my previous trips to Oz. So well done the Grace for being such a unique hotel and BIG thanks to CROYLAB for the amazing experiecne. Hopefully see you soon

Reviews.Title: “Overall, good stay minus a couple of a things”
Reviews.Author: Auyon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grace Hotel in June for 5 nights on a business trip. I was accompanying a delegation from our Central Bank. The rooms are very spacious and the bed was comfortable. TV channels were very limited but we were provided with complimentary internet and breakfast (which was very good, especially the egg station). Few things I was not happy with: 1) Being asked to pay a cash deposit for the room plus $500 for incidental charges. Were not willing to give our credit cards because of the high charges and the time it takes for the refund to take place. We checked in on the weekend and the banks were closed so we could not change US dollars to Australian currency (on another note, the hotel was charging a rate of 1 USD = 0.75 AUD when the current rate was 1 = 0.94). It was very inconvenient for us but the assistant manager was nice enough to let us make the room payments once the banks had opened. But to deal with that stress was not nice. 2) Grace Hotel charges AUD 15 for an adaptor that will only work in Australia or New Zealand! That is so unwelcoming and unhospitable for international guests! These things should be provided free of charge as most hotels around the world do.

Reviews.Title: “Oldworld Charm.”
Reviews.Author: Oldandnew
Reviews.Content: When you walk into the foyer you feel like you have stepped back in time. The decor is charming. Rooms are comfortable. Good location right in the centre of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious.....NOT!”
Reviews.Author: flyinround
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for many years and during renovations gave it miss. Thought l would give it a go now that some renovations have been completed and was a real let down. The bathroom was advertised with a luxurious shower and nothing luxurious about it. Furniture old, room very small and location is the only thing going for this hotel. My favourite once is no longer the case.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jhnhllns
Reviews.Content: This is a very traditional city hotel in a heritage listed building. It's a true 4 star with lots of attention to detail in decor, facilities, staff and food. Being right in the heart of Sydney between Wynyard and Town hall stations, it's perfect for the tourist or business traveller alike. I asked for a quiet room and so was given one on the 6th floor facing the inner atrium and boy, it was quiet, Not a whisper all night. The bed was so comfortable too. The room is well presented, has everything you'd expect and the bathroom was nice and roomy. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: happyworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: It's an expensive hotel to stay in but is in a good location. A number of rooms are not yet updated, so it really depends on the type of room you get. The renovated rooms have better showers with more room, but the beds are uncomfortable. The older rooms have smaller shower stalls (like the European style bathrooms with half glass doors and really high tubs to get into). Overall, it's pretty pricey for the stay....hotels closer to World Square area are better value for money. Parking is expensive too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but $400 deposit required”
Reviews.Author: Beffa
Reviews.Content: The Grace Hotel is located in the heart of Sydney, and a short walk to chinatown, the rock, Opera House and the ferryies. The room was nice and comfortable and pre-paid. We would stay there again, except for the $400 deposit required by the hotel at check-in. I have been traveling for over 20 years and have stayed at some very upscale hotels (4 seasons), but this was the first time any asked for a deposit on a pre-paid room. I spoke with the manager and he said it was standard for all hotels (obviously a lie) and would not wave it. While the hotel was nice and the location was good, I will not be back and do not recommend it. See photos of my trip to Australia at www.worldphotosonline.com.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I ever had”
Reviews.Author: eviljinks
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work and have never stayed in a hotel where the staff were so outright rude, inattentive and dismissive. I actually ended up leaving early and even had difficulty doing that. Check in was a nightmare, the room was ok, but nothing special by Sydney standards and every time I asked a staff member anything at all I was either ignored or dismissed. I will never stay there again. I'd rather sleep on the street. Disgusted.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: fhyr
Reviews.Content: Hotel is within walking distance to Chinatown, QVB, Darling Harbor and many other sites. Two blocks away from the Apple store (use internet there) and kiddy corner from there is a grocery store where you can get fruits, snacks, bread, meats, etc. Mono rail is close by, same with the free 555 bus.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, solid service - great value!”
Reviews.Author: bbs220
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grace on a few occasions as rooms were still available last minute. While usually not the best sign, we had a great stay. The Grace is located right in the middle of downtown - easy walk to The Quay, Hyde Park and George Street. Rooms were all reasonably spacious with all the amenities you would expect including a large tub in each room. Staff was incredibly courteous including check -in, concierge, room service and help desk. Only knock to be aware of is $25/day for internet though I don't think that's unusual. Overall a great stay, particularly at a lower price than the comparable hotels in the area, and one I would repeat anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Dharam_SP
Reviews.Content: It is located at a very decent place, with all ammenities availble. food is excellent and you can get anything you think of in an around of this hotel, rooms are well maintained and clean. The view from the balcony is mind blowing and it has a feel.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: MBCB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grace Hotel for 2 nights. Staff were very courteous. The rooms were clean and large especially the bathroom. Decor of the hotel is beautiful. It is an older built hotel so you can hear your neighbours through the walls sometimes.. Overall a pleasant hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A wee bit long in the tooth but great location/value”
Reviews.Author: Gustypants
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical ultra modern 5 star Sydney hotel with views of an iconic skyline (The Grace is situated about half way between Circular Quay and Darling Harbour), and it could do with a few million bucks of refurbishmant, but it is pleasant, quiet and ideaaly situated for those with business or shopping in mind. The rooms are a bit daggy but very spacious and the sleep quality is excellent. The staff were all polite and friendly (more mature than most of the Sydney hotels) and check in/out was seemless and quick - they have an unusual rule whereby if you order a late check out they will charge you by the hour ($15). I did not sample the food in house because you are right in the centre of Sydney's best troughing area. All in all, great value for money and a perfect location (without the views).

Reviews.Title: “King Size Rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah21ny
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious very comfortable, quiet and well serviced with very helpful staff at the counter.I would recommened this hotel to any future travellers. Room with every thing you would require for overnight or longer stays. The room was very large, with the most comfortable bed we have ever slept on (king-size), a walk up spa, couch with chaise end, workstation, tea and coffee making facilities and a very modern bathroom with seperate shower. Rooms were very quite with no outside noise being heard. We have stayed in many places over the years, but this one really had the WOW factor and we cannot fault anything.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerseyboysfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at Easter for the fourth time and it was great as always. The room (a premier corner room) was light and bright and the bathroom was large and spotless. The management left two large Easter eggs in the room, which was a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Average Service With Far More Potential!”
Reviews.Author: Quin01
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying in this hotel - it really appeared to have everything I was looking for. However, even upon arrival, it soon became clear that the staff at this hotel were not interested in providing top levels of customer service. The check-in was impersonal and very little information was communicated to do with the hotel and locating our room. The service at the pub bar, attached to the property, was absolutely shocking: the staff were rude and the service was very poor! The hotel does boast an excellent location for exploring the main sights of Sydney. I cannot help but feel that it may be better to return to a department store, though, as I don't feel they cut-it as a top class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grace is the right name for this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cassie-Ann
Reviews.Content: A beautiful art deco style buiding with lots of history which you can read about on the lobby wall. ( I wonder if the original air raid shelter and secret tunnels under the hotel still exist?), very charming hotel. Great location close to all areas of interest , walkable to Rocks, Opera house, ferry access etc. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Only down side was no view, poor swimming pool and noisy bar opposite!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect, central location to anchor your Sydney experience from”
Reviews.Author: pnieuw
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel right in the heart of Sydney's CBD. Within 15 minutes walking, you can be in Darling Harbour, or The Rocks, on a train to any other city destination, at the Circular Quay Ferry Terminal, or within sight of the Opera House. The hotel is a classic, iconic turn of the 20th century building, with the charm and grace you would expect from a property of this grandeur. The room we had was fantastic - roomy, and the most comfortable beds and pillows. The breakfast buffet is excellent, and try to get it as a package deal, because a la carte, it is a bit pricey. A dip in the pool is nice, but it is a lap pool, and while my 10 year old had a lot of fun in it, it isn't the same as a regular pool where you can do cannonballs and goof around a bit. The price can be steep - look for specials and packages. Parking, I hear, is expensive, so plan on taking transit or a taxi to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond!!”
Reviews.Author: kiwigal123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Sydney for our 15 year wedding anniversary. Being in the accomodation industry myself, I enjoyed taking the time to research all that Sydney had to offer in the way of Hotels in the CBD. I settled on The Grace because of the great reviews on this website and others. I was definately not dissapointed. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a deluxe room and given a complimentary bottle of bubbly to celebrate our anniversary with. The room was HUGE, luxurious and very quiet. The bed could have easily slept 5 people and was incredibly comfortable. We were there over easter and the housekeeping staff even left a couple of easter eggs for us - it's the little things that make the difference! The Grace is also with a very easy walking distance to Darling Harbour, the Rocks, Circular Quay, Chinatown. We would definately reccomend The Grace to anybody who is visting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Ingersoll
Reviews.Content: Excelleant service from the concierge in setting up trips and excursions. The room was very nice. Contemporary quiet and comfortable. The hotel is walking distance to the waterfront and the attractions located at Darling Harbor. There are decent pubs and restaurants within and very near to the hotel. There is on-site self-serve laundray which was extremely convenient to us as we were travelling for an extended period of time. If you are looking for things to do in Sydney I would highly recommend a day trip to the Blue Mountains. We also did the Sydney Harbour Tour and would reoommend that trip as well. Both excursions were set up by the concierge and were well worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “A good overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: jarz1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds in the middle of April. Arrived at the hotel at about 11:30am and the room was ready. We were on the 5th floor with a great view of some buildings and streets in the CBD. We chose the standard room which was $20 or $30 cheaper than the deluxe room, the only difference is the deluxe room has a couch which we didn't need. Ordered room service (wedges and spaghetti) and was happy with the cost and taste of the food. Only thing I didn't like was the expensive internet, but we just didn't buy it. The beds were comfy and the room was clean... considering we only paid $160 for the room and the closest hotel of the same category was well over $200.. I feel the Grace Hotel was great value as we only needed a room for an overnight stay as we had an early international flight the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Poor on the cleanliness scale.”
Reviews.Author: travelingwama
Reviews.Content: We did not book this hotel of our own accord. It was chosen by our tour company. Having said that, I found the hotel to be in a great location. Central to all that is important to see in Sydney. Hotel room was adequate in size. Breakfast buffet was included in our tour, the buffet was quite good with a wide assortment of choices. Most hotel staff that I encountered, were very friendly and seemed interested in our well being while staying in the Grace. However,I am always skeptical when staying in a hotel and notice that housekeeping is cleaning rooms dragging their carts and vacuums, but not hearing the sound of vacuuming. Our room was very dusty and there was a film of dirt around the back of the toilet. One sign that cleanliness of hotel is not a priority is when hallways are dark and dingy, I found that the Grace really lived up to the "dark and dingy" hallway cliche. There is a guest laundry room which is a plus. Business center is adequate, however, if you utilize the business center, minimum charge is $11.00 for one hour. If you only use 30 min of your 1 hour, you forfeit the rest of the charges. The Grace is adequate for a short period of time, but I would do my homework next time, and try to search for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but food for an event was terrible.”
Reviews.Author: KRock_06
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference, the rooms are ok as is the service. But the food for the week was at best patchy. In the dinning area it was ok but for events the standard was very poor. Cold meal, some not fully cooked the standard I could not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not what we were looking for.”
Reviews.Author: JMB
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in a premium corner king room in mid March 2011. Grace has a great location near lots of pubs and restaurants. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk to the Darling Harbour, 20 minutes to Circular Quay and 10 minutes from the Wynyard train station, which is handy for the airport train. The room size was nice, with a large bathroom with a separate toilet/shower from the sink, and the staff were very kind and helpful. The main foyer is quite grand, and having a pub and lounge accessible from here is handy. There was a fire alarm on one night, which is something that we have never experienced before. The staff handled the incident very well and communicated as quickly and clearly as possible to the affected guests and we never felt like we were in any danger. Some negatives are the room lacked a luxury feel despite its price, the hotel generally lacked character, and itâ€™s a busy street outside with lots of pubs and lounges so there is late night noise that lasts into the early morning hours. We also have an issue with their expensive daily charge for WiFi access. In todayâ€™s world where it is possible to walk into any coffee shop and access free WiFi, we think it is unacceptable for a hotel of any class to have a WiFi charge. Overall we thought the Grace was okay but not enough to stay again at its current room rates, so on our subsequent visits we will try some other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: Polly018
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way to and back from New Zealand. The rooms were comfortable although the view we had on our first stay was better, we arrived on very early flights on both occasions and we were lucky enough to get a really early check in on our first stay (9am) when we returned we had to wait until about 2pm. We didn't eat at the hotel bistro but we used the pool (a lap pool) which we had to ourselves. Staff were friendly and helpful, they were able to suggest restaurants to us each evening and all of their suggestions were good. On our first stay we were invited to "drinks" with the manager, it turned out to be a good evening with some lovely canapes. My only criticism was that I don't think our return stay was as good as the first - we didn't feel like valued returning customers. There was nothing wrong with the stay on our way home, it just didn't seem as special as on the way out.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Hiccups”
Reviews.Author: ztinkerbelle
Reviews.Content: I'm hoping that our experience was an anomaly, but there were problems from the moment that we checked in. We were given a twin bedroom and made to pay $35/night to an "upgraded" double-bed room (irksome, since I had booked two rooms, and the other was a double for no further charge). The "upgraded" room was apparently an improvement, because it had and extra 30 sq. ft. or so - not necessary when the rooms are already generously sized. Our window faced out onto an air shaft, so looked directly into other rooms. Our towels reeked so strongly of cigarettes that we had to change them (it was a non-smoking room). Our ironing board literally fell apart - into 6 pieces - when we tried to use it, but the iron was of such poor quality that it didn't really matter anyway. The TV had something wrong with it and kept resetting to the hotel menu screen. Other than that, a very comfortable and attractive room, but with so many other options in Sydney, I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lea5834
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Grace for three weeks for work- was a very nice comfortable hotel. Rooms were good- but varied depending on the room (I checked in and out a few times). The best thing for me aboutt the hotel was that when in your room you couldnt hear anything in the hallways- always welcome when at a hotel. Rooms were nice- modern, newly redecorated- not overly spacious but not cramped. Location was amazing- a few short blocks from darling harbor. Fitnesscenter was terrible though if that is something you look for! Other then that I would definetly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great - but choose room carefully”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: I started in 625 - an ouitside room, which we found too noisy. Woken at 0500am, by traffic. Asked to move and went to the 11th floor, an inside room. It looks into an internal courtyard. No view, but cooler and QUIET. A good nights sleep, nice bed. Tea and coffee facilities, minibar, ironing facilities. Hotel has a guest laundry on 3rd. Breakfast good, quality and choice great. hotel location is ideal for the CBD, easy access to all city activities. Pool area on 12th - nice view, good whirlpool, small pool *(is it a pool - about 4 ft deep, one person can (just) swim a bit. Service all fine, good staff, no waiting and all very edfficient. Given a quiet room, a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quality 4 Star Hotel close to major city attractions and transport”
Reviews.Author: iitravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel whilst on short break in Sydney. Superior Twin Room was modern and spacious. Hotel is approx 11 years old and well maintained. Hotel has several dining options. 320m walk to Wynyard Station with direct access to airport train and city circle. Monorail is only a few blocks away. Well situated for the Rocks, Circular Quay - ferry terminus and Darling Harbour all within walking distance. Staff were friendly and check-in and checkout was seamless. Would recommend this Hotel for those wanting a comfortable affordable stay close to all city attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: dennycrane03
Reviews.Content: A family member booked and prepaid to stay 5 nights. Due to flight changes, their plane was going to arrive earlier than planned. They asked Grace if they could check-in a bit earlier, say 10-11am, rather than 2pm which is Grace's normal check-in time. Grace refused even though they were not fully booked and said they would only let them in early if they paid $170! That's only $10 off the current nightly room rate! I am so appalled at the blatant money-grabbing! Especially when the customers in question are repeat customers! It is so unfortunate that the room is prepaid. The best I can do is tell everyone I know not to stay at the Grace Hotel EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Grace Hotel is in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: AshfromBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We checked in late (10:45pm) midweek and service was fine, check in was easy. The room was a reasonable size, and relatively clean. The toilet was not cleaned properly which was a real let down. The shower water pressure was surprisingly good. The decor is art deco and they did a good job of preserving it. Check out was also efficient. The guys at the porter desk were helpful in holding our luggage and negotiating a flat rate fee with the taxi driver to our next destination. Strongly recommend Mecca Expresso for breakfast - it's around the corner (walk out the door closest to the porter's desk, take a left and walk to the corner of the road, and hang another left. There's a string of eateries and Mecca Expresso is one of them. Terrific coffee. The Grace Hotel is in a great central city location, perfect if you are there for business or shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Inflexible staff and Breakfast Room hours”
Reviews.Author: suzmca
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Grace Hotel. The rooms were fine but we were disappointed with the staff and service. We were on a tour and were picked up each morning at 7:00 A.M. The hotel provided a free breakfast each day but did not open until 6:30A.M. By the time we waited for the staff to open the breakfast room and write down our room numbers, we only had 15 minutes to eat and rush to the lobby. Beware, they have happy hour at their upstairs bar but do not honor the times listed on the large, framed sign posted in the lobby below. When they gave us our bill, we questioned the bar staff but they refused to give us the happy hour price and would not acknowledge the happy hour times listed on the hotel lobby sign. Very irritating even though. management corrected our bill the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Everything one needs in close range”
Reviews.Author: Nonie20
Reviews.Content: This is an Historic hotel with a beautiful facade right in the middle of the city Lovely spacious rooms, wonderful breakfast , short walk to anywhere in the city; shops, The Rocks, the museums, and yes The Opera !!!! a short walk to the harbour! We go back once a year in spite of many other options - wonderful Greek restaurant nearby "The Athenian" ; excellent food good value! very special prices for weekends and during the Winter there

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Elegance in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: misstiatokyo
Reviews.Content: Two Nights in Sydney to catch up with some girl friends, so organised a Twin Room at the Grace Hotel. Transport - It is very easy to catch the Train from the Airport to Wynyard Station and a short walk to the Hotel, about 20 Minutes. The Room - The room was spacious, the king single beds very very comfortable and it was lovely to have feather pillows and bed covers. The room was clean, with a decent mini bar. The bath was deep and clean, lovely to soak in after a hard day shopping as you are so close to everything. Toiletries were provided and replenished daily. We had a room on the outside, on the 4th Floor and were not affected at all by Traffic noise. Outlets - We enjoyed room service, which was delivered promptly and still nice and hot (wedges and a hot sandwich) and we also visited the Bar77 in the Hotel. The bar was serving specials on cocktails for the opening night for a Jazz Singer they are having in March. The tables in the bar were a bit messy, to be expected on a busy Friday. Each morning we ate the full buffet, on level 2 at the Brassiere, it was absolutely fantastic, so try to get a deal that includes breakfast. We did not, but I downloaded Go Viva! Sydney card which allows two for the price of one breakfast at this time, so we took advantage of this. Staff - The staff at check in were good. The Brassiere staff were friendly and cheerful. The Concierge was knowledgeable and helpful and very polite. Location - The best, we attended Theatre Royal, went shopping in the Pitt Street Mall and walked easily to the Museum of NSW to see the Terracotta Warriors. A perfect place to stay in Sydney! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Parunarang
Reviews.Content: When i reached Sydney, i found out that the hotel i had originally booked myself in, had double booked and had no room for me. No other arrangements made, i was left stranded with 5 other family members, 2 days after the new year, with no place to go too and a lot of luggage! luckily, someone recommended Grace Hotel, and after a short talk we were even offered a discounted rate for our stay. This hotel is beautifully done up, with large spacious rooms with all the amenities you could need. The shower is amazingly powerful, and it was a pleasure to stay in the shower for ages. The hotel is located in the heart of the city, with supermarkets and restaurants surrounding the hotel. Wynyard Train Station is just a stone's throw away, and so are the major bus stops. The hotel complex also has a series of small restaurants, and serves a considerably good amount of room service too. If visiting Sydney for a short stay, Grace is the place to me. Clean, friendly and centrally located, no place offered us a better night's sleep. Also, darling harbour is only a 5 minute walk away, or why not pop down to George Street for a spot of shopping? Enjoy your stay in Sydney at The Grace :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but eat somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: SweetpeaOlive
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, 5 minute walk from Martin Place, shopping and Darling Harbor. 15 minute walk to Circular Quay. Rooms are large and well appointed. The building was a department store and many of the original features have been retained, it has great character. My major complaint was with the poor room service. I rang and had to leave a message on an answering machine, they got back to me 15 minutes later and then my food took another hour to arrive. When i rang to check up on it I was again put through to answering machine. What did arrive was very dry, not sure what they did to the prawns but they were rock hard. I assume they were busy but I could walk in to any restaurant in the world and expect my food to arrive earlier than 1 hour 15. I suggest you walk to Darling Harbor where there are many good restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: thebrewerswife
Reviews.Content: There is something very grand and retro about the Grace Hotel, it is charming. Fantastic value. Rooms were quiet, well equipped and comfortable. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Quality inner-city hotel”
Reviews.Author: k4t_travels
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location. Very spacious room (we stay in a deluxe king room). Pool and gym are small but clean and with quality equipment. Staff were polite. Appropriately priced for it's location. Attractive heritage building.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in sydney ???”
Reviews.Author: SPJ_001
Reviews.Content: Having been a regular traveler to Sydney for business this was my first time at the Grace and LAST, from the unhelpful girl who checked me in to the appalling food. The grace is anything but !!! Lets highlight the food, it was so bad i even went across the road to subway to get a meal and it was far better.......On a good point the concierge and room service staff were great and helpful, on a bad point the young asian staff were appalling, unhelpful and rude. If you are considering this hotel....run as far away as you can, if fact run over to the radission were the food is fantastic, and the staff helpful...... Stay away at all costs.........!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely tremendous place.”
Reviews.Author: LizzyLeeton
Reviews.Content: What a gvreat hotel! From the moment you arrive and a porter opens the door for you to when you check out quickly and without fuss, staying here is a pleasure. Someone is sure doing the customer service training very well. The rooms are great, the bar downstairs was vibrant and I enjoyed just walking around the place talking to other very happy guests. We got a great deal on Wotif and the value was great. recommend this place thoroughly and wil stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJames57
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 4 hotels while in Sydney, 3 of which cost more than The Grace and were much less nice (Novatel, Marriott). This is a great boutique hotel which a lot of charm near Darling Harbor and within an easy walk to the ferry wharfs of Sydney Harbor. Great staff, good sun spot on the roof with a lap pool to refresh and central location. My room was well updated with a great bed, safe and noise proof (I booked the cheapest room level). Realized I needed a printout after business center hours and the staff provided me printing at the front desk. Overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in Sydney for shopping, quiet and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Jenz1
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Grace Hotel, I felt the location was excellent, the rooms were spacious and property was clean. Staff were great including the cleaning staff the concierge guys were great - even funny!!! Enjoyed the pool and spa and the lovely view from the deck at the top (wish this area was open later than 9pm though). Lighting was not great in the rooms for applying makeup :) other than that would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant and calm stay in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: Photosynthesis
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Grace as part of a "mystery hotel" deal on an accommodation website and enjoyed a change from my regular stays in Sydney. Upon check-in, my boyfriend and I were informed that a king bed room was not available for the deal we had (I was told this might be a possibility on booking). We were offered an upgrade to a larger room for a small extra charge which I was happy to pay. The room was very clean, tastefully decorated and surprisingly quiet, given our windows faced the road. The bed was amazing, and we both slept very soundly. The location was great for us, as it was a short walk from most of the places we usually visit, and the close proximity to Darling Harbour would make it a good choice for people visiting Sydney for the first time. Car parking under the hotel was comparable to other weekday rates in the CBD.It was fully staffed by valets, so it feels very secure. My only complaint would be that they charge for internet, which is a common gripe for Australian hotels. Given that it would cost them almost nothing to provide this service with the infrastructure they already have, it baffles me as to why so many hotels insist on having their guests pay to check email. Overall, I would recommend the Grace to Sydney tourists looking for a comfortable and quiet and relaxed place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: SamWollongong
Reviews.Content: Great location, within easy walking distance of attractions and shopping, good service, quiet spacious room. We loved the fact that you could have a lovely cheap breakfast in their cafe. Just a bit disappointed we didn't get a complimentary newspaper. We'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like this type of building”
Reviews.Author: hemikiwi
Reviews.Content: I most recently stayed at the Grace Hotel for 2 nights. As has been previously mentioned, it has been renovated from i believe a large store and also office building. It is quite impressive from outside in terms of its style and they have tried to keep many of the art deco style in the lobby and public areas. Overall i was happy with my stay. My first room was on a high floor overlooking the main road outside. It was a little noisy, so i requested a room change to an interior room, which overlooks a sort of courtyard below. Thsi room was very quiet indeed and i was able to relax and i slept well. The room and bathroom was very clean indeed and so , once again, i was happy with my choice. Although i was quite happy overall, it wasnt really for me. So i am not sure i woudl return. However, i am sure that there are those that return time and time again. Its just a matter of personal taste and what you like!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kissmeekatie
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Grace hotel. The staff were lovely and accommodating, breakfast was great and there is a lovely little pub accross the road! Short walk to everything in Sydney CBD - highly recommend this hotel and will certainly stay in the future. Rooms were large and clean with everything we needed (tea, coffee replaced daily). Thank you to all the Grace staff who made our stay so lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & Historical”
Reviews.Author: mb12345
Reviews.Content: Once you see the Grace Hotel from the roadside you get the impression it is a historical landmark, and you won't be disappointment when you step inside. The hotel has been meticulously upgraded by its new owners who strive to keep the historic intricacies of the building intact. The lobby area is beautiful and quite grandiose. I stayed in a Queen Size bed room and I was impressed by the cleanliness of the room and just how comfortable the bed was. Unfortunately there was no comforter on the bed but considering the air conditioner did not work well at all (the only downside of the room) that explains why. I didn't find the hotel front desk staff to be friendly, especially compared to my prior experiences in Melbourne, Cairns and NZ. In fact, on check in, they were quite abrasive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a few hiccups!”
Reviews.Author: hoopkat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Grace hotel for 5 nights and upon check in found it fairly difficult to understand why on earth you need to leave a deposit of 50% of the room rate per night (in our case $100 per night). We hadn't budgeted for this and in all of the hotels we've stayed in have never heard of this before. We were told that it is just incase we wanted to spend any money in the hotel and that would cover it. If anything, it made us not want to spend any money in the hotel to make sure we got it back. The concierge staff were great but there was a bit of a mix up upon check out and the lady on reception was just rude with a bad attitude. We were told the amount of the final bill, and when she gave me the slip of paper to sign after producing my debit card, there was an extra $15 on there. I was told this was for a credit card charge. I had paid with a Visa debit card (not credit) but that didn't seem to matter. When she realised the mistake she'd made, she asked us what we wanted her to do about it. She ended up refunding the $15 but there was a fair but if drama that went with it including her saying 'congratulations, you got your $15 back' Nice eh!?.... In summary, nice hotel with nice big rooms but the deposit thing and desk staff left a bit to be desired!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all expectations and more.”
Reviews.Author: graciousr
Reviews.Content: I booked The Grace because 1) my name is Grace and I got a silly kick out of booking there - haha - and 2) because it came so highly recommended. We arrived on a rainy Sydney night around 9 - the concierge was polite and checked us in quickly. Our room was lovely - spacious, well decorated and spotless. It is a quick walk away from Pitt Street Mall and a nice wander down to the Sydney Opera House. After a long day's walking I went down to The Cendana Spa for a last-minute reflexology massage which was absolutely blissful. They were amazing, and more polite than the Tranquility Spa and Beauty (which I tried to get into first). The only downside was the $200 safety deposit that is secured at check-in. This may be just me being naive but I didn't know it would be this much as it only says 'a small safety deposit' on booking. It is fairly steep - especially for someone on a budget like us. But that is the only fault in an otherwise faultless hotel - we really had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Stay in the Heart of Sydney...”
Reviews.Author: miamidancer_10
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but positive things to say regarding my stay at the Grace Hotel Sydney: December 2-7, 2010. Upon arrival early in the morning, my room was not ready but they allowed me to use the health club facilites upstairs to shower and change after my flight. I walked to Darling Harbour for lunch, took pictures, and came back in the early afternoon when my room was ready. The room was extremely clean... and what I appreciate the most: quiet. I had no trouble sleeping the first night, or any other night after. The concierge was very accomodating. He suggested a small group tour to the Blue Mountains, which I really never considered until he mentioned it. The concierge staff took care of the reservation and pick up arrangements. It is centrally located in the heart of the CBD. Within walking distance to just about anything in any direction. My only two suggestions to the management would be: 1) Updated weights and workout equipment in the Health Club facility, and 2) Include some sort of continental breakfast with the rate. The room rates are expensive enough as it is. Adding $22.00AU for breakfast is a bit steep. The norm, I realized for breakfast in Sydney, but such a hotel should be able to offer something for their guests. Highly recommended. I would definitely stay at the Grace Hotel Sydney again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Weekend shopping package not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: jimbomaca
Reviews.Content: Hotel location very good. Room small but clean Bathroom had mold in shower,Room service not good we ordered milk for coffee we never received it. Shopping package NOT good value for money we were looking forward to afternoon tea but all we were given was Tea or coffee and a Danish pastry that look like it was left from breakfast staff would not allow us to have a cake or anything on the menue for afternoon tea. Hotel not able to guarentee parking even when booking one and it was expensive we had cheaper parking in a short distance to hotel Breakfast was good staff friendly

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Maihe
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights in rooms facing the inner yard. The hotel was very quiet and the rooms were very clean and spaceous. The hotel was centrally located and it was easy to access the whole city from there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Kincardinepair
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grace for five days in early November and found it to be every thing I needed . Very comfortable beds, the included breakfast had everything you could ask for , staff was there when ever you needed them and the front desk was very attentive. Location put it with in a few minutes of all the main attractions in Sydney . Price of the internet was however way to high and restrictive, there are many internet locations very close and much cheaper, it appears that the vast majority of hotels in Australia believe every one is on a company expense account and can afford outrageous prices to check their E Mail.

Reviews.Title: “New Rooms with WOW factor!”
Reviews.Author: wockinwod
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Grace and it had been on my hitlist for some time. First impressions were of a wonderfully restored art deco grande dame. The foyer is stunning. Check in was quick and efficient and I had been upgraded to one of their new suites - we love an upgrade!! The room was stunning with a wonderful modern fitout. These rooms were about to be released on the website so it was great to get a quick peak. The room was large with the bed tucked around the corner but not in a separate room. Great big dining table which also became very useful as a desk with a very funky light fittting above it. The bed provided a great night's sleep. Bathroom was nice and big. My room did not have a bath which was just fine for me. I believe some of the oter suites have baths and or spas. The bar on the mezzanine floor felt a bit tired and the wine glasses were more like what you would find in a pub rather than an elegant hotel. Breakfast was in the cafe downstairs and they did a great set of eggs and coffee. I would definately head back for another stay. It is very well located and it is a really stunning building.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Bebbi71
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights end of October. The hotel is in a great location, everything within walking distance. Rooms are spacious and well laid-out. Our room faced the road, it was definitely noticeable, but still tolerable. Breakfast was included in our rate with pretty decent buffet choices. Overall a good choice to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “A really pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Kbel3
Reviews.Content: The Grace Hotel is lovely and the location is perfect. We stayed in a Deluxe King room on the 10th floor for just one night and we were impressed. Although the window faced onto an internal light well/atrium our room was still light and spacious. In fact, given the nightclub/pub across the road we were grateful for the super-quiet room we had on a Saturday night! We couldn't get over the size of the room which was great. The bed was comfy and the bathroom was clean and well supplied with toiletries and towels. My only gripe is the shower over bath scenario which, given its depth, might be an issue for a less able traveller. The staff were very friendly and helpful and check-in and check-out was quick and easy. I hadn't expected The Grace to be this good (I'm not sure why) but I do know that our expectations were certainly exceeded and we'll definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: ForeverYoung50
Reviews.Content: This heritage listed hotel is full of history, charming and beautiful. We took advantage of the "Weekend Shopping Getaway" package for $210 a night including afternoon tea in the Grace Cafe and buffet breakfast next morning in the Grace Brasserie. This is great value however when you add car parking it bumps the rate up to $250. Take note, the carpark is VERY limited so a parking space isn't guaranteed. The service from check-in through to check-out was exemplary! Our room was clean and spacious, there was a desk but only one chair plus one small lounge chair. A small table with 2 chairs would've been a better option. Nice bathroom and products and good airconditioning. And might I say, the PA system and fire alarm work well! Thankfully it was only a false alarm during the night, but the hotel staff handled the situation very well by keeping all guests informed. The hotel is in the best location. Only one block to the Queen Victoria Building, the new Westfield and the city centre and 2 blocks to Darling Harbour. The Rocks and Circular Quay are a little further but easily reached on foot. My only issue with our stay was the noise from outside on the street below and the pub across the road. We were on the 6th floor facing King Street. Whether or not because it was Halloween weekend, we found it a little noisy when trying to sleep. Had we have thought, we would've chosen one of the inner rooms i.e one that doesn't have a street view but rather faces the atrium in the middle of the hotel. Summing up, we loved our stay and the service and breakfast were highlights and we'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of a 2 star rating, let alone a 4 star rating.”
Reviews.Author: When_in_Rome2010_10
Reviews.Content: We recently booked the Grace Hotel for a 3 night stay in Sydney. The building architecture is classic neo-gothic in style and looks great from the outside. We approached the front counter to check in to speak to a staff member who had very basic english skills. We shrugged this off as being part of multicultural Sydney and moved on. When we checked in at 12.30pm there were no porters available to assist with luggage or show us to the room. The card was placed on the table in front of us and we went from there. Letting ourselves into the room, we found it to be clean but extremely small and almost no natural light whatsoever. The shower in the room was only capable of producing luke warm water at its hottest. I brought this issue up several times and it was never investigated. I found this to be one of the worst aspects of this hotel. On the second night we called down to room service for an ice bucket only to be told that it would be "at least 30mins because they are busy". When this was questioned, I was advised to "get the ice myself from level 5". I then proceeded down to level 5, eventually located the ice machine in a closed off room, but realised there were no ice buckets there. I approached the restaurant on the first floor to request an ice bucket. I explained the reason I was there was because room service had advised me they were too busy. The staff member at the front of the restaurant told me to approach the bar and go through the same explanation again. I went to the bar and requested the ice bucket, eventually getting it and filling it on level 5. I was starting to wish I hadn't chosen champagne for the evening! On the last morning of our stay we were awoken early twice to loud knocking (despite having the privacy please sign hung on the door). They became aggressive at 10am (apparently their checkout time, never come across such an early checkout time in my life). I called down to reception and spoke to the "duty manager" who advised me that I would have to pay $15/hr for each hour after the 10am checkout time. I tried reasoning with the duty manager, but it was ultimately a waste of time. I complained to the front of house manager when I was checking out, his face expressionless and kept asking him what I wanted him to do about it. I guess he gets that feedback pretty often. He told me contact him directly if I ever wanted to stay there in the future. Not a chance. This is the worst hotel we've ever stayed at in Sydney and not cheap either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Craig O
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a weekend in Sydney, It was wonderful. It is centrally located, so everything is within walking distance. The rooms were large and moden, and had everything we required. The staff were very helpful, they looked after our bags whilst we spend a day at Bondi exporing the sites. Would Defintly visit again...

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: auswanderer
Reviews.Content: I often stay at the Grace for work. In fact they gave me a gift pack a few stays back as I had been so many times. Very adjacent our Sydney office, and many others I imagine. Dining options and bars at the hotel are not anything to write home about but it is always a comfortable bed and I haven't ever had noise issues which is important for me when travelling for business. Courteous staff although in typical Sydney fashion not overly attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: cba81
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel set in the original Grace Bros department store building. The architecture in this building is excellent. I especially liked the character in the stairs in the building, years of use and you can see the wear marks in the stairs and the pivot marks on the landings. The room was excellent with the most comfortable bed I have slept in in a hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: k8andsteve
Reviews.Content: Very attentive staff. Beautifully restored and classy. Buffet breakfast was nothing short of amazing - I have never seen so much food!

Reviews.Title: “grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: evking
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. All staff were very friendly and efficient. Check-in quick. Food in Cafe 8/10. Breakfast quite good. Room was quite large and in very good condition. Good blockout curtains. No real noise from outside except one siren. The king bed was very comfortable. Only problem was height of bath - very high for people who are not tall. Wouldn't like an elderly person to have to get in and out. Otherwise lovely place to stay and walking distance to shops, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in pristine room in the heart of CBD”
Reviews.Author: Korendir
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel relatively well rated on Tripadvisor, and I would agree. It's very clean, well situated in the heart of the CBD. Found it as a sale on Expedia.com for 50% off, so was great value too! Friendly staff mostly (some seemed a bit new though). Renovations show and are quite nice. The room service menu is the same as the cafe next door, for no additional surcharge.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable business hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsMooMoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice during August and I had a good stay on both occasions. The rooms are large and well-appointed. The hotel has a nice ambiance with its restored art-deco charm. The gym is good and the pool and spa areas look very nice. While I did not encounter problems with the check in staff, I did find room service was a bit Faulty Towers. I ended up with someone else's meal and they forgot my beverage but it was no big deal. Also they have express check out so I would encourage people to use that facility if they can. The location is excellent as well. Right in the middle of the city. It is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dapster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel during our round the world back packing trip. It would have normally have been off limits on a year long trip had it not been for the lastminute.com 'secret hotels' offer. we booked through them twice and both times we got amazing hotels in Sydney! Anyway, i'm digressing. The hotel is in a beautiful art deco buildings, the rooms are clean and confortable and the beds were so gorgeous and comfy we didn't want to leave! The location is also perfect. From memory the guy at the concierge desk was a bit stuffy and could have been more helpful but I wouldn't let that put you off as this hotel is a very solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Do The Staff Talk To One Another?”
Reviews.Author: Pioneer18
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on three previous occasions in the past eighteen months. It is a former art deco department store which has been brilliantly converted but retains all of the important features of yesteryear. However despite there being six of us in separate rooms all to be charged to the company account they insisted on wanting to charge us for the accommodation and parking. This led to an absolute debacle on checking out with staff scratching their heads whilst the queue got longer and longer. Eventually someone got the message and found the email with the order number and off we went. A week later I got an account in the mail where they had charged my credit card for accommodation and parking. A day later I got a credit note for the accommodation but not the parking. I called the hotel and they were going to check with the company. A month later I am still waiting. The hotel has an Irish Bar which is certainly Irish. For my first beer I ordered a middy (10oz) of light beer. I was told I could only have a schooner (15oz) or a pint (20oz) so I ordered a schooner. For my next drink I asked for a schooner of another brand and was told I could only have a half pint (10oz) or a pint. Duh! Overall I rate this hotel as a desireable place to stay in Sydney. It is in a very convenient location, but the staff really need to get their act together and the pretentious nonsense in the bar is dumb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: watermelon_23
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a mystery deal through the Need It Now website. At the time of booking a requested a twin room.
