I have previously always booked mystery deals through Wotif.com and never had any problems with the room configuartion I requested. Unfortunately that wasn't the case this time. We arrived at the hotel and checked in. The paperwork I signed clearly stated a twin room, but once we got up to the room we discovered a king size bed. We went back down to reception to try and get a different room with twin beds only to be told that my booking for twin beds through Need it Now was "just a request" and they couldn't guarantee that I would be able to have a room with that configuration. When I tried to discuss the problem with the receptionist I was told "it's just a request" endlessly by the like it was some kind of mantra!! She didn't even understand that it would have been good customer service to at least let me know before we went up to the room!! We were then told that they *might* be able to put an extra bed in the room but that it would cost an extra $55. We then went back up to the room and upon closer inspection discovered that the king size bed was actually two twin beds that had been pushed together. Off we went back down to reception and requested that the beds be separated and made up into two twin beds. While we were out at lunch the receptionist left a message letting me know that housekeeping considers the bed a king and that they have put another bed in the room at the addtional cost of $55. After attempting to get this issue sorted out with the receptionist three times, in the end I just gave up!! This hotel has been beautifully refurbished and the location is extremely handy if you are looking for an inner city hotel, but unfortunately those benefits do not outweigh the poor customer service I received from the staff on hotel reception (IMHO). In addition to the $55 I was charged for the extra bed, we were also charged extra just for using a credit card. As the majority of business in hotels is conducted via credit card these days, I felt like the hotel was out to rip me off as much money as it possibly could during the time I was staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ANNGC
Reviews.Content: Beautiful historic hotel. Very well located in the commercial area of sydney. The internet is not free and is very expensive. The service in the cafeteria is sometimes very slow.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic tour”
Reviews.Author: nizubai7
Reviews.Content: exellance in restaurant and room facilities.i enjoyed swimming pool and gymnasium.good parking facility. i suggest to my relatives. km ahmed..vc no.01501800143

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Serena T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight after a night at the theatre & were very pleased with it. Lovely old building with lots of character. Staff were friendly & always helpfull. Large well appointed room with comfy bed. Fantastic gym/pool area. Would be an ideal loction for a visitor here to see the city sites. It is an easy walk to Circular Quay, shops etc. A quick walk to George st to catch the free city bus if you don't want to walk everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “wotif "misleading" info star rating”
Reviews.Author: kelbelgw
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms with wotif asked for 2 queen beds, we checked in got 2 single beds, ask staff if we could have rooms with queen bed, as it was a weekend no kids, reply was this is a wotif room , not happy, when demended a room with queen bed we got charged a extra $30.00 per room, as advertised with wotif it said it was a 4.5 star rm value $635, staff said they dont have any rooms at that value?? wotif you need to get the correct information, young guy rude at counter, we got wotif service.

Reviews.Title: “luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: GianSingh
Reviews.Content: You have heard the rumors that the Grace Hotel has the most comfortable beds in Sydney, and after you spend a night on the feather pillows under the feather comforter, youâ€™ll know why. An art deco luxury hotel built in 1930; this hotel was restored with original features, so youâ€™ll walk down wide hallways over marble floors under pressed-metal ceilings alongside masterful ironwork. Itâ€™s an easy walk to the Darling Harbour and King St. Wharf, not to mention the fabulous shopping at the Queen Victoria Building. Say, "yes" to a stay at the Grace, and you may never want to go home!

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel with personalized service”
Reviews.Author: tweetietraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Grace for 4 nites upon our arrival in Sydney. It's a pretty hotel, and it's easy walking distance to all the key sites - The Circular Quay, the old part of the city (The Rocks), the Sydney Tower, Darling Harbor. We had considered renting a car but in the end we decided not to, and that was the right choice. We walked everywhere - no worry about parking and traffic. Before our trip, I had written to the generic info address with questions. I got a reply from Stephen within a few hours. He was warm and detailed in his response (and cheerfully answered several rounds of fussy questions). We met Stephen upon arrival and he was just as helpful in person. All of the staff was cheerful and pleasant. We arrived in town at 7:30 a.m. after 25 hours of travel. Our room was not ready, but we were able to freshen up in the immaculate fitness center. It is convenient that there is a cafe in the lobby, a bar upstairs for a quick drink and more of a pub just off the lobby. So if you're weary after a day of sightseeing, there are plenty of good options without venturing out. But there are also plenty of great restaurants within a few minutes of the hotel. We left The Grace to tour other parts of the country, but returned for one additional night on our way home so that we'd be in Sydney the day before our departure. (The hotel kindly stored one bag for us so that we didn't have to take that on our travels around the country.) The room was just as nice on this second visit and the staff was just as thoughtful and pleasant. We were thrilled to find a guest laundry on the 3rd floor, but at $20/load of wash (including soap and drying) - it was just too much - my only disappointment at The Grace. There are many pretty hotels in the world, but what sets the Grace apart is its helpful staff. Many hotels in the U.S. could take a lesson in service from The Grace.

Reviews.Title: “Warm & Elegant!”
Reviews.Author: siienka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner over the weekend & absolutely adored the place! It was a secret hotel deal with lastminute.com.au & we were really happy it was the Grace Hotel!We have always walked past it but never really gave the place a second thought. Upon arrival we were greeted warmly & instantly given a free upgrade to a deluxe room. Check-in was quick & smooth just how it should be! The room was spacious & elegant. The bed (OMG THE BED!) was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on. The mattress is amazing, like sleeping on a big soft cloud! Room service was a little expensive but all part of a hotel experience. The late night room service (11pm-6am) was a bonus after a night out! A wide range of recent movies were also availabe at $14.95 & we selected one to watch instead of heading out to the cinemas in the cold. There is also a lovely fragrance that runs through the whole hotel & it smells divine! We will definitely be returning to the Grace Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Superb value”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: I booked a www.wotif.com 'mystery rate' for the bargain price of A$110 for a Thursday night stay. At check-in the male staff member was very matter-of-fact (some might say 'perfunctory') but he asked me 'had I stayed here beforee' to which I said 'yes, about 15 months ago.' The lifts are separate from any rooms. This is a good feature but can be put down to the building's history as a department store. My seventh floor room had a king size bed and was spacious and thankfully noiseless, backing onto the 'courtyard' type arrangement (not onto York or King Streets, thank goodness). The bed was comfortable, with excellent bedside reading lights. There was a light on the writing desk as well as other (perhaps slightly insifficient) illumination. The two-seater couch was comfortable but the hotel still has not improved its free offering of TV channels. At about six, this compares very poorly with many hotels in countries such as Philippines and elsewhere in SE Asia. Why must many Australian hotels lag so far behind in this regard? The bath worked well although some may not like the lack of a separate shower. Illumination in the bathroom was excellent: better than in the main room. I only detected the noise of one other door banging the whole time, which is good. My room lacked an interconnecting door into the adjoining room which was a godsend as I had found previously when staying at this hotel that such rooms may have 'noise transfer' problems. I did not have breakfast. Checkout was a breeze. An excellent hotel in a great heritage building. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and well situated.”
Reviews.Author: West-Aussie-couple
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 night stay at the Grace through Hotels.com while they were having a 50% off sale. We paid $150 a night which I thought wasnâ€™t bad, we arrived at the hotel at 7.30 in the morning after a 4hr midnight horror flight, after doing the check in details we were told the room was ready and we could go straight up. how good is that we thought. The bed was comfortable and the room was quite large, superior king was the room type. We only use the room for sleeping so canâ€™t comment on extras like internet, television or such. There was coffee making facilities there, also we didnâ€™t pay for breakfast in the hotel, but why would you when darling harbour is a 10 min walk away or any number of other shops in the city. There are 2 entrances to the hotel lobby so the smokers outside the bar can be avoided. The staff were pleasant to deal with and quite courteous All in all we would stay here again, but not at the full price as I wouldnâ€™t pay that much at too many places for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Swansforever
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grace Hotel for 1 night in June. We got a very good rate from an online supplier. It is a beautiful building which is very well located in the centre of the city. Shops, cafes, transport, the Bridge, and harbour are all close. Cafes are on-site or 1 minute walk, the habour and Bridge about 10 -15 minutes walk. Check in was fast and our bags were stowed until our room was ready (we arrived very early). When we collected our bags they were chained up so they were certainly secure! We were given a quiet room on the 7th floor at the back of the building. Traffic noise was minimal and we didn't hear anything from the corridors or neighbours. The room was large, clean, modern and warm. It was cold in Sydney but even in the middle of the night the room was very pleasant - we did not need any heating. The bed was a king bed with beautiful linen. The bathroom was large, although it didn't have a bath, with good toiletries and the shower worked well. The TV was a widescreen with good choice of pay TV stations. We had the buffet breakfast which was very good. Fresh fruits, juice, yoghurts, stewed fruits, cereals, cheeses, cold meats, egg station, lots of cooked dishes, various breads, pastries, pancakes, tea, coffee etc. There were even juice machines where you could make your own fresh carrot/pineapple juice. The breakfast was excellent value and in a beautiful, large, architecturally stunning room. We enjoyed our stay at the Grace and will definitely return and stay longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Overall poor”
Reviews.Author: FJB774
Reviews.Content: The Grace is an imposing building and its situation in the CBD of Sydney means it is somewhat limited in what it can offer. However - itâ€™s expensive and pretty poor value. Check in was an experience - my room was secured on a Corporate platinum card which I produced on arrival - however the rather brusque lady on reception told me she had to make a swipe for $500(AUS) 'for incidentals"? When I asked what she told me room service and mini bar. One thatâ€™s an awful lot of room service and mini bar and two why do this when you already have my Corporate card? She had no answer except the old chestnut "Its hotel policy". the bell boy who took me to my room was first rate - it was me ! As she told me nobody was around to help. Mind you it was 2000 hrs in evening and I assume all staff go to bed early ! The front door of the hotel overlooks a bar / hotel and the Grace itself and that hotel provide a lovely vista of smokers lining the pavements on both sides of the road. Itâ€™s really a pain having to elbow your way through huge groups of smokers in every doorway in Sydney. I know the hotel canâ€™t be responsible for the whole City, but they could keep their doorways clear of them. The breakfast room was dreadful. The air con was cranked up to sub arctic levels and it really wasnâ€™t comfortable to eat there. Staff excuses - "Itâ€™s on a central system" The central coffee machine stopped working after about 5-6 uses and a surly staff member would eventually clear it ready for the Leisure centre is OK - Sauna broken for entire 2 weeks of stay Internet VERY expensive I dropped my multi plug adaptor on tile floor and in the hotel guide it said staff will be happy to provide. Yes, they were but only if I paid 2 times the shop price to buy an Australia only adaptor I have never stayed in any hotel before that didnâ€™t loan guest an adaptor Overall a very disappointing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grace!”
Reviews.Author: dileeshus
Reviews.Content: I'll admit it... I'm a very fussy traveller. But from the minute we arrived to the second we left, I felt very well looked after. Check in was smooth (be prepared to hand over your credit card details, though!). I was very pleased that I was on the 10th floor (which meant no street noise) and quite a distance away from the lifts. The room was very clean, quite sumptuous and had all the mod cons (flat screen TV, deep bath etc.). Late night travellers be aware: I couldn't get the lights to work, and it was only when I went downstairs and asked that I discovered I had to put my door key in the slot next to the lights (no signage to that effect). The room was very quiet... I could have been the only person in the hotel, and the curtains blocked out all light, which was great. Bed was super comfortable, and I slep exceptionally well. The only niggles were that the air conditioner was slightly rattly, the TV reception kept dropping out, and the bathroom looked a little bit tired (but it was very clean). Wi-Fi was pricey, so stuck to my iPhone internet. We dined in the brasserie for breakfast and the offerings were extensive and reasonably priced ($22 for a full breakfast). I didn't order room service, so can't comment on service or pricing. All in all, I'd definitely stay here again. It was an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Grace: Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Saschi101
Reviews.Content: I've been a regular guest at The Grace since 2003 and have to say that it's my favourite Sydney hotel. As a regular work traveller, I've stayed in just about every business hotel and apartment in town, but I always come back to The Grace. The location is perfect - right in the centre of town. Pitt Street Mall is a short walk and most of the CBD is within ten to fifteen minutes walk in any direction. Although not the most luxurious hotel, The Grace is solid. I love the period feel and the general atmosphere. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable, but I would always recommend upgrading to a deluxe or premium room. The superior rooms are basic and from what I've seen, you could do a lot better for the price. However, the premium and deluxe rooms are as good as any hotel I've stayed in. The downstairs pub is very handy and there are several dining and entertainment options nearby. Room service is good and not as expensive as many other Sydney hotels. I'm a big fan of this hotel. Although it's not the fanciest, it's certainly got an atmosphere that's lacking in many of the bigger brands. The biggest compliment I can pay it is that although I generally stay for work, it's the only Sydney hotel I regularly visit for leisure. And I'll definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room + Facilities, Very Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Aishwaryarao
Reviews.Content: Grace Hotel is located in an excellent spot, bang in the middle of York Street, Sydney in the heart of the business district. Their business centre facilities come at a reasonable price ($11 an hour with unlimited print outs for the hour). The room I occupied was impeccable, the beds were comfortable and the sheets were sparkling clean. The best part about my room was the fact that I didnâ€™t have to do yoga to connect my computer or phone to the power outlets. My only issue was with a trainee-staff who didnâ€™t understand that my room had been prepaid (I believe it wasnâ€™t reflected that way on her system) and insisted on charging me for the night. However her manager was very understanding and accommodated me without too much drama. Despite the confusion, I would strongly recommend Grace Hotel for a business/personal stay (especially if clean sheets and tasteful bathrooms matter to you!)

Reviews.Title: “My fave hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: awful_in_aqua86
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here most recently for our 2 yr anniversay, in a nicer room than usual (one of the cnr rooms) which we booked for a reduced rate on wotif. We love the Grace, and the 2 times we stayed other places in Sydney we were really disappointed. Everytime I have stayed at the Grace, the room has been gorgeous, clean and comfortable. I have stayed in a twin room with my mother there before as well (my first stay) and that was just as fantastic. For a place with good location, beautiful rooms and a fair price, the Grace is a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique & heritage hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTourist
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through wotif secret hotel (with a very good rate) for a business trip with my partner. From our previous experience with screte 4 or 5 star hotels through wotif, we usually get the most basic room because of the rate we paid. Offer at Grace hotel was more than our expectations! We were given a huge room with a king bed. We realy really enjoyed every minute of our stay. 1. Location. Perfect. Pitt Street mall & QVB are just 1 block away. Darling Harbour and Circular quay is 10 min stroll. The hotel is a boutique heritage building and is very nicely decorated giving you a early 1900 feel. 2. Room. We were given a large room with modern facilities. LCD TV, large comfortable king size bed. Good selection of tea and coffee making facilities. We were facing the inside of the building and was extremely peaceful and quiet. A small sofa with a good selection of magazines to relax. 3. Unfortunately we did not have time to visit the gym and the pool. Will try next time. 4. Service. Friendly, efficient staff and concierge. 5. I recommend not to drive. The hotel has limited number of parking spaces costing $40 per 24 hours. We enjoyed every single minute of our stay at Grace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Rogandrose C
Reviews.Content: Ideally located, handy for both Darling harbour, Circular Quay & public transport, comfortable hotel, looks very much like an old department store - ala "Are you being served" ( UK TV program of old) , enjoyed PJ O'Brians bar & restuarant- only minus side being internet was pricy - although pretty common in Australia

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing...you won't want to go home”
Reviews.Author: Brisflip
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel in the heart of Sydney, with easy access to the shopping domain of sydney, trains are a block away, and a little further is circular quay. The restaurants in and around Darling Harbour are a must. This is the third time I have stayed at the Grace Hotel and still have not been wanting for anything. The service, reception, cleanliness is all what you would get in a five star. If you away for a relaxing weekend, well do yourself a favour and pamper yourself to the Grace Hotel.... mmmm the beds are great. Obviously you pay for the location, but it is well worth it, did I mention all the good restaurants in and around Darling Harcbour and Cockle Bay, additionally the markets at the Rocks are good to browse over. Would have no problems in returning to the Grace Hotel

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: csg001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel to attend a friend's wedding on the day, and I had requested numerous times over the phone for guaranteed early check-in, however none of the staff would budge unless I booked for the night before as well. So I turned up on the day fully expecting to be denied check-in at my requested time, however to my surprise (and luck) they had a room all ready for me when I arrived. Very impressed! Reading previous reviews, many users said something about the deep bath and it being difficult to get in/out of. However I didn't find the bath to be any different to other hotels to be honest, and certainly wasn't deep or large enough to fit any large-sized men as I would have thought from the reviews. Maybe it's just the room I had? I got a room with a "king sized bed", which I quite enjoyed. It wasn't until next morning that I realised it was one of those "two single beds pushed together" king sized beds. The bed had thick layer of bedding on top, which certainly made the difference. Other than the price (I would have never paid the going-rate for the room), my only complaint is that the room was really lacking in lighting. There was pretty much no way you could read at night unless you sat right below the lamp. It certainly made the mood more intimate, but not very practical in my opinion. And lastly, I highly recommend the "Express Beauty Bar" downstairs in the hotel. They can do quick and inexpensive makeup on the go, and the staff are really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: WindsurferNewZealand
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely and I found the reviews very helpful in choosing it! The hotel itself is a restored 1930's building, well located within walking distance of all the lovely sights of Sydney. Lovely quiet rooms and very comfy and a great breakfast buffet too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Service, Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: 2Much2See41Lifetime
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grace for a total of 10 nights in March 2010, 8 nights at first and then returned for 2 more before leaving Australia. Check-In was quick and friendly - and early - at 1:00 in the afternoon. Both rooms that we had were clean and in pristine condition and the beds were amazing. It was a shame to not spend more time in them! The bathrooms were great and the showers worked well - although it was a bit of a step to get over the side of the bathtub. The staff were very helpful and the concierge held some of our luggage for a week while we were enjoying the Outback. Only to have it swiftly returned to our new room on arrival. Initially, I was slightly concerned about being too far from Circular Quay, but it turned out to be a non-issue. It was easily walking distance to the Quay, the Rocks district, the Opera House, etc. The location of the hotel is actually quite good because of its close proximity to Darling Harbour, which has at least as many good things to offer (Wild Australia, the Aquarium, the Maritime Museum, IMAX, and even a casino...). Our only concern about the Grace was the expense. We did not use the internet, but we did have one dinner in the restaurant - for 72 dollars. The food was good, but there are many other options in the area. Also, we opted to take advantage of the guest laundry machines before leaving for our Outback excursion. 8 dollars per wash, 8 dollars per dry and 2 dollars for detergent made our one load of laundry worth 18 dollars. Convenient, yes - reasonable, no. Make no mistake, the Grace is a beautiful hotel. It is well situated, the service is excellent and the beds are fantastic. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Clean, Safe Hotel - Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Puddings-mum
Reviews.Content: I booked this property via AirAsia Go and received a deal better than what was offered from the hotel's own website. I chose this hotel based on price and location. It is located in Sydney's CBD, a stone's throw away from Darling Harbour and the Pitt Street Mall. I found it to be clean, neat and tidy - although it was difficult to find a rubbish bin in the lobby area. Staff are efficient and friendly but lacking in personality - front desk/concierge desk. Breakfast at the Brasserie is typical of hotel buffet breakfast but the room lacked atmosphere. The presentation was lacklustre and the only person who had a genuine smile was the chef who prepared my omelette. The room was clean and well maintained. Everything was in working order, however I was given a room for a disabled person which did not have a bath. Well worth looking into.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable bed I have ever slept in!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jvonslow44
Reviews.Content: My sister, brother in law, daughter, husband and myself stayed here for 3 days in January. The hotel is large and we were dealt with quickly and efficiently by the reception desk staff. We had booked three rooms only 1 was ready when we arrived but we arrived early so we just put all our baggage in the 1 room and then went out to explore. After having a look around Sydney we headed back to the hotel to change before going out for dinner. We all used the leisure facilities, swimming pool, steam room and sauna which were kept spotlessly clean and towels provided. We didn't eat in the hotel as there are so many places to choose from around the city. The rooms are very spacious, clean and modern but homely. The beds we all agreed are the most comfortable we have ever slept in they are divine!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced â€¦”
Reviews.Author: benabouttown
Reviews.Content: So what do you getâ€¦ a really comfy bed, and a spa/gym area on the top floor. â€¦. But thatâ€™s where it stops. They charge you a bomb for wifi, to which it was cheaper to use my mobile phone on roaming, plus they had data caps. The Hotel has a stupid 10AM checkout, and a 3PM check-in (yes that is a 5 hour turnaround â€“ I guess thereâ€™s only one cleaner doing the whole building). They will also sting you for a 1.5% surcharge for using your credit card for settling the bill (as if I am going to be carry that amount of cash in my pocket), and as for the general level of service â€¦ well, lets not talk about the some member of staff not being able to speak English. So what do you get for your buck? A comfy bedâ€¦. God knows how itâ€™s 4 or even 5 star hotel oh oh ... watch out in the bathroom, there's a drain on the floor that has back wash issues (i.e. if you (or someone) is using the shower, toilet or sink stuff comes out - picture attached)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: karen_brad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely. It had been beautifully refurbished. This is our second stay at the hotel and certainly won't be our last. Walking distance to everything. Lovely cafe next door - had a great breakfast. Great Irish pub across the road. The rooms are very nicely appointed, great bed and linens, the bathroom is modern and a good size. Staff are friendly. Room service prompt. All in all and excellent inner city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good except the price for me”
Reviews.Author: Hoahero
Reviews.Content: 180 aud/room is expensive for almost backpacker,however for short and important holiday you could not find any place in CBD suit than that .this is my first time to Sydney and the expences here made me dizzy!

Reviews.Title: “They call it "The Grace", I call it a 'The DisGrace"!”
Reviews.Author: fairone2000
Reviews.Content: Booked a supposed romantic evening away with my partner. Chocolates on arrival, full room serviced breakfast in a Superior Corner King room sounded like the perfect getaway....Ha! We were advised of a guaranteed check-in of 3:00pm which turned out to be 3:35pm. It then took 40 minutes for our luggage to find its way to our room after three calls to guest relations. The luggage finally arrived after my partner went looking for it only to make us late for our show at 5pm. The room booked for us was not a Superior Corner King as outlined in my booking, no chocolates to be seen, no bath robes, no walk in robe, a king sized bed which turned out to be two beds put together (not very romantic), crumbs on floor, mould in shower, unfriendly staff (exception being Adam) and no follow up call from guest relations James in relation to a wrong room being booked for us. Extremely disappointing and definitely not rated 4.5 star...I shall be back at the Carlton Crest next time where rooms are immaculate and service as it should be. Don't bother wasting your money or time at 'The Grace" otherwise known as "The Disgrace".

Reviews.Title: “not amazing, but no real complaints either”
Reviews.Author: urameatball
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights over Valentines weekend mainly because this was the last decent hotel that was still fairly affordable. I booked through expedia and realized the free breakfast wasn't included (which explains why it was cheaper than booking elsewhere). Breakfast buffet at the hotel was $29, but you can get a made to order breakfast at a nearby cafe for much less. Room was fairly standard, average LCD TV, average size, average decor, average amenities, small window with no view... Seems like the standard for Sydney hotels (been to 3 so far). Only real complaint was the king bed -- the mattress was at the end of it's life. The two sides were people usually sleep had significant sag and can be uncomfortable. The centre of the bed was still fresh and much more pleasant to sleep on, as long as you don't roll to the side and fall into the sagging spots again. I guess what gave this hotel it's 4.5* status is it's beautiful lobby and nice decor. Inside the rooms, the bathroom was the only thing I would consider above average. I actually found the 4* Holiday Inn just as comfortable, except at half the price. So you'll need to ask yourself how much you wanna pay for the location and nice decor. One last thing, the hotel has a small pool. Water was murky when I first arrived, then they just closed the pool altogether for the rest of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: Ozjamboree
Reviews.Content: We book this hotel as a secret stay. Price was good, location was excellent, rooms were well furnished and all in all, a wonderful stay in a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully restored art deco hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ravfamily
Reviews.Content: Beautifully restored hotel in a good location , 15 mins walk from The Rocks. Near to the shopping areas too and only 10 mins walk from Darling Harbour ( pedestrian bridge gives easy access). Concierges were very helpful. Roof top pool and fitness room quite fun. Even had a self service laundry - very useful for families. No view though from rooms we had and they needed a few more paintings on the walls - very minimalist!

Reviews.Title: “There is better...especially if you have children”
Reviews.Author: Kroppers
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and one year old daughter. Building is nicely preserved although is a little unfriendly for those who have access issues inlcuding prams and strollers (there is no ramps to/from the lifts to the lobby. Our room window faced into a void in the centre of the hotel, nothing to look at except other hotel room windows, could not even see the sky...very disappointing. One of the biggest issues that we experienced was the baby cot that we requested for our 1 year old. The 'cot' looked as though it was a converted industrial laundry trolley (see pics. attached). It was totally constructed of scratched and rusting metal and also had large bolts and screws everywhere. We have travelled extensively with our daughter both in and out of Australia and have never, ever been expected to put our baby to sleep in something like this. I'm sorry but this is not some third world country, this is Australia! After getting the staff to remove the cot and after a few calls to guest services we had arranged for another cot to be brought up, this port-a-cot that was brought up was broken and could not be used. An hour later another port-a-cot was found and thankfully worked. I would not recommend this hotel to others, especially if you are travelling with children, or spend time other than sleeping in the room, considering the non existent view. For four and a half stars there is better and certainly not worth paying the full rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - perfect for the traveller who won't stay in the room”
Reviews.Author: littlemiss009
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying I only required the hotel as a place to sleep and shower, and was mostly looking for practicalities. This hotel fitted that bill great. I stayed on 2 seperate occassions over the one holiday as I flew to and from new zealand. On the first time they had the room ready early as requested, and we checked in at 8am which was great. We got the train to and from the airport, and it was $15pp each way, and about a 7-10 minute walk - the hotel staff were really helpful with directions. On the second occassion we got a cab and it was $40 - so between 2 of us the extra $10 was worth the ease I think. Our flight did not leave till 8pm on the second occassion, so we left our bags with the hotel, and came back in and used the showers in the fitness centre with no problems before the flight. I was really happy with the flexibility of the hotel to help us around the flights we had. We also ordered breakfast one morning - we ordered one between 2 because there was so much food on the list we knew it would feed us both - and it did! - just don't get the poached eggs - they tasted like vinegar. From this hotel we could walk to darling harbour, the rocks, china town and the concierge directed us to stanley st on one occassion which was great as a locals strip of dining. There is also plenty of shopping in walking distance - which makes this hotel great for a holiday. The rooms are basic, so wouldn't stay here if I planned on staying in. The room service butter chicken was yummy too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: LoveitalyEssex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of January and was delighted with our choice.From the maids to the check-in and everyone else it was a great stay.We were on a B&B arrangement and it was really worth it,I could have skipped eating midday if I had wanted to!!. The location is great--very near Darling harbour and about 10 minutes walk from Circular Quay.Will definately stay here again next time we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience overall... shame they charge so much for internet though...”
Reviews.Author: drb1234
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, great rooms, comfortable bed, friendly staff, reasonable rate. Only complaint is that AUD25 for internet per day is pretty outrageous. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Grace is just okay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_was_a_horse
Reviews.Content: The Grace Hotel offers a great location and large (if spartan) rooms. However, the price is high and the service is practically nonexistent. Not the right combination. We had to carry our bags to our room ourselves. They would not loan out a plug adapter but were willing to sell us one for $15. If you drink a beer from the fridge you will be charged $8 though it costs less than $2.50 at a store. The late night menu is very very limited. I suppose I am only SO disappointed with this hotel because I paid so much to stay here. If I had it to do over again I would have paid even more to have a room at a more service-oriented hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: gavve60
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in deluxe twin 4th floor. Room quite large with the softest beds and pillows, as stated earlier the bath is very high and if short or elderly you would need to use the hand rail. Bath products just okay. Hotel clean and well decorated. Hotel parking $40.00 extra. Front desk a little off putting at both check in and check out, both staff not very welcoming which I think it is not very professional. Went to cafe x 2, first time walked out as no service, 2nd time for breakfast where wait staff did not inform us of a combination breakfast deal which we had paid for, until we asked when paying our bill. We were then informed we could have the extras but by had no time left so declined. It is the little things that count and made us feel a little ripped off. If you want a hotel close to darling harbour and the rocks and a very nice furnished room, then this is the place. Shame about the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mahalo65078
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. Easy walking distance from Darling Harbor, Circular Quay or great shopping. The pool and fitness center leave a lot to be desired and breakfast in the second floor restaurant is "very grossly over rated and over priced." The room was clean and comfortable. Loved the Irish restaurant downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: AndyEngland
Reviews.Content: Its location in the middle of the Central Business District means its great for the shops, Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. Access from the airport is direct and simple with Wynyard and City Hall stations close by. Nice historic building renovated into an Art Deco style. Superb room and a really comfy king sized bed. You don't choose this hotel for its views from the bedroom windows. You will need to pay a lot more for a flashier hotel near Circular Quay. We liked the hotel very much and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: baalamb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grace Hotel for 2 nights on a secret hotel deal through needitnow.com for $150 night. Our room was a twin with 2 king single beds which were extremely comfortable. Being an old building I expected it to be a bit old inside but they have renovated the main areas and the rooms really well. The shower had good water pressure and didnt leak all over the place like I have found in a lot of other hotels -be warned though if you have mobility problems the shower/bath is up fairly high to get into -they have a sign saying they can provide handles/rails if required though. We had the buffet breakfast which was good, nice selection and the service was very good, coffee and tea constantly offered and plates cleared away promptly. Pool area is currently being renovated so is not in use at the moment. This hotel is within walking distance to city centre, monorail & town hall train station and darling harbour so you can not beat it for location. Overall a really good sydney hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “A graceful hotel at the centre of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Clara_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Grace for 5 days while in Sydney and absolutely loved it. Our bedroom was modern, clean, with a very comfortable bed. The hotel was conveniently situated, within walking distance of the harbour and therefore not far from excellent restaurants . The hotel has been renovated in its original 1920s art deco style, which we found most attractive.Their hair salon came in handy and we sampled their restaurant which had quite a good variety of dishes but the staff were rather impersonal. Breakfasts were excellent. While we were there, the pool was being refurbished but should be back in action before Christmas.All in all, a stylish hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and building”
Reviews.Author: DorCologne
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice building, pretty lobby and Restaurant. We stayed twice and loved the room, the bathroom and exceptionally comfortable bed. We had two very enjoyable stays at the Grace.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: sukiah
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Executive Heritage Room which was on the higher floors in Jan 2008. Pros: Great Bed and Pillows Location to Darling Harbour Cons: At Check-in I asked the staff member to confirm breakfast was included and they advised no it wasn't. I thought this was odd given we were staying in one of their best rooms at the time and it wasn't cheap. Post stay I discovered breakfast was included. I made a complaint and they resolved it to my satisfaction. Room was dusty and the bathroom needed better cleaning View was looking out onto rooftops Came back from dinner in Darling Harbour on a weeknight and the bar had closed at 9pm. There was a band-aid at the bottom of the pool

Reviews.Title: “grace hotel”
Reviews.Author: reddevil1999
Reviews.Content: great place to stay loverly room comfortable king size bed ,room very clean .Hotel handy to shops and restaurants and a friendly irish bar downstairs .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - watch out for telephone in room - $10/minute”
Reviews.Author: dissappsc0t
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at The Grace, but we were really taken aback at the cost of using the phone in room, we stayed in 3 different hotels in Australia, sister-in law used all phones in rooms apart from here - lucky her - cost us $10/minute - 14 mins to UK - $135.00 - shocking, it actually put all 6 adults off going there again

Reviews.Title: “The Grace has quiet sophistication but service for all to enhance your stay”
Reviews.Author: Glenis19
Reviews.Content: This hotel has quiet class. Any queries regarding facilities and sight seeing are answered without hestitation and very professionally. The Grace is conveniently situated for sight seeing with everything at hand. After a day of sightseeing relax at their or attached restaurants and bars. One of which will cover all tastes and pockets. Then off to a well appointed room with all the amenities you require. Overall your stay will be a very pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Way too slow!”
Reviews.Author: welsh_in_adelaide
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel - really pretty interior and rooms. BUT - incredibly slow service! When we arrived our room wasn't ready - the reception staff had no idea if the room had been cleaned. So we disappeared for 3 hours - still no room. We waited for another 40 mins in the lobby and only got a key after pointing out that other customers had checked in and left with a key to their rooms and refused to move until we got ours. Had another 45 minute wait for our bags to be brought up - phoned down to find out what was going on and was met with a surprised tone and lots of giggles from the desk staff - most unprofessional. Booked a wheelchair accessible room but didn't get one, shower screen broken, lights wouldn't switch off (they refused to be turned off!). We were really looking forward to this hotel but left really disappointed - never again. On the plus side - good location and easy to get to lots of the main attractions. Beautiful building.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic base to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: blutorpedo
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and well furnished. It was in a perfect location to explore Sydney. I would go again without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Really spacious!”
Reviews.Author: kiraywm
Reviews.Content: The room was much more spacious than anticipated, and the bed was really comfortable for my bad back. Service was great both at reception & room service. Everything was clean, bathroom amenities sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Graciful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kpiddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights over a weekend for my Birthday. Got a great rate online through expedia for $90 and $95 per night in a King deluxe room. Location is fabulous, close to shops and many attractions, easy walking distance. The room was enormous, clean and serviced daily. Used the gym once, equipment was in good condition. Loved the range of tv channels on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a Closer Look”
Reviews.Author: BurtonRustle
Reviews.Content: A very positive experience for a first time visitor to Sydney--would definitely stay here again. I spent a very pleasant two days here in August 2009. Friendly staff and pleasing art deco style. The hotel was built in the early 1930s as a flagship department store, later acquired by the government as used as a headquarters by Douglas MacArthur's during. WWII. Thoroughly remodeled in the 1990s and converted to a hotel. Pros: Location--Central Business District, about 15-20 minute walk to Circular Quay (harbor area). Numerous stores and sights within walking distance. Room--Clean, well appointed and equipped. Flat screen TV, but no refrigerator. Quiet--No discernible street noise from my 4th floor room. Quirks and Cons: To use the bathroom and entry light you need to insert your room card into a slot near the door--an energy saving 'feature' It took a call to the front desk to figure out what was wrong with the lights. Skip the Brasserie on the second floor--the one meal I had there (breakfast buffet) was mediocre at best, Perhaps the entre meals are better. In contrast, the breakfast I enjoyed at the ground floor Cafe was very good. The Irish Bar on the ground floor looked fun, but was very loud and crowded--as should be expected on a weekend night. The Business Center charges $11 per hour for internet service on their two computers. I don't know if they have WiFi, or how much it costs. I didn't use the parking garage, so can't comment on it. One standout restaraunt for me was the "Redoak Boutique Beer Cafe" (http://www.redoak.com.au/) which was a block away out the back door of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “terrific”
Reviews.Author: sandburn
Reviews.Content: what a fantastic hotel very central for all the sights and the shops. hotel reception staff were friendly and welcoming rooms spacious and clean will definately stay there again next time I visit Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 star value in central city”
Reviews.Author: Tferrari
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel unless you are looking for 5 star luxury. Great rooms - very comfortable beds, quiet rooms, great staff. Location is within walking distance of all Sydney attractions. I have stayed here several times and never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Total Deal!”
Reviews.Author: vhutton
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about booking online and not knowing the city but the price was just too tempting, and I thought "well how bad can it be?" The Grace Hotel was great. My room was perfectly clean, modern, and enormous. Ditto for the bathroom. The concierge was great, and the location was totally central to everything I wanted to see and do, and that was on foot which made it even more fantastic. The only thing I would say is that the neighborhood is a bit like the equivalent to midtown, eg, lots of high rises etc, but that's a trade off to be able to walk to all the sites, so I totally recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a Gem”
Reviews.Author: mmdownunder
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Grace Hotel regularly. The rooms are spotless and staff are very helpful. This Hotel is located right in the heart of downtown Sydney and the building has some amazing history behind it (a must to read and learn about during your stay). The hotel retains lots of its original features marble staircases etc but the one thing I like about the Grace Hotel is it is a solid building and very quiet at night. The Grace provides all the services expected of a 1st class hotel and there are plenty of options for food and entertainment nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Don't need to look any further”
Reviews.Author: Mame53
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 days, room was kept well serviced, staff very friendly and courteous and nothing was too much trouble. Location was good for what we wanted; easy walk to either Darling Harbour and a bit longer to Circular Quay. Had dinner in hotel a couple of nights and the meals were good, other restaurantsâ€™ nearby. Or head to The Rocks, some lovely restaurantsâ€™ there. Would recommend The Grace to anyone and will be returning. Compare discounts, can vary greatly.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed, never again.”
Reviews.Author: bekky-boo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a few of Sydney's 5 star hotels and this is definately not somewhere I would return to. On a recent stay at the Jamison where the staff welcome and greet you at the door, take luggage to your room and have ample parking available under the hotel this place was closer to 3 star than 5. There was no welcome, no sight of a concierge and as the parking station was full we were told to park 2 blocks away in a public parking station where we had to pay daily rates and where we could not take our car out unless we wanted to pay an hourly rate of $10-20. When we arrived in our room we were very happy with the spaciousness and the comfortable bed but the furnishings were rundown, had obvious scratch and scuff marks on them and we had a lovely view of the club next door. Breakfast was good, nice service here from staff and the buffet had a lot of variety. Unfortunately the problem was with the staff. Whilst in the a bar within the building I badly injured my foot and needed bandaids. When my husband requested these from reception he was refused then questioned about his occupancy at the hotel. Only when he fought to prove he was staying did the receptionist offer to call to get some (and asked him to wait 10mins). When both myself and my husband were returning for the bandaids the receptionist was closing the doors to enter reception 5 feet in front of us. He turned, shut, then locked the doors and rudely ushered us out onto the street to walk around the block to the front door!! (My feet bleeding and no shoes on) When we got to reception the new receptionist knew nothing about bandaids but got them for us straight away. When this was mentioned to the manager in the morning he was very apologetic and said he would investigate and call us in the next two days. We recieved a call from him SEVEN days later stating that the 'receptionist did not recall the incident but he was sorry anyway'. Working in this industry for 5 years that is the first time I have ever heard a manager of a 5 star hotel tell an unhappy customer that his staff don't remember the incident but he is sorry if it happened. He might as well have told us that as far as he was concerned we made it all up. Not exactly what I expected. If you are going to shop this is a great location but I would recommend you stay at the Swissotel or the Westin which are equally as close but 20 times better value if you want to feel welcome and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Deserving of 4.5 star rating and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Li_Li
Reviews.Content: We decided to be tourists in our own city for a weekend and chose the Grace Hotel since we got a good deal through the Entertainment Book. We were impressed with the hotel. It was well presented (the art-deco restoration has been done very well), the staff we encountered were helpful and courteous, the room (superior king) was very spacious, clean and everything was in good working order. Lots of in-room movies to choose from. Room service was efficient and the menu sufficient. Breakfast was very good (banana bread and garlic sourdough being the highlights!). Lunch at the Grace Cafe was very nice and they make the best Haigh's hot chocolates! Only disappointment was that the spa area was closed off for renovation. The sauna and steam room were great, but the pool was a bit small. The location is excellent for city sights and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: alymurr
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney for a short visit to see a show, the Grace Hotel was a wonderful place to fill in the gaps between the show & a few tours. The staff were great, & the location worked well for us. Our room was a little noisy from activities near the hotel, but I guess Sydney is a busy place. The TV didn't work when we checked in, but they sent someone fairly quickly to fix it. Overall an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: gogram
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grace on Easter week-end. The location is good, within walking distance to the harbor and Opera house and shopping. We did not find the staff to be particularly helpful when it came to information about tours or things to do. If the brochure wasn't on the rack then they weren't very well informed about the attraction. Watch out if you have to make a phone call to a mobile phone from a hotel phone. Our 10 min. call to our contact person in Sydney cost us $38 and she was 2 blocks away. When we complained about it to the management they just said that was the cost of calling a mobile phone. After staying for a month in New Zealand and Australia this was our least favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem Right in the Cente of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Savages
Reviews.Content: We only booked in to the Grace because we couldn't get our first choice - but were we in luck! This is a great hotel! It has slightly faded grandeur, really helpful staff, large comfy rooms, is quiet despite being in the CBD (just ask for a higher floor) and it's location is perfect - just a walk from everywhere! We walked to Circular quay, the Rocks, the opera house, Botanical Gardens, Hyde Park, Sky Tower, QVB, Darling Harbour etc etc. If you want to go further, we caught a bus to Bondi from round the corner & Wynyard rail station is just along the road. Having said that, the taxi's are cheap too - only Aus$30 to the airport - same as 2 train tickets! We stayed over New Years & the conceirge got us last minute tickets for a fireworks cruise - expensive but worth it for the experience & the uninterrupted views. This is now our official Sydney residence!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a night or 2”
Reviews.Author: Vaino
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grace for 1 night while in Sydney for business. It's an acceptable hotel for a business trip. Also the room service breakfast was very good, although a bit pricey at $24 for what was in effect ceral and crossant. For anything other then a short business trip though the little things would annoy me. The fact that the lights don't work unless you but the key in the slot in the wall, something I'm used to for aircon but not the lights. This is extra annoying given that the room is pitch black while you search for the little slot in wall so you can turn on the lights. Another annoyance was the fact that the batch was really deep. Now this is great if your having a bath but when your having a shower it means you need to try and get your legs up so high you nearly fall over trying to get out of the shower. On the plus side the hotel is in a pretty good location, only a 5 minute walk to Darling habor. So all in all it's ok for a night or 2 but for a longer stay maybe look somewhere else. Also if work wasn't paying it would be a bit expensive at around $240 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: JesskaTwo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grace a couple of weeks ago as it was my anniversary and we wanted to stay somewhere in the city. I have been inside the hotel before for an site inspection and have wanted to stay there ever since. I was very impressed with how the hotel looked on the inside. We stayed in a superior room, room was spacious and comfortable. Bed was a king split but you couldn't tell. Best shower I have ever had - although it is quite a step into the shower. I liked the fact there was so many elevators, i think the longest we waited was a few seconds! We didn't utilise any of the facilites, it was perfect location in regards to restaurants and public transport. Will defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, poorly managed - but Ok for a short business trip”
Reviews.Author: travelbee2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near to the Tower, Convention Centre, Aquarium, Harbor etc. There is Internet and iron/ironing board in each room. This is all what I can positive about this hotel. The rest is very disgusting - drunken tour groups making late night phone calls to the felloe guests - and no intervention of the management despite of complaints. Poor food, bad staff hygiene - the cook picks a filthy piece of food from a plate and places the same plate back on the table. 14 dollars for one short local phone call, a travel enquiry - and no excuse for overpricing: " you must have been talking for very long". Tiny swimming pool, very inconveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, central location”
Reviews.Author: moonbather
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights whilst visiting our daughter who is spending a year down under. She recommended the location of this hotel as everything was within easy walking distance of hotel. Less than 5 minutes to Darling Harbour, 10 minutes to Circular Quay. In fairness we only used hotel for somewhere to sleep. Bed was exceptionally comfortable, towels soft and room clean. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as previously stated this was very expensive and there were a multitude of cafes around the hotel for coffee and breakfast. The equipment in the gym was perfectly adequate and better than several city hotels that we have stayed in. Pool really is only good for swimming few leisurely lengths but it is fairly explained as such in hotel literature. Concierge staff were exceptionally friendly. We would recommend this hotel without hesitation especially if there's a good deal going.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JoanneDavies
Reviews.Content: After searching for a decent hotel at a decent price we found this on hotel.com. Having stayed in Sydney before I knew where this was and so we booked it on the basis primarily of its position. However location wasn't just the great thing - hotel rooms were spacious and looked recently refurbished. The concierge was exceptionally helpful, giving advice on trips, helping us book them and generally always being friendly Definitely worth a visit, especially if you can get it at the knock-down prices we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great Grace”
Reviews.Author: PoeticCrayon
Reviews.Content: A beautiful art deco building, the Grace has plenty of information for tourists, and even a souvenir shop. Having said this it is not "touristy" It is elegant and beautiful. They have paired modern room interiors with the historic lobby and building very successfully. There is a gym and a laps pool. They have 24 hour room service and two restaurants, although the buffet breakfast is very expensive. This isn't a problem as it is surrounded by cafes that serve all day breakfast. The staff were really helpful and happy. The Irish pub that is part of the ground floor has a really nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Madgey
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Grace Hotel with my mum and we both loved it. The location was perfect for the purpose of our trip....shopping! Very close to Myer, David Jones and the QVB. The room was a decent size, not huge but adequate. The bathroom was small with the shower over the bath, which is not everyone's cup of tea. The room had everything you would expect and was well maintained. The buffet breakfast was enjoyable apart from the $4 cappuccino, maybe stick to instant coffee! Room service was also tasty and arrived in record speed. There are plenty places to eat in and around the hotel but room service was a great option after walking around the city all day. The hotel staff were friendly and check-in/ check-out were relatively easy. My only gripe with this was I wanted to give my credit card as a deposit (which is standard in most hotels) and then pay my bill with cash. They insisted that this wasn't possible as the hotel actually charges the card before you have checked out. Therefore I had to give a cash deposit of $100 a night which was refunded on check-out. I just find this annoying and inconvenient. Despite this, I would stay again as the location is just so great.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm in good location”
Reviews.Author: PennyScotland
Reviews.Content: For a young country, The Grace Hotel has a fair degree of old world charm but it is not shabby. Our room was modern, elegant but slightly on the small side (however about right for a 4* hotel). The gym is small and the pool is very small and really only suitable for younger children. Location is good, being about 10 minutes walk to Darling Harbour and 15 mins to Botanical Garden and Circular Quay. Main shopping areas only a few streets away. Staff were very helpful and friendly at all times. Hotel meals were good but overpriced compared to the dozens of alternatives within walking distance. An Irish themed pub, PJ O'Briens, is within the hotel but does not appear to be part of it. It attracts a young crowd and offers reasonable meals and good beer. Overall view: We liked The Grace and apart from the restaurant prices thought it was good value for money. We would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: janetravelsKent
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were allocated our rooms promptly and all given interconnecting rooms which was good as we had children travelling with us. The rooms were clean and noise was not a problem as we were allocated rooms away from the high street. The service was good, but there was no-where to sit and have a drink with the children in the evening as it was adult only in the bar upstairs. The irish bar in the hotel seems a priority and we felt like we had to fight through the crowds to get to our hotel at night. This is rated as a four star, but I would say it is more a 3 star due to the facilities it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Greglorious
Reviews.Content: We visited the Grace Hotel in Sydney for 4 days during our honeymoon in October. The location cannot be beat - it's within walking distance of all the major Sydney attractions, food, shopping, Chinatown, everything. The hotel itself, while very pretty and clean, was nothing but average for the price. Compared to some of the other places we stayed, the accommodations were nice but not overwhelming. The hotel seemed to cater more to business travelers than pleasure travelers (is that a thing, pleasure travelers?), and the included amenities (beyond the very nice fitness center and sauna) were fairly light. Internet services were expensive, as well. A nice place to stay, and the location is great, but for the price, we felt a little underwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Desert__Duo03
Reviews.Content: We spent a total of 5 nights at the Grace Hotel and overall it was acceptable. We decided to stay here as a cheaper alternative to the Marriott Harbour hotel. The price was very attractive and the location was great. Itâ€™s within walking distance from everything we needed to get to â€“ Sydney Harbour, Darling Harbour, shopping. It took about 15 minutes to walk to the Harbour. We easily walked during the day and at night. One drawback was that the concierge service functioned as mainly a bell hop service. They were too busy to make thoughtful suggestions about restaurants, etc. The front desk staff was good, and nicely accommodated our request for a different room. I would recommend a room on a higher level and facing the less busy street to minimize the street noise. The hotel seems to cater to the weekday business traveler and large tourist groups. Overall, the hotel was fine. Thereâ€™s nothing special about it and nothing terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: jonadPerth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Grace. He on business and I for leisure. We enjoyed everything about it. The room was spacious, well equipped and very clean with a king size bed (Deluxe Room). We were on the 5th floor and could faintly hear the buzz of cars below, but not enough to disturb us. I did hear youths on the Friday night having a bit too much fun, but my husband slept through it. We had dinner at the Irish PJ O"Brien one evening and it was filling, tasty and well priced. It is very well located, very close to the main shops and the QVB and about 5-10 walk to a train station. Also an easy walk to Darling Harbour. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Carolandtom
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at The Grace Hotel. Rooms were a good size and very clean and comfortable. We looked out on the street, but the noise was never a problem. It is within walking distance of Circular Quay as well as the Queen Victoria Building (which we really enjoyed). Had their breakfast buffet and it was adequate and reasonably priced. The best part about The Grace was its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbmm
Reviews.Content: We had two nights this past weekend at The Grace, staying in a Superior Room. A graceful building and a refurbishment sympathetic to its historic nature. The hotels location must surely be hard to beat. We were an easy walk from the theatre, Sydney tower, Darling Harbour and George Street (shops!). It wasn't even that long a walk down to the Rocks and Circular Quay. We are generally easy going guests and didn't tax the hotel staff at all. Check in and check out were quick and efficient. However because of our very early arrival time our room was not ready when we arrived. On returning to the hotel about 4pm the room was ready but we had to chase up our bags and I ended up literally getting them myself from the luggage storage area (to be fair it seemed maybe 2 tour groups had arrived as there was luggage all over the lobby so the porters were pretty busy). Our room was on the 9th floor so was almost shielded from the noises of the city but not completely. However I figure some noise is the price you pay for a central city hotel. Still I didn't appreciate the police sirens at 4am or the helicopter hovering outside both mornings (delivering equipment to the rooftop of a nearby building). The room itself was an Ok size, no comfortable seating which annoys me and an old TV, with only a few channels to choose from. Shower over bath is also annoying, especially in what is essentially a reasonably modern hotel. Amenities were basic, standard horrible hotel coffee and UHT milk. No robes but otherwise everything else seemed fine. Housekeeping wasn't totally sharp, they only washed out one of our coffee mugs and neither of our used water glasses, there were significant smudges on the windows but otherwise the room was very clean. Overall we had a good stay and the above is really being pretty picky I would certainly happily stay again, especially for the price we paid. I do not know what sort of rating the hotel has but in my mind it was a good 3.5 star property. It could easily be a 4 star with a few improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - more of a tourist hotel than a business one”
Reviews.Author: pommie01
Reviews.Content: I'd heard good things about the Grace, and I had a chance to stay there when my usual Sydney hotel was full. And overall it was quite nice. It's correct to say that the lobby and other art-deco architecture is spectacular. The rooms are of a good size, as are the beds - pretty much what you would expect at this price point - nothing outstanding, but no problems. TV had a good selection of channels - but was waaaay too small, and old for this price point. Time for some flat screen hi-def love please guys. I had a smallish sofa that was quite comfortable. Bathroom was good - but shower was in bath rather than standalone - which is not my preference. View was only internal to an internal courtyard and other rooms. Due to the fact that this is an old building - the elevators seem to be a problem - you have to wait a long time between them - and when they arrive they are often packed. Staff - a bit quiet and a little grumpy, although effiecient enough. I've been spoiled by other places I think. My package had the breakfast included in the restuarant on the 2nd floor. Was pretty standard - with a good western and eastern selection. Nothing too fancy. Weirdly the Bacon was of the streaky American type rather than the standard Aussie/English type - this may reflect the nationality of much of the clientel (which appears to be elderly American package tourists). There is a cab rank right outside the hotel - and the drivers seem very very disappointed and grumpy if you aren't going to the airport. This happened to me twice.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: UkJetlag
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect, with a 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour and a 15 minute walk to the Opera House. We requested a high floor room on arrival, and they accomodated us with a 13th floor room. The room was spacious, clear and tidy. We didn't hear any noise from surrounding bars. P J O'Brians Irish bar situated within the hotel does good food and drink, but gets very busy Thursday to Saturdays. Conceirge was very helpful. The fitness room was nice. I would recommend this hotel when staying in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Suey52
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels around the world. For the price you can not beat this hotel. I stayed for 9 nights and the location was great. They bumped me to the 11th floor and I never heard street noise. The workout facilities are good for a hotel. The concierge help was great. Ask them to get you a private driver if you want to avoid the tour trap. Ours was great! It was less expensive than the tour. The only complaint was the internet charges. Be careful because there are daily charges and hourly charges and it is not easy to tell which you are being charges for. There is a cheap internet cafe a 1/2 block away. I would use it. The best part of this hotel is location location location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pakole
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. I was pleased with the experience. I spend two nights there. I only have two items of note that might have influence my decision on this hotel. First note is the internet is not free. I do not know where I read it that said that internet was included, but you have to pay a daily or hourly fee. The Hourly fee was 12.95 AUS, while the daily was 24.95 AUS. It was real easy to connect through the wired cable the hotel provided. They listed some common problems and solutions to those problems as well on a little pamphlet. The internet was reasonably fast. It definitely satisfied my desire. The second item of note was the gym closed at 9:30PM. My days are long, and I usually required late night access to a gym. The view from my room on the fifth floor was limited, but expected for the price and location. The location placed me within walking distance to so many markets, areas to eat, and attractions. The only taxis I had to use were work related activities. The area around the hotel has a quieter night life compared to other areas of Sydney, but I wanted that, so I was quite pleased. The area around the hotel provided food up until midnight which was the latest I tired to eat something. Inside the hotel, there were two stores, a restaurant, and a bar. You could stay inside the hotel and have a full experience. The iron included in my room was a hot plate type iron. The hotel also uses your hotel key as the source of power, so you need to keep the key in a slot need the entry door to maintain power throughout the room. I also had a light on my dresser that I could not turn off. All in all, it was a great experience and I would recommend this hotel to most people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but watch out for the noise”
Reviews.Author: bettoneyvere
Reviews.Content: There are lots of nice things about this hotel but a couple of things to take note of. The room was nicely appointed, very comfortable, good amenities. Great breakfast. We booked direct with the hotel website, at a rate that included breakfast, but for some reason that did not show up on their reservation system ... so make sure that you have any confirmation details with you. The reception people did fix things quickly for us though. We stayed a Saturday night, on the 7th floor, overlooking King Street and the noise from the pub/bar/club across the road was VERY loud until way after midnight which was a real problem for me. If you're a light sleeper, try to get a room away from this kind of disruption. And we did find we could hear the TV and other noise from adjacent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grace”
Reviews.Author: ian1881
Reviews.Content: great hotel, nice and clean room, good location, great breakfast, great staff, love it , love it , love it....we stayed there for 4 nights and it was really pleasant... the concierge was really nice, we even got bumped to a nicer room..it was huge... location wise...the opera house is just 15 minutes walking distance...all and all... we had a really great time...a very nice place to come back to after a long day of sight seeing and shopping...we hope someday we can stay there again...thank you grace hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Grace”
Reviews.Author: NellyBean
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel - not cheap. this used to be store bulit by the Grace Brothers - the history of the building is on display at the hotel. Well situated for city attractions. definatley worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great value, just off the beaten tourist track”
Reviews.Author: AAMiles
Reviews.Content: I took a chance on this one, but had a good experience. It's located within walking distance of a lot of shopping, transit hubs, and restaurants. Perfectly nice place to stay in the city, especially if you get a deal, as I did. It gets a lot of convention goers or big business meeting parties, though, so you may have to contend with a lot of demanding folks. It's a restored classic, but the rooms are comfortable if a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Garota05
Reviews.Content: The Grace has been a fav of mine for a long time, and it keeps getting better. There aren't too many quality hotels in the central CBD area that are priced between $150-$200 and that offer what the Grace does. The rooms are very spacious and clean. The last time I stayed there I booked on wotif, paid around $170 for the night (Sat night) and received free parking, which I thought was excellent value for the city. If you're looking for a hotel that is 5 mins walk to George St, QVB, Pitt Street Mall, then the Grace is the place to stay. Is probably a 10-15 min walk to the Rocks/Circ Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal tourist hotel in central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: William18
Reviews.Content: The Grace is brilliantly situated right in the heart of Sydney, no more than 15 mins walk to most of the tourist attractions. Its a large hotel with very friendly and helpful staff, the rooms are a good size and very clean. The only downside was the restaurant; its small and breakfast isn't great. Drinks and evening food are found in the attached 'pub', again not ideal. Much better option is to eat out in the evenings and there's plenty of choice at Darling Harbour only a 10 minute stroll away. At this price, its a good choice for anyone wanting a conveniently situated hotel. As well as the usual sights, the aquarium at Darling Harbour is worth a visit, the botanical gardens are fascinating, and whale watching at migration time is a MUST DO!

Reviews.Title: “Should have been better”
Reviews.Author: AussieBella
Reviews.Content: Booked this room direct with the hotel. Was offered a rate including breakfast, gave credit card details to secure the booking and was given a confirmation number... Arrived late to the hotel due to flight delays, and given a smoking room which had a most unpleasant odour. Given that it was alread 11pm didn't have the energy to ask for another room... although in retrospect should have. Went to breakfast and told it was not included!! There was further problems booking out also. So... would recommend you get a written confirmation of your booking. I guess the problem with booking on the phone is that you don't have those little boxes to tick for non-smoking room! Recommend you check all details thoroughly.... Otherwise the hotel was fine but won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Honeyjj
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, very helpful staff. Rooms are very very nice and it also has a pool / jacuzzi / gym free to use as you want. Also very good location - just a 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour and the Aquarium etc. Very nice breakfast...and it was free as we stayed more than 3 nights. What more could you want!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HGL
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions of the Grace were not encouraging. Arriving at 10:30p.m. or so, we had to struggle from our car into the lobby with our luggage , with no assistance from any hotel staff. The reception area itself is large and 'cold' in appearance, although in keeping with the art-deco style of the hotel. Our room was clean and unremarkable, and although on the 9th floor, as previous reviewers have mentioned, the traffic noise was clearly audible. Where the hotel 'wins' is its' location. The Rocks, Sydney Opera House, CBD, Darling Harbour are all within 15 minutes stroll - no need for any taxis. Also there are numerous cafes close to the hotel for breakfast [at least during weekdays] If we ever return to Sydney we would not rule out returning to The Grace, but would probably look at other hotel option first.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ewoker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for two days as I had a conference at the hotel. The room was basic but it was clean and tidy. The service of the hotel was efficient and the concierge were helpful when needed. I was in the seventh floor and had a king size bed in my room. I did find the room to be quite noisy though from the aircon in my room. I also heard quite a bit of traffic noise from the street even on the seventh floor. The location of the hotel was fantastic. Close to the Sydney Habour and walking distance to Chinatown. So you will never have a problem finding good restaurants. If you are a gym junkie and are part of Fitness First there are two gyms within walking distance from the hotel (Market and Pitt Street gyms). Overall I enjoyed my stay and will consider staying at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very basic”
Reviews.Author: IRENOTA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good option if you are in Sydney for the very first time. Location is perfect to hang around the CBD, Darling Harbour and so. It is not very expensive but its services are very basic. Rooms are clean and ok, but never expect luxury. I went there six months ago and I have to say that I was satisfied but next time, IÂ´ll definetely choose a different option.
