Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: hodg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grace over New Year 2007/8. The hotel is in a good location for most things Sydney. About half way between Darling Harbour and The Opera house. Easy walking distance. Rooms were basic but ok, breakfast good and a very popular and good Irish bar linked to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Grace just OK”
Reviews.Author: gardenweed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grace at the beginning of Feb. for 4 nights. Check in went smoothly, concierge was helpful, bed was comfy, but the room was not laid out well. There was a couch and a chair in a little sitting area, however you couldn't see the TV from there, so we ended up using it to put luggage and clothes on. The breakfast was OK, nothing special and the coffee was not good. The hotel was a pretty good hike from the Rocks and main harbor area, and after a day or evening out in that area, we wished the hotel was closer than a long walk back or a cab ride. We did enjoy shopping in the nearby Queen Victoria Bldg. There also were some good restaurants not too far from the hotel that we dined at in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing city, good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RosieFlynn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Grace for 4 nights at the begining of March 08. After spending hours reading reviews here, I'm pleased with my choice. The location is perfect, although Sydney is such an easy city to navigate, but the hotels proximity to all the major tourist attractions is a bonus. I was in town on Business and arrived at the hotel at 7am, on the Saturday of the mardi gras, and was unable to check in any earlier than the advertised time of 2pm(it was a busy weekend I suppose) so I went for a stroll around the city and came back at 2ish to check in. My room was a nice size, the bathroom was ok, pretty standard, not what you woudl expect from a 4 star hotel. I had dinner in my room one night, which was really nice, good portions and well presented...however the guy that brought it to my room was really strange and didn't say a word, just stood there very nervously while I signed the receipt - very odd! I'd probable stay here again as it was resonably priced and in a good location, however last tiem I was in town I stayed at the Establishment, which was amazing, so I'll always check there first to see if I can get a good deal..other wise it'll be the Grace.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: elisha333
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grace for 5 nights during our honeymoon in Sydney. We chose the Grace because of reviews on tripadvisor, price and location. We were not disappointed. We were able to find a good rate on a travel website (maybe utell.com, sorry I forgot). Our rate included breakfast buffett every morning, which was really a savings! We had a big breakfast every morning and also took some fruit and snacks for lunch. We were luckily placed on the Heritage floor, which is the top floor of the hotel. I can't compare this floor to other floors but our room was spectacular. It was clean, large, modern furnishings with a extra deep bathtub. I loved the art deco style of the hotel and the location. It was in the business district of Sydney, but was a perfect location as it was only 10-12 minute walk from the Rocks, 5-10 minutes from Chinatown and 5 minutes from Darling Harbor. If we stayed down in the Rocks, like we originally wanted, we probably would have relied on public transportation or cabs more. But this was perfect walking distance from everything we wanted to see. The price was great compared to many of the other hotels we looked into and it was just a great hotel and we'll def. stay there again if we are ever back in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Grace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeSEAtrekker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grace for 2 nights in December and this was a quality hotel. It has recently been refurbished and its interior has been brought back to its original art deco syle from the early 1900s. The room was spacious and luxurious and the all aspects of our stay ran smoothly from the check in to the check out. The location was great very near to Darling Harbour and the main shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: mn2ca2az
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again. The customer service is awful, especially when there is a problem. I had to use the phone in the hotel. I called the operator/guest relations to find out the charge. It wasn't posted in the room and now I know why. I was told how much a local call was and also a call to a mobile phone. I called my friend and the following day, I went to the front desk to check my bill. The rate the person gave me on the phone was a flat rate not a per minute rate. The bill was charged a per minute rate. I had all the information from my call to the hotel the day before but the hotel didn't care. They would not help me. When I looked at my bill again, I realized that the rate they quoted me (as now a per minute) was less than they were actually charging me. I spoke to a night manager the day before checking out and he seemed will to help. However, he had to check with his general manager and he wouldn't be in until after I had checked out. I have emailed the hotel twice and they have not responded. I got my credit card company involved but the hotel is still not accepting responsibility, nor are they acknowledging the issue. I had names/dates/everything. So my recommendation is that you get it in writing from the hotel because they cannot be trusted if they give you incorrect information. They will deny it and pretty much call you a liar. I have traveled the world and never encountered such horrible customer service in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable, clean, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: HMcT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grace for 5 nights while on business. Although my office was in North Sydney, the Wynyard station was two blocks away and I could catch a train for the 7 minute ride to the North Sydney station - AUS $2.60 each way. My room was very large, with two beds, large bathroom, closet, television, small sofa, coffee table, and a desk. I didn't have a view but it didn't matter because there is so much to do in the immediate area, I was rarely in my room. The hotel is short (10 minutes) walking distance to The Rocks, Circular Quay, Darling Harbor, and many shops, restaurants, and transportation. There is a Woolworths grocer three blocks away if you prefer to purchase fruit, yogurt etc. for meals/picnics. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends any day.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel for a downtown stay”
Reviews.Author: Darlox
Reviews.Content: The Grace hotel is a reasonably nice property occupying a 1930's building in downtown Sydney. It has the "grand old" look of a classic National Trust building, but the rooms are quite basic. We spent two nights in the Grace just after New Year's 2008, and found it to be an acceptable, if unremarkable, lodging. Read on for details... LOCATION: The Grace is on York street, roughly equidistant between the Wynyard and Town Hall train stations. It's not immediately adjacent to anything with tourist interest, but it's an easy walk to most major locations including the Botanic Gardens, Aquarium, Sydney Tower, and some of the historic sites and museums. The hotel is perched on a street with several restaurants, pubs and clubs, so especially on weekend evenings, the surrounds can be a bit raucous. Request a room on a high floor or away from York if you're an early-to-bed sort. Additionally, the "vision-impaired" beeping crosswalk signals are located just below the York street-facing guest rooms, so a quiet but noticeable beep-beep-beep is a continual presence. Another reason to request a high floor. ROOMS: The rooms are basic but adequate. A small TV, bedside clock/alarm, overhead reading lights and the usual hotel furniture are all present. The bathroom is acceptable, except we had issues with hot water and pressure in the shower. The water pressure would "pulse" in the shower, and with each pulse, the water temp would swing a good 10-degrees. So showers were often an exercise in freezing and broiling, alternately. This evened out after the first day, so the problem would seem to be intermittent. The room had wired Internet (at a cost) available, an in-room safe, and plenty of closet space. SERVICE: We had no issues with the hotel staff. We arrived quite early in the day, and were immediately given a room well before normal check-in times. The staff answered our questions and were pleasant, even though they were not quite as helpful (especially the concierge) regarding arrangements outside the hotel as one would expect from a higher-end hotel. They did seem to make a solid effort though -- at one point when we had to leave a message at the front desk for another guest, they left a voice notification on their phone, slid a printed message under their door, and left an on-TV message for them! So, they're at least as thorough as they're able to be, for any given request. AMENITIES: The hotel itself is fairly basic, but the street-level amenities are pretty good. There is a trendy bar/tapas restaurant, a full-service cafe, a buffet Brasserie and an Irish pub in the building. Not world-shaking cuisine by any means, but perfectly adequate for a downtown meal, without paying the higher prices of the more touristy districts. Overall, the Grace is showing a bit of its age. The windows are slightly drafty. The fixtures have been polished a few times too many... But I believe the official description for somewhere like the Grace is that "it has charm". If you're into staying in the classic hotels, The Grace stacks up well to its generational counterparts around the world. All-in-all, if you're able to secure a good rate, there is no reason NOT to stay at The Grace. For most travelers who don't intend to spend too much time in their rooms, this hotel will serve adequately. But if you're going for a special occasion or a romantic weekend getaway, and don't mind paying a bit more, you're likely to find slightly fresher options within a short distance of this location.

Reviews.Title: “The Dis-Grace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: explore_&_indulge
Reviews.Content: I occasionally travel to Sydney for work or holiday and had the misfortune of the Grace Hotel being on my employers approved hotel list. Despite a specific request for a double room I was given a room with twin singles which were so short that my feet hung over the end and the sheets were 6 inches shorter than the bed at the bottom. The bath leaked to form a paddle pool in the bathroom obviously meant for the entertainment of the short children intended for the little beds. Management were not interested in either of these issues. I now always use Pacific International apartments at the Rocks which have comfortable beds for adults, great views of the Opera House and bridge and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grace”
Reviews.Author: SportMom04
Reviews.Content: Sydney was the last leg of our trip and we were looking forward to our stay at the Grace after reading the reviews. We were not disappointed. We found the staff very friendly and accomodating. The beds were comfortable and the room was good sized. I love the location since it is right in the middle of the city and close to some great places to eat and shop. You are a 10 min walk to the harbour by the aquarium. The breakfast was good but you can find some other places to eat that are a bit cheaper if you walk out around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Glassman77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grace Hotel for 6 nights over Christmas and we were very pleased with our choice. Perhaps the best thing about the hotel is its location - 5 minutes to Darling Harbour, 5 minutes to the main shopping streets and 10/15 minutes to the Rocks or Circular Quay. Our room was very smart and clean - if a little dark - and there's a good gym with a small indoor pool on the top floor. The service is very good. The concierge in particular is a real asset. The hotel cafe is also very good - serving very tasty modern Australian food at reasonable prices. We went to some really excellent restaurants during the course of our stay: Catalina (Rose Bay), Doyle's on the Beach (Watson's Bay), China Doll (Woolomolloo) and Wildfire (OPT). We also went to the cocktail bar in the Shangri La hotel, which was a lovely spot for a few sundowners.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: phillipsrhit
Reviews.Content: The Grace Sydney is a decent place to stay. It is a 15 minute walk to the harbour, but we were perfectly fine with the short walk through the city. There are closer hotels, but expect to pay more. There are places good places nearby at which to eat. The room was clean, but a little tight on space; we did manage just fine, though. No problems with check-in and the concierge was nice when helping us find some places to eat. If you can find a good deal on their website, like we did, then this is a safe bet for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Bruce Willis Movie, solid & dependable but won't win an Oscar”
Reviews.Author: JACKSONJE8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grace Hotel for 5 nights in October as part of a 16 day trip up the Oz East Coast. We paid about Â£120 a night with breakfast through hotelclub.net. We like the Grace Hotel and would stay it is definitely a dependable 4 star hotel. Rooms are a decent size and clean and modern - staff very helpful when needed - we were able to check in at 8am after a 18 hour travel marathon which I will be forever greatful for! Breakfast was good and we used the pool and jacuzzi up on the top floor a few times which was good as long as no one else was trying to use it as it is pretty small. The location is good, 5 minutes walk to Darling harbour and restaurants and bars and also the shopping of George Street. The Rocks and Harbour Bridge / Opera House is about a 15 minute walk. Overall I would recommend the Grace as a solid option for all travellers. The only thing that the hotel does not have is the wow factor - there is no opera house and harbour bridge view which is what it really needs to make the hotel 5 star but if you are looking for a cheaper option but still high quality then you won't go too wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Acommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: WWwalker
Reviews.Content: Nice size rooms in downtown Sydney. Walking distance to Harbour, Piers, Parks, Shopping, Monorail. Staff very helpful. Stayed on the phone for 3 days till airport found my luggage. Lobby stores not open during normal hours.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely SURLY, RUDE reception!!!”
Reviews.Author: MeganDublin_
Reviews.Content: Having travelled by plane for thirteen hours, I arrived at the Grace around 8.30a.m. on November 24th, 2007. The concierge and porter were very polite and welcoming and relieved me of my bags immediately. However, the member of reception with whom I had the misfortune to deal, was extremely SURLY and RUDE. I was understanding of the fact that, as I had checked in early, my room might not be ready. (However, on reading this website, I see that some people have been far more fortunate than I was and have been allotted their respective rooms on early check-in.) While I was waiting for my room, I went into the CafÃ© off the lobby for breakfast. The staff in there were very friendly and, on hearing that I had just arrived in Sydney for the first time, proceeded to give me advice on where to go and what to see in the immediate area. The breakfast was also excellent! Afterwards, I went back to sit patiently in the lobby, where I remained until after 10.00a.m. I then noticed a busload of people checking in and immediately going to their rooms. On observing this, I approached the reception desk to politely inquire why a room was not ready for me at this stage, as I had remarked on booking that I would be arriving early. The same member of reception I had encountered on check-in spoke to me, once again, in a rude and insulting manner. I then informed him that, in all my travels, I had never encountered such bad manners in any hotel staff. I requested to speak to the manager and, quietly but firmly, made him aware of my disgust at the treatment I had received from his colleague. He took this on board and assured me that he would deal with the problem. I stayed in the Grace Hotel for four nights in November and returned for two nights on December 9th and 10th. I was very satisfied with my accommodation on the first occasion and loved the upgrade I received when I came back. My room was on the eighth floor and was spacious and bright. I loved many things about this hotel - the beds (only in the Omni Parker House Hotel in Boston have I experienced beds as comfortable as those!), the art deco surroundings, the lifts!, the location (brilliant for shopping and sight seeing). As it was my first time visiting Australia, I think it was rather unfortunate that I had to meet up with the rudest person I ever met in a hotel reception, on my first morning in the country. All my other experiences in Sydney and Australia were brilliant! From other postings here, I notice that I am not the only person who has experienced rudeness from a member of reception at this hotel. I am of the opinion that some training in common courtesy is sadly lacking here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: barryandsam
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Australia, we were visiting our son and wanted a reasonably priced, central hotel. After much research, we chose The Grace for the first week of our stay. We needed to book a further 4 nights in Sydney following a week of travelling around NSW but waited until we had arrived in Sydney so we could look around the city and see if there was a better situated hotel. It was immediately clear that the location of the Grace was perfect - 5 minutes from Darling Harbour, 10 minutes from Hyde Park and 10-15 minutes from Circular Quay. We did check on a hotel near Circular Quay for our return stay but they quoted AUD435 per night, compared to AUD250 at The Grace! We had arrived from Hong Kong at 0810 and had gotten no sleep on the flight so were pretty tired. Our room was available for us when we arrived at the hotel at 10am, for which we were very thankful. So many previous reviews mentioned the comfortable beds so we were looking forward to testing it out, since I suffer from back pain. We had a look around Darling Harbour and got back to our room at around 5.30pm. By 6.30 we were asleep and woke up at 8.30 the next morning! How's that for a comfortable mattress! We slept through all our jetlag and were completely acclimatised when we woke up. The room was very nicely decorated, contemporary furnishings and was cleaned to a very high standard. An added bonus was the laundry room for guests use. As we were away for 5 weeks and were trying to travel light, we found it very useful to be able to wash our clothes without the expense of having to use the hotel's offsite laundry. When we checked out of our first stay, we reconfirmed our return and asked for a room on a higher floor than before. We were very pleased on our return to be given a room on the 10th floor, with great highrise views - we could see the Sydney Tower from our window! The only thing that was disappointing was the lack of a hotel bar - the new Bar 77 only opened the night before we left. There was an Irish bar which could be accessed from within the hotel's reception area but on the Saturday night, when we came back for the night and would have liked a nightcap, we found that the internal door was locked. The Assistant Manager came up to help us and said we would have to go out into the street and stand in the queue to get into the bar! The cafe was good for snacks but that, too, was for public use. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay at The Grace and would not hesitate in recommending it for anyone wishing a central location near to all the sights of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oskar07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our son and his girlfriend stayed at The Grace for 5 nights on our first visit to Sydney and we were very impressed. The rooms were large and well appointed, beds extremely comfortable, cleaning staff superb and in-house cafe was excellent. Most of all the building itself was my favourite art deco design. Instead of taking the lift I would walk down the elegant staircase from the 6th floor just to savour the authenticity of this wonderful building ! Looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice & Value if Staying in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: nj_group_diving
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Grace Hotel in Sydney. The service at the Hotel was awesome. The front desk and concierges responded to any questions or issues we had immediately. The elevators were fast and you hardly waited more than 15 seconds for one. The rooms were a little small, but immaculate, clean and comfortable. Not sure about the previous poster on the bathrooms, but I had a bathtub that was actually pretty deep so I could take a nice bath if I wanted to (Stayed in Premium King Room). The hotel is not right in the Sydney Harbor/Rocks Area, but is only about 5-6 blocks so either walking or a Taxi can be taken. I loved the hotel and the Heritage look/feel of the place. If I ever go back to Sydney, I'm staying there, no question about it.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms okay but the Bathroom -yikes”
Reviews.Author: JetLagPete
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated with reasonable rooms. I certainly wouldnt give the rooms the ratings some of the other travellers have. The bathroom was my main problem, there is NO bath just a shower. The shower shares the bathroom floor and only has a curtain to contain the water ... which it doesnt. You land up standing in the middle of a pool of water in the bathroom. Calls to houskeeping for additional towels for mopping up, despite assurances, never appeared. The problematic internet connection, which reception promised to have fixed was also not attended to. Not impresssed.

Reviews.Title: “The Grace - worthy of the high rating”
Reviews.Author: Meeten
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel at 10am after a flight from NZ, and the hotel had a room for us to check into . We though taht we would have to leave the bags there and go explore the city till a room was available. Good start! Saw the room and was not v pleased. Nothing wrong with it, except that it was facing another building. Went to reception and told them that i was not pleased (we had seen another room whilst it was being cleaned on the other side and it was much brighter and had a slightly better view). Reception looked into other availabel rooms and said tha if we could come back at 3pm, the new room would be available. RESULT. WE did have a wonder about and when we came back ther ewas a different reception team but the room was sorted and we got a room with more natural daylight. Additionally we were provided complimentary breakfast for hte 3 nights that we were there - a nice touch. Overall, the location of the hotel is great, the room was good size, staff were helpful. COffee whilst having breakfast was pretty poor. Would I stay there again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “definetely not 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: serialweekenders
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel as we are frequent visitors to 5 stay properites and are huge fans of art deco buildings. We also usually follow the reviews of tripadvisor. We arrived at the Grace and discovered that there were no bell staff available to assist us. The staff member who checked us in was extraordinarlily surly and disinterested despite us paying for an extra nights accomodation to guarantee us checking into our room 4 hours early. The room we were had paid for (superior) was a good size and nicely furnished. There was a lack of soundproofing and the traffic from outside was most apparent. We ordered the same items 3 times from room service and each time we were charged a different amount. The concierege who was apparently a member of "les clefs d'or" was amazingly rude and unhelpful on more than one occasion. On the second night we asked to change room as the hotel opposite The Grace plays very loud music which due to the lack of soundproofing makes sleep impossible. Our room was changed without problem however no appology was offered. Finally upon checking out the same staff were on duty and again were disinterested in our experience. We were due to stay at the Grace later in the month however we opted to cancel our reservation and stayed at the Swissotel which was significantly better and a lot cheaper!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grace-ful”
Reviews.Author: lynji2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful art deco hotel, but getting a bit tired. Needs a bit of a sympathetic refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: bistomtom
Reviews.Content: I've lived here for 2 nights last month and it was a excellent experience to live in a historical building like this. I lived in the room 1013 and you could see the people walking down there on the street. The check in processes quickly and without problem. Staff were very friendly. Basically the hotel decorated with very warm and mature style so you wont feel any uncomfortable living in. The size of the room was not very big but at least alright for a sleep. The bathroom was spacious compare to the room. The location is the main reason i chose it. It is very close to market/george street where the main shopping area (QVB, Pitt st. The strand etc..) located and it is only a step away (take 8-15 min easy walking to the rock & circular quay or darling harbour if you like to walk around) If you would like to grab something easy to eat at morning or during nights, its not far away reaching Woolworth where you could get some dairy, fresh fruit. Also it takes only around 5 mins to town hall station or bus stations around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: shortstufff
Reviews.Content: This place is phenomenal, definitely one of the greater hotels that i've stayed at. I stayed at the Grace hotel for a special occaison and the Grace hotel fit the importance of the occaison. We booked the "King Corner": to call the room lavish is understating its beauty. The decor was gorgeous: i'd recommend this place for romantic getaways and business trips and any other excuse you could find to stay at this place. These reviews are not understating the case when they say these are the most comfortable beds in Sydney (and well worth the price paid for them). the size and comfort of our room was well worth the price paid (which compared to some of the other hotels in Sydney is not a great deal at all). To top it off, $35 all day parking in sydney on a weekday- an absolute steal! (usually $50-55 or more) AND, a full hot buffet breakfast was given to us at a discounted rate (Incredible array of well prepared and delicious breakfast options to choose from). I'll definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed, Stylish, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TallulahB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August 2005 based on tripadvisor reviews. After the long flight from the US I wanted to know I found the best bed in Sydney. And it was. The hotel was quiet, clean and stylish. I had an interior room that had no view but I was just looking for dark curtains and help in gettting over jet lag. It was conveniently located. It was very easy to walk to Darling Harbour or the ferry terminal. I even managed to get there from the airport using the Metro (although it was a little bit of a walk with a wheelie suitcase). Overall I would stay here again in a second. Although didn't like the downstairs restaurant. Not much selection, pricey and not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Grace is Great”
Reviews.Author: bundyone
Reviews.Content: Over the past 6 years, I have probably spent close to 6 weeks in total at The Grace. I recently travelled to Sydney for work and was given the choice of either the Hilton or The Grace, and chose the Grace. That is how much I rate the Grace in Sydney. Beds are near to the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in, the location is good (in the middle of everything) and I never have any problems with the service of the staff, rooms are well appointed. Even if travelling to Sydney for a weekend away, I always endeavour to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars Plus!!!”
Reviews.Author: shopaholic70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Grace earlier this month (July) for 2 nights and absolutely LOVED it!!! From the moment we arrived until we left we noticed how nothing seemed too much trouble for the staff. We pulled up in the taxi and the doorman opened our door immediately and welcomed us warmly and took care of the luggage. We walked into the foyer and right away felt impressed - it looks great! The staff were very courteous, professional and welcoming from start to finish. We arrived early and they gladly stored our luggage until our room was available and did the same thing on the day of our departure, so we could shop all morning and into the afternoon without having to worry about carting luggage (& all the shopping we'd already done) all over Sydney. The room was fabulous & huge! It looked like it had been painted recently and was so spacious. We stayed in a family room on the 8th floor and got a great deal on wotif.com for 2 adults and 2 children plus full buffet breakfast (divine!!) for all of us. It had a lovely king size bed and great double fold out sofa bed. We didn't dine in the restaurant but had the best steak sandwich I've ever had from room service. It was huge and came with a large serve of french fries and a bread roll as well - $19 but well worth it!! All in all it was a fantastic stay - can't rave about it enough - and can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...so sad to leave!”
Reviews.Author: UnitedStatesMember
Reviews.Content: It was so hard to leave the Grace when our trip to Australia ended...it was marvelous! Never before have I experienced such magnificent service than I did at the Grace Hotel. Our room was several floors up, with a wonderful view of downtown Sydney. We had two queen beds (I was traveling with my father on a business trip), and the room was spacious, extremely clean, and equipped for virtually any need that might arise! (This was the first time I had seen a telephone in a bathroom.) The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and the concierge recommended many good restaurants and sights to see. The bellhops helped us get our luggage out of our taxi when we arrived, and helped get it back into a taxi when we left for the airport. Our last night in Sydney my father took me upstairs to the exercise room and swimming pool. The pool was marvelous...very warm water, and brightly lit up. The best part? No other people! I had the entire pool to myself, and had an excellent swim. I would definitely recommend the Grace Hotel to anyone who comes to Sydney...please ignore the bad remarks, because they just aren't true.

Reviews.Title: “Great to stay at the Grace”
Reviews.Author: peoria_gal
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 4 nights at the Grace Hotel at the end of April 2007 and couldn't be happier with the decision. It has a great location, as it is within walking distance to all of the major Sydney attractions. Darling Harbor is very close, which gives a lot of great options for evening dining. The rooms were always clean and crisp. It isn't often that you love a bed other than the one at home, but both of us raved about the beds. If you want a comfortable night sleep close to attractions, then the Grace Hotel is probably the right choice for you. Lastly, don't forget to do rate searches on more than the standard websites. I booked the hotel on an Australian internet site and saved quite a bit of money.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, perfect location, incredibly comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Risky_Rat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real beauty. Great location in the centre of everything. Great price. And the bed was sooo comfortable. The rooms are a bit small, but if you are just planning on sleeping, then it doesn't really matter. Book a room today, just to sleep in the massive, luxurious bed.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: sulumanly
Reviews.Content: we have just had a night at the grace and loved it! My husband and i just had our 8 year wedding anniversary at the grace. we only stayed there because we could not get into the park hyatt. I am extremely fussy and have booked out of so many hotel rooms all over the world. we booked a heritage room which is on the 11th floor. it is reasonably spacious, no outlook to mention but bright not dark and dingy. we booked on wotif.com and got a good deal including breakfast, turndown and chocolates ( which never came) i dont know what the other rooms are like but the heritage level is very nice. it is a lovely old building, beautifully restored. It is clean and the staff were friendly enough. the concierge staff were particularly helpful and welcoming. the great find with this hotel is the position. i am from sydney and for anyone wanting to be in the heart of the city -this is the place. we had lunch in the david jones food hall, always a treat. walked through the strand and the queen victoria building. walked to dinner at the summit, which was so nice we just had cocktails and champagne watching the wonderful view unfold. this was one of the nicest stays we have had in the city for a long time. the breakfst was nice as well. the price is reasonable, the old world charm was a delight, the position was the best. oh and the bed was sooo comfortable, a king bed that was soft and fluffy. it was quiet also, no street noise. we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Grace!”
Reviews.Author: aurora26Melb
Reviews.Content: Even though it was a few months ago, I had to write and let everyone know what a great place to stay. The heritage of the building is beautiful especially when you walk into the grand lobby through the original Grace department store doors. The floor tiling is spectacular and it's like stepping back in time. Adjacent to the lobby near the elevators, is a history of the building which is rather fascinating to read. We stayed on the 10th floor which is the heritage floor. Our window looked directly up at the Centrepoint Tower, which illuminated at night is wonderful. The decor is modern dark timber which is a favourite look of mine, yet the decor didn't detract from the building heritage. The floor above has the pool and gym. The pool is really a lap pool, we didn't swim there at all. Take a ferry out to Manly or a bus to Bondi and enjoy the beach culture whilst in Sydney. The hotel is located so central to the city shopping and eating. Eating is a short 5 minute walk to either King Street Wharf, Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay Wharf. We walked numerous times down to Circular Quay, however it is a good 15min walk but fairly easy. Sydney is rather pricey to eat, however I can recommended Velvet Slide at King Street Wharf and Blackbird at Cockle Bay for reasonable price eating. Ghengis Khan is great too. Some restaurants have specials on different nights. A full breakfast buffet was included in our room rate, however it was nothing spectacular and I can only say don't pay for it, it's not worth it. The hotel being run by a Malaysian consortium, I expected better, since staying in Malaysian resorts. There are plenty of great eating places out of the hotel that are a lot cheaper than paying for the buffet. There is a business centre available for use with internet for $5AU for half hour or $25AU for 24hours. It's rather expensive but I suppose it's all about convenience. Overall, I can highly recommend this hotel, it exceeded my expectations. I always like modern hotels but this was like stepping back in time and really appreciating the design of the gone era. I will definitely be staying here on my next visit to Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: CarlosPedro
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, excellent and friendly staff, centrally locate.

Reviews.Title: “The Grace is one of the best”
Reviews.Author: AccElan01
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at The Grace at 10am, our room was not ready, but concierge held our luggage while we went out and explored the city for the first time. Our room was ready by 2pm even though check-in time was not until 3pm. The hotel is very clean and well cared for. The room was large, modern and clean. It was definitely what we expected. We bought water and soda at Woolworth's (a few blocks away) and kept them cold in the mini bar fridge. The pool was small but whenever we used it we were the only ones there. The spas were on the cool side but it wasn't a big deal. The gym facilities were nice but we did not utilize them since we did so much walking in Sydney. The breakfast buffet was included in our stay, and we ate there every morning. It was very good and added value to the stay. The hotel location was excellent is is truly in the middle of everything. Anyone staying in Sydney that doesn't want to spend more than $1000 per night for harbor views should stay at The Grace.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: spired
Reviews.Content: We got a free upgrade at checkin to the top 'heritage floor' and the room was very nice...modern, spotless, well appointed. The bed/ linens/amenities were all top notch. We didn't have a view but that wasn't that important. The concierge was great too with recommendations, arrangements advice, and everything you expect them to provide. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: janines
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grace the week of March 26. I was able to get a rate of $157 through asiarooms.com. On check in I told the receptionist I read on this website someone who was upgraded by staying over 3 nights. She said she wasn't aware of this upgrade, but she did put us in an upgraded suite. We were very pleased with the room and all the amenities. It was a 4-5 star hotel and met the expectations. The hotel is also very convinient and central to all of Sydney. We were able to walk to Circular Quay , Prymont and Paddy's market in 15-20min walk. I would stay there again and recommend it to anyone. janines

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Kev&Tina
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - couldn't fault it, check in easy, room large, spotless and quiet!! Had an internal room, so the view wasn't up to much, but it did protect us from the noise of Mardi Gras!! Overall very good, wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “sell the kids if you have to”
Reviews.Author: kirven42
Reviews.Content: Thank you trip advisor reviewers for recommending The Grace.For location,quality,class and price, this hotel must be unbeatable in Sydney.We stopped for 2 nights at the end of a memorable first trip to Australia, and loved every minute.The air conditioning seemed to have a mind of its own,but no real problem.Try to get a rate that includes the superb-but expensive- buffet breakfast.I paid 225 AUD per night through Utell,but that included breakfasts worth 58AUD.Unless you enjoy wasting money,stay at this hotel.Incidentally,dont worry too much about location in Sydney.We were amazed at how compact the city is.Most places are within walking distance or a couple of stops on the undergound from the Grace.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal to see all the sights!”
Reviews.Author: kristelclarke
Reviews.Content: After we had travelled to Hayman Island for our wedding, Sydney was the next stop. We fell in love with Sydney from the moment we arrived. Hotel was perfect - conveniently located close to Darling Harbour and a short walk to the bridge and opera house. Rooms were spotless and service was excellent. Whilst in Syney I would go to the blue mountains - we hired a car and it took about 2 1/2 hours but was worth it! BONDI BEACH - is beautiful - one of the best beaches I have ever seen. Top tip - around the corner from the grace is a club called the 'bowlers club' - at the back is the best chinese restaurant we had ever tasted!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: monkeechops
Reviews.Content: This hotel immediately hits the spot....its location in the CBD of Sydney. Slight problem upon checkin, but we were a bit early but this was soon sorted for us and we soon had our room. Bathroom spotless and bedroom throughout, no complaints here. Breakfast was great and something to suit everybody and quality ingredients used unlike some hotels we've stayed at. Its a shame they don't include wireless internet free of charge like other hotels we stayed in during our trip in Australia, but other than that no complaints about The Grace whatsoever. One of the receptionist staff, 'Grant' was extremely pleasant and helpful during our stay and made our trip worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Weekender”
Reviews.Author: HolidayHot
Reviews.Content: Amazing Grace was wonderful stay. Loved the style and relaxed atmosphere. Busy Mardi Gras weekend and lots of people around, still this hotel was calm and quiet, obviously still quite full. Booked the room via Last Minute (although months ago) and got really reasonable rate, still received a roomy and confortable room. Beds were like sleepin in clouds. Stinking humid weather required the airconditioner even during the night but the aircon vent was positioned so that it was not blowing straight to the bed, which made sleeping even more confortable. Did eat at this hotel, many good cafes around, only thing missing in the neighbourhood (Grace take a hint) was a quiet street level bar where talking with friends would be possible without screaming to each other. Recommend Grace to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A very lovely hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Redfish2
Reviews.Content: We booked the Grace Hotel through [--] and did because of the good reviews at trip advisor. The hotel room was large and very lovely. The bed was very comfortable. The room was modern and had every amenitie one would desire. The room was always immaculate. The location could not be better. It was a 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour and a 10 minute walk to Sidney Harbour. Pitt Street Shopping was less than 5 minutes away. We did not eat in the hotel. Our only criticism would be that the bell captains were the concierge and they didn't always have a lot of knowledge about the area. However, it is very easy to walk to restaurants in the Darling Harbour area or city center. I would give this hotel 5 stars. We enjoyed a week staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed and loved it twice!”
Reviews.Author: ornerygoat
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grace twice, once in an outward facing room, once in an inward room. The location is great, definatley request and outward facing room however. the service is excellent, the beds so devine and the room service very high quality. Both times we got a great rate from wotif. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely historic hotel with modern rooms and gym”
Reviews.Author: ThatTree
Reviews.Content: Easily accessed by Wynyard train stop or bus interchange, the Grace Hotel offers modern, comfortable accommodation in a beautifully restored historic building. We had a deluxe king room. Though with less "deluxe"-looking furnishings compared to the executive rooms shown in web site photos, our room was a great value, spacious, and cheerfully light thanks to a bay window. The bathroom is spacious with separate shower/toilet and sink/closet areas; the provided iron and ironing board were a great help. Hotel staff were gracious and reassuring, even with our too-frequent checks for delivery of luggage lost by United. Maid service, bathroom fixtures, broadband internet (not unlimited) and heating/cooling were all spot-on. The hotel also has a health club, open to guests, beautifully appointed with wood paneling and including an indoor lap pool. We didn't eat at the pretty, lobby-level Grace Cafe, but the room rate included one daily breakfast in the second-floor Brasserie. It was good, but we didn't take advantage of that every day as the *fantastic* Mecca Espresso (outside the hotel itself, but in the same building) was too good to pass up -- consistently high-quality and beautifully poured cappuccino, along with pastries. Just across York St. from the hotel is Cafe Cozy, unpretentious with yummy Asian and Italian lunches and great service. Indie music fans who stay at the Grace will be delighted to find Red Eye Records on the opposite corner from the hotel. This location (SW corner York & King Sts.) cannot be beat: heart of the CBD, but just steps from Darling Harbour attractions and Martin Place shopping. The Rocks restaurants, Circular Quay and Hyde Park are all just a short walk away. And because of the proximity of trains and buses, you can reach just about any greater Sydney neighborhood quickly. The Grace Hotel makes a perfect home base for business and tourist trips to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Graceful Grace”
Reviews.Author: lorel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Grace Hotel over the Australia Day long weekend. We booked this hotel for two nights through wotif.com just a few days before . We arrived at our hotel after a quick taxi trip from the airport. Our twin room consisted of two King Single beds which were very luxurious and comfortable. The room was quite spacious with plenty of space for our luggage, a wardrobe, a desk, and various other chairs and tables. Our room had an atrium view but perhaps if we had asked we could have had a street view. Nevertheless we found our room to be very quiet. The hotel is an elegantly restored former department store in the art deco style. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. We were given a complementary newspaper each morning. We had breakfast at the Grace Cafe downstairs on one morning. It was a pleasant enough place at which to dine. The hotel is well located close to the Queen Victoria Building and Martin Place, and we also walked from here to the Rocks area. We ventured down to the Kng St Wharf area one evening for dinner. This is in the Darling Harbour area to the right of the Aquarium. There are many bars and restaurants here to choose from and the atmosphere is quite lively in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller84
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grace for 5 days at Christmas and we were impressed by the standard of the rooms and the service. It is also in a great location slap bang between Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. It's also well situated for the main shopping streets. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual!”
Reviews.Author: Posthum
Reviews.Content: We stayed again at the Grace on our recent trip to Sydney as we had thoroughly enjoyed our stay last year. The hotel is a great 4 star hotel and as such offers a fantastic city centre location (all attractions are within walking distance) and clean comfortable rooms without 5 star prices. We booked one of their summer packages and due to a mix up we were upgraded to one of their corner suites. The room was huge (very light and bright) with fantastic windows on three sides and a seperate bath and shower This is now the third time we have stayed at the Grace and we will definately stay here again next time we are in Sydney after trying others the Grace is still our favourite. We always find the staff very courteous and their breakfasts are great.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, But not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Kramax
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Grace based on good reviews on this site. I was dismayed to see the price of the rooms $60 cheaper per night on wotif than what I paid. However, since I was promised a room upgrade due to having booked more than 3 nights, I wasn't too perturbed. On arrival I was put off by being asked if it was "just you" booking in. Well, yes, since I was the only one standing there and the booking was in my sole name, that was the case. Single women do travel alone - revelation! I was proudly told by this silly woman that I was being upgraded to the Heritage floor. I then asked her what that meant, she replied she did not know, she then smirked and said "extra things in the room...." I was baffled by this and on arriving in my 11th floor room I was as baffled as previous reviewers as to what the difference could be, since this room looked like your average 4 star hotel room. The dark furniture depressed me until I got used to it, the view is over rooftops. The air con is great. The bathroom is average, only a bath, I found it uncomfortable showering as the bath is quite narrow and it is quite a hike into the high bath, don't stay here if you are even slightly disabled and you want to take a shower, though the hotel does acknowledge this as there is a sign on the bath offering aids if one cannot get in the bath. The room service meals were awful, I didnt think I could get a bad steak for $33 but you can at the Grace. I found a lot of local bistros, so don't eat in the hotel. The ice machine was broken on my floor which was a real hassle in very hot Sydney weather. I was there a week and no attempt was made to fix it. There are only 2 cable TV stations, CNN and BBC, they should have more. You can hear the plumbing of the surrounding rooms, the hallways are very humid as the air con does not stretch to that. Each evening a lovely man dropped off a liquour chocolate and a 600 ml bottle of water, which was very nice and does not happen in any 5 star hotel I know! There is a generous range of magazines in the room. The hotel is very central to all spots in the CBD. The hotel has kept its original fittings and has some charm. All the staff (besides narrow minded receptionist) were great and helpful. I would stay there again, but not for full price. Ignore other reviews that state this hotel is the same as 5 star - it is not. But it tries hard....

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good location”
Reviews.Author: MK_Cal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe king room. It was a large 7th floor room with street view and a good size bath and very comfortable bed. Room only had one chair which meant someone had to sit on the bed and someone in a chair. I believe you are getting the size of the room for the deluxe vs standard. The hotel info states that there are additional amenities in the deluxe room but I can't imagine what those would be unless the standard room does not have shampoo!. I think a few more pictures on the hotel website plus explanation of the differences between rooms would be helpful to guests. Our only complaint was the less than helpful concierge. We found him to be border line rude and he really was not interested in helping us with our simple inquires about restaurants. We simply wanted to find out where one might find restaurants open in Sydney on Christmas or Boxing Day. We discovered the answer to our questions, later that morning by asking a cafe waitress a few blocks away. On holiday's most of the restaurants in The Rocks area are open and provide good meals with efficient and friendly service. I don't know if I would stay at the Grace again. I agree with an earlier review that $25 /day for internet connection is a bit steep. However the room was very nice and the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Andy B
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel charges, the service you get is poor. The staff are freindly, but expect to pay well over the going rates for things like internet access ($25 per day for what would be considered normal internet access- i.e. >2MB). The channel selection on TV is also poor (only ~6 channels, two of which are CNN and BBC world, the reception of which was bad). From my perspective, if I pay a hotel this much money, I expect more, and certainly do not expect to pay the hotel loads of extra money just to get what most would consider a normal service.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco Cool”
Reviews.Author: jdavies2001
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in central location near Darling Harbour and CBD. Building has a lovely art deco interior and the rooms are stylishly furnished and spacious. Breakfast was also very good. Reception and concierge staff were helpful and friendly. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: AsadShamim
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Wotif and we were delighted with our stay (6 nights). The room was huge and provided plenty of space for our 2 year old son to share. The location is superb as it is walking distance to both Darling Harbour (5 mins) and Circular Quay/Opera House (15 mins) and is one block off from the main George Street shopping thoroughfare. The hotel building is beautiful and has a lot of original features still in place (it used to be the Grace Brothers department store!) and the Grace cafe in the lobby has been recently renovated too (and serves great breakfasts!) We were very well looked after and the front desk and concierge were always helpful and friendly. The hotel provided a cot for our son and were even happy to send up warm milk for him to our room ... for free! We would definitely stay here again if we went back to Sydney. Although it is rated as 4* it is easily as comfortable as any of the 5* hotels nearby and definitely better located, and of course it's half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Graceful indeed..”
Reviews.Author: BrightonandHove
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from a fabulous 4 night stay at The Grace Hotel. Our twin room was stylish, clean and spacious with extremely comfortable king single beds. The hotel was central and convenient for everything on offer in Sydney and the staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Loveagreathotel
Reviews.Content: We stayed this hotel for a weekend stay. Good location to City and walking around although central to everything. Gentle walk to Circular Quay, Rocks, Darling Harbour. Shops very close. Your are in middle of the city. If on business and not sight seeing then recommend this hotel. If tourist - then better locations available elsewhere.Breakfast excellent, rooms spacious and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE GRACE AND PERFECT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: swirls
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location for Sydney. We could walk to the harbor, the Opera House, the Rock Area. We did not take one cab. The staff is friendly - the rooms are big and clean. The decor is to perfection. We were thrilled with our experience at the Grace!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Boris91
Reviews.Content: We had three nights at the Grace and can totally recommend it. The rooms were exactly as appears on website, bed extremely comfortable and the staff all friendly and onto it. The location is perfect for shopping and we walked everywhere - about 15 minutes to Circular Quay, 5 minutes to Darling Harbours and 2 minutes from the heart of the central shopping action. Although right in the middle of the city, rooms are well soundproofed and no disturbance from traffic noise. Concierge staff were brilliant - amazing memory for names and very helpful. Would definitely go back there

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what most of the reviewers say”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveller.This hotel is without doubt one of the best hotels I have stayed at in sydney. To be honest I was really amazed. Everything works in the room too!! Hey, this is something believe me. How many times have you got a room and the tv is broken, the cable internet modem is broken, or the airconditioning is extremely poor or doesn't heat or cool? The room is very tasteful - not some room thrown together with leftovers from another hotel. Bathroom good space and quality features. Hot water great and pressure great. The beds are undoubtedly the best I have ever slept on - even my own one at home. Seriously you don't know what its like to get off a plane and the only thing you want is sleep and you get this rock hard or stinky bed. Everything in my room was new, I didn't get the feeling that anyone else had been in it, and I wouldn't of been scared to run a UV light over the sheets... yuk - just the thought makes my stomach churn. room service great and in room menu is great as well. TV, variety of channels, quietness, airconditioning, lighting, placement of spare electrical outlets, internet access, inroom movies, staff, speed of ordering inroom food and delivery, etc.. the list goes on. Everything was great!. I highly recommend this to all business travellers. I will be staying here even though I usually work out Parramatta way. It is so much cheaper too.. you just won't realise until you go. You must at least try it. Location is the only thing down, but its still in the heart of the city, its just not on Darling habour, thats all. Not that its a long walk either, the harbour is just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JohnG8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grace for 7 days, certainly long enough to learn all the pros and cons of any hotel and more than enough time to get fed up with most. But this is a fantastic place to stay, in the heart of the CBD yet amazingly quiet (we were in a front room on the 7th floor). We were first given a rather small room, perhaps because we had checked in very early after an overnight flight; but when we asked if there was anything better we were promptly changed to a much larger one - at no extra cost even though we had booked at a user friendly rate through wotif. The staff were very friendly and efficient, the room was absolutely spotless, the bed was huge and comfortable. And the art deco exterior and lobby areas give the hotel a special feel. The room service menu was limited but the prices were reasoanble. My only complaint is that the food quality of the Neo restaurant and the ground floor cafe was very ordinary. But there's a terrific Asian lunchtime food bar on the ground floor. The Grace is tremendous value for money. If you want to stay in comfort within an easy walk of the QVB and Darling Harbour, then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, old building with modern fittings”
Reviews.Author: Kakiteano
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the old Grace Brothers department store - very elegant exterior, modern but nicely redecorated interior. Location is central - closer to Darling Harbour than to Circular Quay. Not far from QVB if shopping is the goal. I found the bed in my room extremely comfortable as far as hotel beds go, although the airconditioning seemed on the cool side in the hotel. Breakfast & lunch were good there, but I wouldn't recommend their Neo restaurant - they got my order wrong despite a quiet night (completely forgot my entree) and then the duck was too salty - they did apologise and give me a free dessert...

HotelInfo.Name: Grace Hotel Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 77 York Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
